title: Aargau Cantonal Library, AG 2.38; Full manuscript
transcription: durch die ersamen und geistlichen frowen fro Sophyen Swartzmurerin closterfrow ze Hermanschwil
translation: By the honorable and spiritual lady, Lady Sophie Swartzmurer, nun at the convent of Hermanswil.”
monastery: Hermetschwil Abbey, Cistercian, Hermetschwil-Staffeln, Switzerland

title: Admont Stiftsbibliothek, Admont Ms.292; Full manuscript
transcription:
Cum tibi verborum fructum quis colligis horum,
Hic ut aratoris vescens messorque satoris,
Ut sis scriptoris studii memor atque laboris,
Nomen et intendas te queso vicemque rependas,
Respondens horum quod origo versiculorum,
Ait fert querenti dubium dat scire volenti.
Dispicito quales sint litterule capitales
Unde cito nomen concurret tale per omen.
Sicut et a primo versu cernis in imo.
Gree d i •m iis hah s veu ras n” -0s rr es ad-vade rbua ss everas (= Chunradus)
translation:
When you, who gather the fruit of these words,
Feed here like the reaper and sower of the ploughman,
So that you may remember the diligence and work of the scribe,
I ask you, consider his name and repay him in turn.
The origin of these little verses, answering to those who ask,
Declares it to the seeker and gives knowledge to the willing.
Consider what kind of letters are capital,
From which a name will quickly appear as a sign,
Just as you see at the bottom of the first verse.
Gree d i •m iis hah s veu ras n” -0s rr es ad-vade rbua ss everas (= Chunradus)
monastery: Admont Abbey, Benedictine, Admont, Austria, 1054

title: Altenburg, Stiftsbibliothek, Ms. AB 15 B 16; Full manuscript
transcription:
f.87vb: Margaretha Preiss [swester Margareta Preissin zu Pernegk in dem kloster vnder der geharsam der erwierdigen [...] frawn vnd mueter Ludmilla priorin]
f.87vb: Diez puech von sand Katherina de Senis ist volentet warden an dem abentt des heilige11 xij poften sa11d Bartolameus in dem lxx iar [23. Aug. 1470] von swester Barbara die zeit schulmaisterin.
translation:
f.87vb: Margaretha Preiss [Sister Margaretha Preiss of Pernegg in the convent under the obedience of the venerable lady and mother Ludmilla, prioress].
f.87vb: This book of Saint Catherine of Siena was completed on the evening of the holy apostle Saint Bartholomew, in the 70th year [23rd of August, 1470], by Sister Barbara, at that time schoolmistress.”

title: Amsterdam, Universiteitsbibliotheek Amsterdam, 1 G 1; Full manuscript
transcription: Dit boec hevet ghescreven suster diewe dircx dochter bidt voer die siele", waaraan door andere hand toegevoegd "ende het hoert sinte maria magdalenen in amsterdam woenende opt spoy
translation: This book was written by Sister Dieuwe, Dirck's daughter, pray for her soul," to which another hand has added, "and it belongs to St. Mary Magdalene in Amsterdam, residing on the Spui.
monastery: Canonesses Regular of St. Mary Magdalene (Op het Spui), Amsterdam, Netherlands

title: Amsterdam, Universiteitsbibliotheek Amsterdam, I G 12; Full manuscript
transcription: Bidt vor die schrivers dattem got ewich leven geve na geeindet op sce gregorius dach int jaer van xcviii
translation: Pray for the scribes that God may grant them eternal life after finishing on the day of Saint Gregory in the year of 1398.
monastery: Convent of the Tertiaries of St Andreas & St Barbara (Maagdendries), Maastricht, Germany

title: Amsterdam, Universiteitsbibliotheek Amsterdam, XI H 16; Full manuscript
transcription: dyt boech is geeyndet int iaer ons heren xv ind ix op den sondach nae sancte peter ind paulus dach der heiliger apostelen gode zo eeren ind synre liever moder ind der alre heilichster moder sancta Anna Ind alle die gene die dys boechs gebruchen sollen gedencken Der schyrverschen myt eynen pater noster ind ave maria der heiliger moder sancte Annen zo eeren dat sy ur wil erwerven gracie ind genade in dieser tzijt ind nae deser tzijt de ewige vroude AMEN. Ur naem is suster gretgen smytz.
translation: This book is finished in the year of our Lord 1519 on the Sunday after the day of Saint Peter and Paul, the holy apostles, to honor God and His beloved mother and the most holy mother, Saint Anne. And all those who shall use this book should remember the writer with a Our Father and Hail Mary to honor the holy mother Saint Anne so that they may obtain her grace and mercy in this time and after this time, eternal joy. Amen. Her name is Sister Gretgen Smytz.

title: Amsterdam, Universiteitsbibliotheek Amsterdam, XV E 21; Full manuscript
transcription: F.lv°: cercles computistiques partant de 1400 mais avec l'indication Intjaer ons heren Mcccc ende Ixxxij (cf.Introduction p. 8). f.9: Item dit boec hoert toe Fye anssen dochter woenende tot amsterledam totten elf dus ent maechden Bidt Bidt voer di ghene die hier een arm bezorghester of gheweest heeft om gods willen Suster mouwers dochter woenende te naerden lot sancta marien int cloest
translation:
f.Iv°: Circular calculations starting from 1400 but with the indication "In the year of our Lord 1482"
f.9: This book belongs to Fye Anssen's daughter residing in Amsterdam at the Eleven Virgins. Pray for those who have been a poor caretaker or attendant here, for God's sake. Sister Mouwers' daughter residing near the lottery at St. Mary's in the convent.

title: Aosta, Biblioteca del Seminario maggiore, Ms. 265; Full manuscript
transcription: f.250v: Pries Nostre Seigneur, si vous plaîs, pour la povre seur Bernardine Dunant, qui a escript ce livre l’an de grace mille CCCC LXXXVI. Deo gracias.
translation: f.250v: “Pray to Our Lord, if you please, for the poor sister Bernardine Dunant, who wrote this book in the year of grace 1486. Thanks be to God.”

title: Archivo de la Corona d’Aragón, Cancilleria, Pergamins Seniofredo 39; Full manuscript
transcription: Signature on a charter not written in the hand of the main scribe: see Jonathan Jarrett, 'Nuns, Signatures, and Literacy in late-Carolingian Catalonia', Traditio, 74 (2019), 125-52 [https://www.cambridge.org/core/journals/traditio/article/nuns-signatures-and-literacy-in-latecarolingian-catalonia/B8B041290DAA2454521E44CEFF457CA3/share/022f0b20f668f69eb4cc3c18acfcebce01a5f1bb]

title: Arnhem, Openbare Bibliotheek, Ms.287; Full manuscript
transcription: Inden Jaer ons heren dusent cccc ende lxix is dit boec gescreven. Ende geeyndet omtrint sunte laurens mitter hant Suster Margariet blocks. Nonne toe bethanien buten Arnhem
translation: In the year of our Lord one thousand four hundred sixty-nine, this book was written. And finished around the feast of Saint Lawrence by the hand of Sister Margariet Blocks, nun at Bethany outside Arnhem.

title: Arnhem, Openbare Bibliotheek, Ms.7; Full manuscript
transcription: F.246: (Gop., en rouge:) Intjaer ons heren dusent cccc ende bcxiiij wort dit boec gheeynt te grote vastelavont. (Autre main?:) Dit boec hoert toe sinte maria magdalenen susteren te amstelredam byden bervoeten broeders woenende.
translation: f.246: In the year of our Lord one thousand four hundred fourteen, this book was finished on Great Shrove Tuesday. (Another hand?:) This book belongs to the sisters of Saint Mary Magdalene in Amsterdam, residing with the Barefoot Brothers.

title: Arras, Bibliothèque de la Ville, 742; Full manuscript
transcription: Explicit le Trespas de N. Dame. Escrit par Jeannette Greberd, le Xe jour de march an LXXI avant Pasques.
translation: Explicit The Death of Our Lady. Written by Jeannette Greberd, on the 10th day of March in the year 71 before Easter.

title: Auckland. Auckland Libraries, Med. MS G. 119; Full manuscript
transcription: Sebastienne de Cambray / Remors de mort retarde joye / Cueur en vertus dite fortune Encore
translation:
Sebastienne of Cambrai —
“Remorse for death delays joy.
‘A heart grounded in virtues,’ says Fortune, ‘endures still.’ ”

title: Augsburg, Staats- und Stadtbibliothek, 2° Ms. Aug. 160; Full manuscript
transcription: f.203v: Clara (sic) Hätzlerin.
translation: f.203v: Clara (sic) Hätzlerin.

title: Augsburg, Universitätsbibliothek, III.1.2° 12; Full manuscript
transcription: Daß buch gehörtt in daß closter zum heilligen grab prediger Ordens neben Bamberg, das hat geschriben swester Marthae Pewrlin Anno 1465 und 1466 ...
translation: That book belongs to the monastery of the Holy Sepulchre of the Dominican Order near Bamberg, written by Sister Martha Pewrlin in the years 1465 and 1466 ...
monastery:
Bamberg, Dominican convent of the Holy Sepulchre, Dominican, Bamberg, Germany, 1356-
1803

title: Augsburg, Universitätsbibliothek, III.1.2° 40; Full manuscript
transcription: Das buch der regeln ... ist außgeschriben worden am mitwoch vor der verschydung unser heylligen mutter sant Birgitten (= 19. Juli) do man zalt ... 1497 jar von Schwester Katherina Jopplin von Nurmberck ...
translation: "The book of the rules ... was transcribed on the Wednesday before the passing of our holy mother Saint Birgitta (= July 19) in the year 1497 by Sister Katherina Jopplin from Nuremberg ..."

title: Augsburg, Universitätsbibliothek, III.1.2° 8; Full manuscript
transcription: f.237rb: Dicz puch ist auSSgeschriben worden do man czalt von unsers lieben herren Jhesu Cristi gepurd M. CCCC. und in dem XXXVII jor an dem heiligen krewcz abent als ez gefunden ward in dem herbst (= 13 Sept). Pyt got fu/e/r die schreyberin die dicz puch geshcriben hat daz ir got genedig sey hie in zeyt und dort in ewigkeyt amen.
translation: f.237rb: This book was copied in the year of our dear Lord Jesus Christ 1437, on the evening of the Feast of the Holy Cross, when it was found in the autumn (September 13). Pray to God for the scribe who wrote this book, that God may be merciful to her here in time and there in eternity, amen.”
monastery: Saint Katharina, Dominican, Nuremberg, Germany, 1295

title: Augsburg, Universitätsbibliothek, III.1.8° 16; Full manuscript
transcription: f.341v: Item das puch hat S. Cecilia Rötin gezeugt und gesriben unserm covent zu sant Kathr. pitt got für sie.
translation: f.341v: Likewise, Sister Cecilia Rötin created and wrote this book for our convent of St. Catherine. Pray to God for her.”
monastery: Saint Katharina, Dominican, Nuremberg, Germany, 1295

title: Augsburg, Universitätsbibliothek, III.1.8° 3; Full manuscript
transcription: f.1r: In amore tuo langweo. Anno domini M° CCCC° XLVIIII°.
translation: f.1r: “I languish in your love. In the year of our Lord 1449.”

title: Augsburg, Universitätsbibliothek, III.1.8° 43; Full manuscript
transcription: f.148r: S. Apolonia Kastnerin.
translation: f.148r: Sister Apolonia Kastnerin.

title: Augsburg, Universitätsbibliothek, III.1.8° 44; Full manuscript
transcription: Magdalena Hermani[n] hat daz piechlin geschriben, wem es nach ir wert der LaSS ims in sunderht befolchen sein...
translation: Magdalena Hermann wrote this little book, and to whomever it will belong after her, may they especially keep it safe…

title: Augsburg, Universitätsbibliothek, III.2.8° 58; Full manuscript
transcription: f.286v: Scribe entry possibly Elisabet Sighartin, who wrote Cgm 4373 and Augsburg UB Cod. III.1.8°20 (reference Klaus Graf).

title: Aveiro, Museu de Aveiro, MAV, 21CD - PT/MA/ANTF 9; Full manuscript
transcription: Este p[roces]sional he do mosteiro de Jh[es]u daveiro screveu isabel luys freira do dito convento.
translation: This processional of the monastery of Jesus de Aveiro was written by Isabel Luys, nun of the said convent.
monastery: Convent of Jesus of Aveiro, Aveiro, Portugal

title: Aveiro, Museu de Aveiro, MAV, 22CD - PT/MA/ANTF 8; Full manuscript
transcription: Este livro processional he do mosteyro de Jh[es]u daveyro. Acabousse sexta feyra xxii dias de Junho. Era de mil. cccclxxxix. Escreveo Soror Ysabel Luys freyra do dicto convento
translation: This processional book is from the monastery of Jesus de Aveiro. It was finished on Friday, the 22nd of June, in the year 1389. It was written by Sister Ysabel Luys, nun of the said convent.
monastery: Convent of Jesus of Aveiro, Aveiro, Portugal

title: Aveiro, Museu de Aveiro, MAV, 23CD - PT/MA/ANTF 19; Full manuscript
transcription: Este p[ro]cessionaryo he do mosteyro de Jh[es]u daveyro . Acabousse descrever quinta feyra seys dias dagosto . Era de mil cccclxxxix. Screveo.
translation: This processional is from the monastery of Jesus de Aveiro. It was finished on Thursday, the 6th of August, in the year 1389. It was written by.
monastery: Convent of Jesus of Aveiro, Aveiro, Portugal

title: Aveiro, Museu de Aveiro, MAV, 24CD - PT/MA/ANTF 4; Full manuscript
transcription: Este livro p[ro]cessional he do mosteyro de Jh[es]u. Acabousse sexta feyra xviii de Setembº. Era de mil lxxxix. Screveo Isabel Luys freyra do dicto convento.
translation: This processional book is from the monastery of Jesus. It was finished on Friday, the 18th of September, in the year 1389. It was written by Isabel Luys, nun of the said convent.
monastery: Convent of Jesus of Aveiro, Aveiro, Portugal

title: Aveiro, Museu de Aveiro, MAV, 25CD - PT/MA/ANTF 39; Full manuscript
transcription: Este livro p[ro]cessional he do mosteyro de Jh[es]u. Acabousse aos xxviii de Novembº. Era de lxxxix Screveo Isabel Luys freyra do dicto convento.
translation: This processional book is from the monastery of Jesus. It was finished on the 28th of November, in the year 1389. It was written by Isabel Luys, nun of the said convent.
monastery: Convent of Jesus of Aveiro, Aveiro, Portugal

title: Aveiro, Museu de Aveiro, MAV, 26CD; Full manuscript
transcription: “Este livro p[ro]cessyonal he do moesteyro de Jh[es]u [e] escreveu a_madre p[ri]oressa dona lyanor de meneses”
translation: “This processional book is from the monastery of Jesus and was written by the abbess Dona Lyanor de Meneses.”
monastery: Convent of Jesus of Aveiro, Aveiro, Portugal

title: Aveiro, Museu de Aveiro, MAV, 32CD - PT/MA/COD 15; Full manuscript
transcription: Este liv[ro] he do Mostey[ro] de Jh[es]u da veiro acabousse de escrev[er] sabado xxii dias de Jully Era de mil . iiii . Ri . Escreveo isabel . luis . freyra do d[i]cto c[on]vēto.
translation: This book is from the Monastery of Jesus of Aveiro. It was completed on Saturday, the 22nd of July, in the year 1404. Written by Isabel Luís, nun of the said convent.
monastery: Convent of Jesus of Aveiro, Aveiro, Portugal

title: Aveiro, Museu de Aveiro, MAV, 5CD; Full manuscript
transcription: Este livro screveo e apontou a muyto virtuosa madre Maria Dathayde  prioresa deste Moesteyro de Jhesu, nosso Senhor
translation: This book was written and pointed out by the very virtuous Mother Maria Datayde, Prioress 81 of this Monastery of Jesus our Lord.
monastery: Convent of Jesus of Aveiro, Aveiro, Portugal

title: Aveiro, Museu de Aveiro, MAV, 8CD; Full manuscript
transcription: Este livro screveo e apontou a muito virtuosa madre: Maria Dathayde: prioresa  deste moesteyro de Nosso Senhor Jhesu dAveyro.
translation: “This book was written and pointed out by the very virtuous Mother Maria Datayde, Prioress of this Monastery of our Lord Jesus of Aveiro.”
monastery: Convent of Jesus of Aveiro, Aveiro, Portugal

title: Aveiro, Museu de Aveiro, MAV, 9CD; Full manuscript
transcription: “Este livro he do Mosteyro de Jhesus.  Escreueo a madre prioressa Maria datayde  ataa ho officio de Sancta Cruz de Setembro.  E acabou soror Ysabel Luys, freyra do dito  Conuento. Acabou de escrever e iluminar a  XXIX de Agosto. Era de BXXXBIII”.
translation: “This book is from the Monastery of Jesus. It was written by the Mother Prioress Maria Dathayde, at the office of Saint [Cross] of September. And it was finished by Sister Isabel Luys, nun of the said convent, who completed the writing and illumination on the 29th day of August. It was the year 1483.”
monastery: Convent of Jesus of Aveiro, Aveiro, Portugal

title: Averbode, NA, 1 (BNM); Full manuscript
transcription: achterin: "Eynt dat boeck der diffinitien vergadert int jaer ons heren .M.CCC.XVII. ende vanden paus gheconfirmeert. alle andere diffinitien weder ropen. uyten latijn in duytschen ghestelt bij vrouwe marie happarts abdisse des cloesters van meechdendael bij oplintere Anno domini xv[c] lxviii"
translation: Achterin: "This book of the definitions was compiled in the year of our Lord 1317 and confirmed by the Pope, calling back all other definitions. Translated from Latin into German by Lady Marie Happarts, abbess of the monastery of Mechelen at Oplinter, in the year of our Lord 1568."

title: Bamberg, Staatsbibliothek, Hist. 146; Full manuscript
transcription: Schl. mit roth geschriebenen Versen: Swer an disem bvch werd lesen -Der schal des gemant . wesen -Daz er gedenk dvrch got: swester -katherin · hofmenin dez ist ir not -Die daz bvch geschriben hat --Daz ir got helf avz aller nat -vnd geb ir ze lon -Die himelischen kron -Amen
translation: Whoever reads in this book shall be remembered, that he may remember God: Sister Katherine Hofmenin is in need, who has written this book — may God help her out of all trouble and give her as reward the heavenly crown. Amen.
monastery:
Saint Klara, Poor Clares, Nuremberg, Germany,-
1525

title: Bamberg, Staatsbibliothek, Hist. 147; Full manuscript
transcription: (muz dir got geben daz du alle zeit seist mit ym Amen) unn ich auch M. Wisentaverinn (Margarethe von Wiesenthan, fut abbesse des clarisses de Nuremberg jusqu'en 1403). HKOL says: f.183 Schl.: 'vnn mvz dir got geben daz du alle zeit seist mit ym Amen.' Dann mit rother Tinte umrändert: 'vnn ich auch M. wisentaverinn.'
translation: “(May God grant you that you are always with Him, Amen) and I as well, M. Wisentaverinn (Margarethe von Wiesenthan, former abbess of the Poor Clares of Nuremberg until 1403).” HKOL states: f.183, Schl.: ‘and may God grant you that you are always with Him, Amen.’ Then outlined in red ink: ‘and I as well, M. Wisentaverinn.’”
monastery:
Saint Klara, Poor Clares, Nuremberg, Germany,-
1525

title: Bamberg, Staatsbibliothek, Hist. 148; full manuscript
transcription: Auch die ez schraip mit irr hant Katherina Hofmenin ist sie genant.
translation: Also this she wrote with her hand — Katherina Hofmenin is her name.
monastery:
Saint Klara, Poor Clares, Nuremberg, Germany,-
1525

title: Bamberg, Staatsbibliothek, Hist. 152; Full manuscript
transcription: Do ich agnes sampachinn sein phlegerin was
translation: When I, Agnes Sampaich, was her caregiver.”
monastery:
Saint Klara, Poor Clares, Nuremberg, Germany,-
1525

title: Bamberg, Staatsbibliothek, Hist. 154; Full manuscript
transcription: f.162v-163 Das puch ist aussgeschriben worden, do man czalt noch unsers lieben herren Iesu xpi gepurt 1451 iar, acht tag vor sant Maria Magdalenatag. Pit den almechtigen god und...s. Katherina fu"r die schreiberin, die dise legent geschriben hat in ir. HKOL says: f.163: 'Das puch ist au ssgeschriben worden . Do man czalt noch vnsers lieben herren iesu cristi gepurt Mo. CCCCo. Vnd in dem LI. jar acht tag. Vor sant Maria . Magdalenatag.' Darunter: 'Pit den almechtigen Got Vnd . . . . sant katherina für Die schreiberin die dise legent geschriben hat in irer lieb Das der almechtig got davon gelobt werd' u. s. w. . . . 'Das werd war . Amen.'
translation: f.162v-163: This book was copied in the year of our dear Lord Jesus Christ, 1451, eight days before the feast of St. Mary Magdalene. Pray to Almighty God and St. Catherine for the scribe who wrote this legend in her love, so that Almighty God may be praised for it, etc. HKOL says: f.163: ‘This book was copied. In the year of our dear Lord Jesus Christ 1451, eight days before the feast of St. Mary Magdalene.’ Below: ‘Pray to Almighty God and St. Catherine for the scribe who wrote this legend in her love, so that Almighty God may be praised for it, etc. Let this be true. Amen.’”
monastery: Saint Katharina, Dominican, Nuremberg, Germany, 1295

title: Bamberg, Staatsbibliothek, Hist. 159; Full manuscript
transcription: f.171r: Ich swester Alheit von Streytperg han daz puch geschriben... unn ze eren den dreyn geswister ... Maria Mag. Martha. Lazarus. unn ich pit begirlich alle ... daz si mein ze gedanken. un meiner liben swester Petersn ... und swester Ma/ Rabenekerin.
translation: “I, Sister Alheit von Streytperg, have written this book… in honor of the three siblings… Mary Magdalene, Martha, and Lazarus. And I earnestly ask all… that they remember me, and my dear Sister Petersn… and Sister M[a] Rabenekerin.”
monastery:
Saint Klara, Poor Clares, Nuremberg, Germany,-
1525

title: Bamberg, Staatsbibliothek, Lit. 130; Full manuscript
transcription: A. Schl. f.84 roth 1499: 'Pitt got fur die schreiberin.'
translation: “A. Schl. f.84, red, 1499: ‘Pray to God for the scribe.’” (feminine pronoun)

title: Bamberg, Staatsbibliothek, Lit. 184; Full manuscript
transcription: f.143: Dorotteh (sic) feuchnerinn die hatt das geschriben unnd das bu"chlein das ist den klaren (?) mein freundliche grus zuuor am libe Clor (etc.) (f.143)
translation: “Doratte Feuchnerin, she wrote this, and this little book is for the Poor Clares (?), my friendly greetings to the beloved Clor (etc.) (f.143).”
monastery:
Saint Klara, Poor Clares, Nuremberg, Germany,-
1525

title: Bamberg, Staatsbibliothek, Lit. 18; Full manuscript
transcription: Presens opus cum alijs XII voluminibus incepit fr. Franciscus Mathie de observantia O.Min. sub vicario provinciali patre utique rev. Iohanne de Lindefelcz apud s. Claram in Bamberga in cenobio seu domuncula confessoris virginum atque sororum s. Clare sub abbatissa Katharina Sensenschmidin Iudoco Cutzenbach confessore bene digno cuius anima requiescat in pace. a. incarn. ... 1498 circa festum assumptionis Marie v. et feliciter determinavit manu propria prememoratus fr. Franciscus presbiterorum minimus in litera non (!) illuminatione reliigatione atque correctione sub rev. p. Iohanne Keller proviciali vicario generosa abbatissa Dorothea Marchionissa patre Frederico Gerberstorfer confessore pro tunc existente utique famoso a. salutis 1501 in vig. festi purificationis Marie immaculate virg. (etc.)
translation: “This present work, along with twelve other volumes, was begun by Brother Franciscus Mathie of the Observant branch of the Friars Minor, under the provincial vicar, the reverend Father Johannes of Lindefelcz, at St. Clare’s in Bamberg, in the small monastery or residence of the confessor of the virgins and sisters of St. Clare, under Abbess Katharina Sensenschmid, with the worthy confessor Jodocus Cutzenbach, whose soul may rest in peace. In the year of the Incarnation 1498, around the feast of the Assumption of the Virgin Mary, it was happily completed by the same Brother Franciscus, the least of priests, with his own hand. The work was not (!) illuminated, bound, or corrected under the reverend Father Johannes Keller, provincial vicar, the noble Abbess Dorothea Marchioness, and Father Frederico Gerberstorfer, the well-known confessor at that time, in the year of salvation 1501, on the eve of the feast of the Purification of the Immaculate Virgin Mary (etc.).”

title: Bamberg, Staatsbibliothek, Msc.Lit. 145; Full manuscript
transcription: 111v Schl.: uirtutumque culmina domino protegente peruenies. Dann roth: Finit regula sancti patris nostri benedicti. Anno MCCCCLXXIII Elizabet vidue. Deo gratias.
translation: f.111v: "and by the protection of the Lord, you will reach the heights of virtues." Then in red: "The rule of our holy father Benedict is finished. In the year 1473. Elizabeth, widow. Thanks be to God"

title: Bamberg, Staatsbibliothek, Msc.Lit.110; Full manuscript
transcription: f.45r: Orate pro me sorore Angnese de mülheim
translation: f.45r: “Pray for me, Sister Agnes of Mülheim.”

title: Bamberg, Staatsbibliothek, Msc.Patr. 58; Full manuscript
transcription: f.603. Die zwelft vnd leczt bredig … von der bruderlichen stroff mit den Worten: nit geschiden werden von dir Qui viuis … Amen. Roth: Aue Crux fidelis … Explicit feliciter 1492. Dann: Anno dni MCCCCXCI hat swester vrsala kollerin die XII rett des heilligen ewangeliums geschriben das der wirdig Andechtig vatter Heinricus vigilis in vnser kirchen gepredigt hat dem got genedig sey.
translation: f.603: "The twelfth and last sermon ... about brotherly correction with the words: 'not to be separated from you who lives ... Amen.' In red: 'Hail, faithful cross ... Completed happily in 1492.' Then: 'In the year of our Lord 1491, Sister Ursula Kollerin wrote the twelve sermons of the Holy Gospel that the venerable devout Father Heinricus Vigilis preached in our church, to whom may God be merciful.'"

title: Basel, Universitätsbibliothek, A N VIII 55; Full manuscript
transcription: "Disz bůch gehört Ambrosio zu der tzyt schultheisz zů Covelentz. Anno domini xv(c) unnd dry uff den dag Gregorii [= 12.3.1503] hat disz bůch geschrieben und volbracht mit allenn bůchstaben uszgemacht von Basel Dorothea schryberyn. Gott bewar ir crafft unnd synn».
translation: "This book belongs to Ambrosio, at the time the sheriff of Covelentz. In the year of our Lord 1503 on the day of Gregory [= March 12, 1503] this book was written and completed with all letters carefully written by Dorothea, scribe of Basel. May God protect her strength and effort."

title: Basel, Universitätsbibliothek, A XI 62; Full manuscript
transcription: Mementote orbate scriptricis ymmo miserrime peccatricis (f.118v)
translation: "Remember the orphaned scribe, indeed the most wretched sinner."

title: Bergamo, Biblioteca Civica Angelo Mai, MA 113; Full manuscript
transcription: f.95r: “Deo gratias. Amen. XVIII marcii. Deo gratias. Qui scripsit scribat, semper cum Domino vivat. Vivat in celis semper cum Domino felix. Ego Comina (Comina is erased and substituted with ‘domina Iacoma’ in a different but contemporary hand) scripsi istum libellum cum sua (word erased and substituted with 'mea' in same hand as made the correction above) propria manu. MCCCCLII. E ve pregi per carità che voliati pregare Dio per mi. Finito libro referamus gratia Christo.”
translation: f.95r: "Thanks be to God. Amen. 18th of March. Thanks be to God. May the one who wrote it always write, and always live with the Lord. May they live happily in heaven forever with the Lord. I, Comina (Comina is erased and substituted with ‘Lady Iacoma’ in a different but contemporary hand), wrote this little book with my own (word erased and substituted with 'my' in the same hand as made the correction above) hand. 1452. And I ask you out of charity to please pray to God for me. Having finished the book, let us give thanks to Christ."

title: Berlin, Staatl. Museen - Kupferstichkabinett, Cim. 25 (formerly Hs. 32); Full manuscript
transcription: f.131r: suster gretvogels
translation: f.131r: Sister Gretvogel

title: Berlin, Staatl. Museen - Kupferstichkabinett, Cod. 78 A 14; Full manuscript
transcription: f.109v: finitus est liber iste in die kattedra s an cti pettri p er manus sororis elisabeth warrüssin p ro fesse in cenobio s an cte katherina ord in is p re dicatoru m … 1466)
translation: “This book was completed on the Feast of the Chair of St. Peter by the hand of Sister Elisabeth Warrüssin, professed in the convent of St. Catherine of the Order of Preachers … 1466.”

title: Berlin, Staatsbibliothek, Germ. f.1040; Full manuscript
transcription: f.222: >Diß buch ist vß geschriben worden an dem nechsten doenstag na dem tag der heiligen wirdigen junckfrawen Sant Apolonia durch ein junge swester Sant Claren ordens jn Maria roßgarten zu sefflingen indem iar als man zelet von christi vnsers lieben herren geburt Tusent fünff hundert vnd ein jar ...< [Von anderer Hand darunter:] >Scriptus est liber iste per Religiosam sororem Elyzabeth minsingerin de Vlma<
translation: f.222: This book was copied on the Tuesday following the feast day of the holy and venerable virgin St. Apollonia by a young sister of the Order of St. Clare in the Maria Rosengarten convent in Söflingen, in the year 1501 after the birth of our dear Lord Christ … [In another hand below:] This book was written by the religious sister Elisabeth Minsinger of Ulm.”

title: Berlin, Staatsbibliothek, Germ. f.1041; Full manuscript
transcription: 222rb: Ich schwester ann Jaekin havn diss buoch geschriben ... vnd ward vss geschriben an dem fritag Navch dem vffart tag In dem Iar Do man zalt von cristus geburt. vierzehen hondert Iar. vnd In dem drissgosten Iar [am Rand nachgetragen: vff Sant vrbans tag]
translation: f.222rb: "I, Sister Ann Jaekin, have written this book ... and it was written out on the Friday after Ascension Day in the year counted from the birth of Christ, fourteen hundred years, and in the thirtieth year [in the margin added: on Saint Urban's day]."

title: Berlin, Staatsbibliothek, Germ. f.1157; Full manuscript
transcription: 185ra: Item das puch hat geschriben Swester Magdalena Topplerin zu nutz dem Closter zu Medingen prediger ordens Do man zalt von Cristus gepurt M cccc lxxxij Jar pit got fur ir sel
translation: f.185ra: "Item, the book was written by Sister Magdalena Topplerin for the benefit of the Monastery of Medingen of the Order of Preachers in the year counted from the birth of Christ 1482. Pray to God for her soul."

title: Berlin, Staatsbibliothek, Germ. f.1276; Full manuscript
monastery: Saint Katharina, Dominican, Nuremberg, Germany, 1295

title: Berlin, Staatsbibliothek, Germ. f.1318; Full manuscript
transcription: f.177v: Also Endet sich Das büch der hechsten myn oder der liebhabenden sel Auff S erasmus tag vnd hat Das geschriben S Apollonia kastnerin bitten gott für sy 1530 jar laus Deo
translation: “This book of The Highest Love or the Loving Soul ends on St. Erasmus’ Day, and it was written by Sister Apollonia Kastnerin. Pray to God for her. Year 1530. Praise be to God.”
monastery: Saint Katharina, Dominican, Nuremberg, Germany, 1295

title: Berlin, Staatsbibliothek, Germ. f.654; Full manuscript
transcription: Das puch hat geschriben dy barbara Gewderin vnd hub an der fasnacht an vnd vollendet es zu sant merteins tag anno domino [!] M° cccc° vnd im lx iar ... [von anderer Hand fortgesetzt:] Diße junckfraw starb im lxij jar vmb sant merthen tag vnd schiket dicz buch gen sant klarn ir mumen margreth Gruntherrin (2nd Front Flyleaf).
translation: “This book was written by Barbara Gewderin. She began it at Carnival and completed it on St. Martin’s Day in the year of our Lord 1460… [continued in another hand:] This maiden died in the year 1462 around St. Martin’s Day and sent this book to St. Clare’s to her aunt, Margreth Gruntherrin.”

title: Berlin, Staatsbibliothek, Germ. f.656; Full manuscript
transcription: ein ave Maria der schreiberin
translation: “An Ave Maria for the scribe.”

title: Berlin, Staatsbibliothek, Germ. f.660; Full manuscript
transcription: f.230v: Ein Ave Maria om gots willen vor den schryuer want hets oer vake suer geworden. >D<it boeck is geeyndet in den jaer ons heren Doe men schref xv C ende xxvj op S. Ambrosyus dach in der vasten toe viij vren Ende got hebbe daer ewich lof af >D<it Boeck heuet geschreuen Suster gertken opten koeten vor oer aelderen der oer jair getyde is op S. kiliaens hynrick opten koete ende else syn huysvrouwe ende oer kynder Ende sie en begert daer vor niet by sonder toe lesen Dan dat got daer in gelaeuet werde ende den susteren in den ketwich ynt gemeyne reventer toe gebruken Ende nummer mer wtten Conuente toe geuen Want sye heuet dat gespaert ende alle dattet gecoestet heuet betaelt ...
translation: “One Ave Maria, for God’s sake, for the scribe, as it was often difficult for her. This book is completed in the year of our Lord, when one wrote 1526, on St. Ambrose’s Day in Lent at eight in the morning, and may God be eternally praised for it. This book was written by Sister Gertken Opten Koeten for her ancestors in their yearly remembrance, particularly for St. Kilian, Henrick Opten Koete, and Else his wife, and for their children. She does not seek anything special in return other than that God be praised through it, and that it be used in the convent for common worship in the ketwich (devotional hours) of the sisters, and never given out of the convent, for she kept and paid for all its costs.”

title: Berlin, Staatsbibliothek, Germ. f.741; Full manuscript
transcription: f.333v: Disz buoch wart vsz geschriben an der hailigen junckfrowen vnd martterin sant angnesen tag in dem jar als man zalt von gottes geburt Tusent vier hundert vnd lxxxxvj jar von schwester felicitas lieberin von ulm ...
translation: f.333v: "This book was completed on the feast day of the holy virgin and martyr Saint Agnes in the year counted from the birth of God one thousand four hundred and ninety-six by Sister Felicitas Lieberin from Ulm ..."

title: Berlin, Staatsbibliothek, Germ. oct. 224; Full manuscript
transcription: f.159v: Appolonia Vo e gliny
translation: f.159v: Appolonia Voegliny

title: Berlin, Staatsbibliothek, Germ. Oct. 331; Full manuscript
transcription:
f.1r: "desen psalter hoert thoe int convent den susteren tot Sinte katarinen dael binnen hasselt gelaten van onser ierster onder moeder suster katarina vander molen zeliger ende heeften gescreven met haerre properre hant ende sal vortaen bliven geleent vander eenre onder moeder op dander nu ende vortdaen" 
f.250r: "desen souter es op sondage ghescreuen men en machs niet vercoepen mer hi sal der heileger ermer ghemeynten hoeren di niet en hebben ende dien werdelijc ende reynlijc verwaren"
translation:
f.1r: "This psalter belongs to the convent of the sisters of Saint Catherine's Valley in Hasselt, left by our first prioress Sister Catherine Vander Molen, may she rest in peace, and it was written with her own hand. It shall henceforth remain lent by one prioress to another, now and in the future."

f.250r: "This psalter was written on Sunday. It cannot be sold, but it shall belong to the holy poor community who do not have it, and it shall be kept worthy and pure."

title: Berlin, Staatsbibliothek, Germ. oct. 484; Full manuscript
Berlin, Staatsbibliothek, Germ. oct. 496; Full manuscript
transcription: f.334v: geschriben von schwester lucia krefftin
translation: f.334v: written by Sister Lucia Krefftin.”

title: Berlin, Staatsbibliothek, Germ. oct. 629; Full manuscript
transcription: f.12v: Kvlem Habstelt [Wer dicz buch hat geschri[b]en ... die ist kvlem von habstelt genant zu olspach ist sie her gesant]
translation: f.12v: Kvlem Habstelt [Whoever wrote this book … she is called Kvlem from Habstelt, sent here from Olspach].”

title: Berlin, Staatsbibliothek, Germ. Qu. 1079; Full manuscript
transcription: "Ave Maria voer die schriversche" (f.167r); "een ave Maria voer die schriversche" (f.197v).
translation:
f.167r: "Ave Maria for the scribe." (female)

f.197v: "An Ave Maria for the scribe." (female)

title: Berlin, Staatsbibliothek, Germ. Qu. 1110; Full manuscript
transcription: 437r: Bittend daz der werdi rat. die diss buch geschrieben hat (von späterer Hand am unteren Blattrand ergänzt: Soror anna iaki do priorin) Amen Anno domini M. C.C.C.C. .xxx°. Feria sexta ante diem (von einer weiteren späteren Hand unter der Zeile auf Blattrand notiert: festum) Sancti Augustini Episcopi
translation: f.437r: Praying that the worthy council, which wrote this book (added by a later hand at the bottom of the page: Sister Anna Jaki, former prioress) Amen. In the year of our Lord 1430. On the Friday before the day (noted by another later hand at the edge of the page: feast) of Saint Augustine, Bishop."

title: Berlin, Staatsbibliothek, Germ. qu. 358; Full manuscript
transcription: f.83r: S Margr Cappfin
translation: f.83: Margaretha Cappfer

title: Berlin, Staatsbibliothek, Germ. Qu. 555; Full manuscript
transcription: f.143v: finitus et completus est liber iste per me sororem girdrudyn buchel professam monialem Insule rolandi anno domini Milesimo quadragintesimo nonagesimo septimo in vigilia mathie apostoli Oretis dominu deum per me
translation: f.143v: This book was finished and completed by me, Sister Gertrud Buchel, professed nun of Insula Rolandi, in the year of our Lord 1497, on the eve of the feast of Saint Matthias the Apostle. Pray to the Lord God for me."

title: Berlin, Staatsbibliothek, Germ. qu. 834; Full manuscript
transcription: f.168v: Explicit liber iste . Secunda Ante luce Sub anno domini 1483 per me Elizabeth furnschiltin
translation: f.168v: This book is finished. Early in the morning in the year of our Lord 1483, by me, Elizabeth Furnschiltin.”

title: Besançon, bibliothèque municipale, ms. 54; Full manuscript
transcription:
19 Iulii Hemma de Huse obiit mater scriptricis. 22 Aug. Arnoldus pater eiusdem scriptricis obiit. Abbas Waltherus (f.8)
Agnesa (ibidem)
translation:
“On the 19th of July, Hemma de Huse, the mother of the scribe, passed away.
On the 22nd of August, Arnold, the father of the same scribe, passed away.
Abbot Walther (f.8)
Agnesa (in the same place).”

title: Bloomington, Indiana University, Ricketts 198; Full manuscript
transcription: f.116r: Colophon dates the completion of the manuscript to the Friday within the octave of the Visitation in 1458 [i.e. 7 July], repeating again that the translation was done from a copy in Basel in 1454.
translation: “The manuscript was completed on the Friday within the octave of the Visitation in 1458 [i.e., July 7], and it reiterates that the translation was made from a copy in Basel dated 1454.”
monastery: Saint Katharina, Dominican, Nuremberg, Germany, 1295

title: Bologna, Monastero del Corpus Domini, s.s. (2); Full manuscript
transcription:
f.107: Qui scripsit scribat, semper semper [sic] cum Domino vivat, vivat in celis semper cum Domino felix. Servorum Dei humilis soror Illuminata peccatrix; f.108: Ego soror Illuminata de Bembis de Venetia, serva Dei indigna, composui hunc librum pro veritate pura et pro veneranda beata Katerina matre nostra et pro contemplatione mea. Laus Deo
f.Iv ex libris of the Monastero del Corpus Domini, hand of Illuminata Bembo certified by the abbess Laura Beccadelli.
translation:
**f.107**:
"May whoever wrote this always live with the Lord, live happily with the Lord forever in heaven. The humble servant of God, Sister Illuminata, sinner."

**f.108**:
"I, Sister Illuminata de Bembis from Venice, unworthy servant of God, composed this book for pure truth and for the veneration of our blessed mother Catherine and for my contemplation. Praise be to God."

**f.Iv**:
"From the library of the Monastery of the Body of Christ, in the hand of Illuminata Bembo, certified by the abbess Laura Beccadelli."

title: Bologna, Monastero del Corpus Domini, s.s.; Full manuscript
transcription:
f.23v: Christus, Iesus Christus, Iesus Christus, per lo cui amore io sore Catelina del corpo de Christo in Ferara ò scrito questo breviario, exceto lo salmista e lo commune di santi e lo calendario. Christus
f.469v: Christus meus, Christus meus, Christus, pro cuius amore ego soror Chaterina explevi librum istum in monasterio sacratissimi corporis Christi, sub regula virginis preclarissimae [the letter of the second ‘a’ is uncertain] Clarae, humilis ancillae [corrected from "ancilla"] Christi et verae [corrected from "vera"] discipulae [corrected from "discipula"] et filiae [corrected from "filia"] serafici Francisci patris nostri M°CCCC°LII°, XI° die mensis iunii, in die sancti Barnabe apostoli. Laus tibi, Domine Iesu Christe, pastor bone. Amen.
translation:
**f.23v**:
"Christ, Jesus Christ, Jesus Christ, for the love of whom I, Sister Catelina of the Body of Christ in Ferrara, have written this breviary, except for the psalter, the common of saints, and the calendar. Christ."

**f.469v**:
"My Christ, my Christ, Christ, for the love of whom I, Sister Chaterina, completed this book in the monastery of the Most Holy Body of Christ, under the rule of the most illustrious virgin Clare, humble servant of Christ and true disciple and daughter of our seraphic father Francis, in the year 1452, on the 11th day of the month of June, on the feast of Saint Barnabas the Apostle. Praise to you, Lord Jesus Christ, good shepherd. Amen."

title: Bornem, Abbaye Saint-Bernard, Ms. 10; Full manuscript
translation: Saint-Benoît de Port-Valais (Abbey : Bouveret, Switzerland). Colophons de manuscrits occidentaux des origines au XVIe siècle. Vol. 2. Fribourg, Suisse, Editions universitaires, 1965. http://archive.org/details/colophonsdemanus0002sain.

title: Bornem, Abbaye Saint-Bernard, Ms.1; Full manuscript
transcription: f.182v: Anno domini m cc cliiiij. Scriptus et notatus est liber iste. finitus autem in crastino ambrosij anni m cc xl(i)v. Quaesimus qui uiderint eum orent pro scriptrice agnes et notatrice christina quae laborauerunt in eo.
translation: f.182v: In the year of our Lord 1254, this book was written and annotated. It was finished on the day after the feast of St. Ambrose in the year 1245. We ask those who see it to pray for the scribe Agnes and the annotator Christina who worked on it.

title: Boulogne-sur-Mer, Bibliothèque municipale, Ms.74 (82); Full manuscript
transcription: colophon on f.62

title: Breslau, Dombibliothek (Biblioteka Kapitulna), Ms. 46; Full manuscript
transcription: pitt durch gottes willen für swester kattherina mentellwergerin die das puch geschriben hat
translation: Pray, for God’s sake, for Sister Katherina Menttelwergerin, who has written this book.
monastery: Heiligen Kreuz (Holy Cross), Dominican, Regensburg, Germany, 1233

title: Breslau, Universitätsbibliothek, Ms.IF 508a; Full manuscript
Bruges. Library of the Grand Seminary, Ms. 197/122; Full manuscript
transcription: Desen bouc behoert toe den cloestere van sente liisbetten te sarepten bii brugghe ghescreuen bii suster katerine van der scuere donatinne gheprofest int selve conuent int iaer M Vc XXVIII ghescreuen
translation: This book belongs to the convent of Saint Elisabeth of Sarepta near Bruges, written by Sister Katerine van der Scuere, a donatess professed in this same convent, written in the year 1528
monastery: St Elisabeth of Sarepta, Bruges, Belgium

title: Brussels, Bibliothèque royale Albert Ier, 11172; Full manuscript
transcription: f.1v: "Item myn dochters Anna ende Hynryck synt beyde gevoermt ende Egbert Clants dochter nycht yde heft em beyde de voermeldoeck voergebonden" f.180v - kopiist: "Dit boeck hoert joncfrou wyert lewens to"
translation:
**f.1v**:
"Also, my daughters Anna and Henryck are both baptized, and Egbert Clant's daughter, Nycht Yde, has tied the baptismal cloth for both of them."

**f.180v** - copyist:
"This book belongs to Lady Wyert Lewens."

title: Brussels, Bibliothèque royale Albert Ier, 15055-56; Full manuscript
transcription: volscreven Int jaer ons heren M. cccc. ende lxxv op sinte maergrieten dach
translation: Completed in the year of our Lord 1475 on St. Margaret's Day.
monastery: Cloister Notre-Dame of the Rose of Jericho, Augustinian, Brussels, Belgium, 1247

title: Brussels, Bibliothèque royale Albert Ier, II 1278; Full manuscript
transcription: Ende wort volscreuen anno domini M cccc ende drientneghentich
translation: And it was fully written in the year of our Lord 1493.
monastery: Mont-Thabor, Malines/Mechlen, Belgium, 1459

title: Brussels, Bibliothèque royale Albert Ier, II 1300; Full manuscript
transcription: Int jaer ons heren mccccxlvi des goensdaechs in de sincsendaghe begannic desen boec vanden sevenden artykele voert ende hi wert volscreven op sinte peters ende paulus avent. Bidt voer haer dien heeft volscreven want si seer mate van doeghden es bleven god betert. AMEN. xvii quartenen
translation: In the year of our Lord 1446, on the Tuesday of Pentecost, I began this book on the Seven Articles, and it was completed on the eve of Saints Peter and Paul. Pray for her who has completed it, for she remained in great virtue by God's grace. AMEN. 17 quaternions.
monastery: Cloister Notre-Dame of the Rose of Jericho, Augustinian, Brussels, Belgium, 1247

title: Brussels, Bibliothèque royale Albert Ier, II 1302; Full manuscript
transcription: DIt boeck was ghescreuen ende volyndt int Jaer ons Heeren. M d xcij den xvij nouvember. Bidt om godts wille eenen Aue Maria voer suster Catherine wouters. die dit wt liefden heeft ghedaen Op dat die suete jesus tot alder vren. in synder goedertierende gratien haer wil ontfaen. Amen.
translation: This book was written and completed in the year of our Lord 1592, on the 17th of November. Pray, for the love of God, an Ave Maria for Sister Catherine Wouters, who did this out of love, so that the sweet Jesus, in his merciful graces, may receive her into all bliss. Amen.
monastery: Saint Elizabeth on Mount Zion, Brussels, Belgium, 1432

title: Brussels, Bibliothèque royale Albert Ier, II 2111; full manuscript
transcription: Dit boec hoert toe den cloester te onser vrouwen der Rosen gheplant in jherico binnen bruesele.
translation: This book belongs to the convent of Our Lady of the Roses planted in Jericho within Brussels.
monastery: Cloister Notre-Dame of the Rose of Jericho, Augustinian, Brussels, Belgium, 1247

title: Brussels, Bibliothèque royale Albert Ier, II 2432; Full manuscript
transcription: DIt boeck h[oert+eeft] [-toe] Suster Johanna Koenen ende ic hebt gescreuen en voleynt int iaer ons heren m Vc ende lxxxvi den xvi dach der maent Aprilis Ende het is gescreuen op donsagen ende heilich dagen daer om en willes toch niet vercopen Ende bidt toch om gods wil voer myn ziel getrouwelicken ende sonderlinge dier nae myn doot sal hebben want ic seer aerm van doechden ben Niet sonder godt.
translation: This book belongs to Sister Johanna Koenen, and I have written and completed it in the year of our Lord 1586, on the 16th day of the month of April. It is written on Thursdays and holy days; therefore, it should not be sold. I earnestly request, for the sake of my soul, that those who possess it after my death pray faithfully for me, as I am very poor in virtues. Not without God.

title: Brussels, Bibliothèque royale Albert Ier, II 2759; full manuscript
transcription: Anno domini M CCCC lxxv scriptus est hic liber per manum sororis katherine mast monialis professe in valle ducis orate pro ea propter deum ex caritate.
translation: In the year of our Lord 1475, this book was written by the hand of Sister Katherine Mast, professed nun in the Valley of the Duke. Pray for her for the sake of God, out of charity.
monastery:
Valduc Abbey, Cistercian, Louvain, Belgium, 1230-
1797

title: Brussels, Bibliothèque royale Albert Ier, II 298; Full manuscript
transcription: Desen boeck heeft ghescreuen suster ianne colijns in tijden die haer te goede hadde moeghen werden ende sij bidt eenen yegheliken dier sijn profijt wt doen sal om haers voer gode te ghedinckenne op dat haer ziele in rusten metten zalighen verblijden moeghe. Sij begonsten int Jaer ons heeren xvc ende vij op den xviii dach van Januario Ende hij was wt opt selue iaer inden mey op den iv dach al soe wert hij ghescreuen binnen drie maent ende xxiik daghen Deo gratias.
translation: This book was written by Sister Janne Colijns during times that might have been favorable to her, and she prays that everyone who benefits from it will remember her before God so that her soul may rest in peace with the blessed. She began writing it in the year of our Lord 1507, on the 18th day of January, and it was completed in the same year in May, on the 4th day, within three months and 22 days. Thanks be to God.
monastery: Cloister Notre-Dame of the Rose of Jericho, Augustinian, Brussels, Belgium, 1247

title: Brussels, Bibliothèque royale Albert Ier, II 3462; Full manuscript
transcription: Dit boec behoort toe int regularissen clooster van sint Elisabeth op den berch van Syon binnen Brussel by my Suster Jane van Ophem, Eenen Ave Maria om Gode voor mi en alle zielen
translation: This book belongs to the Regular Canonesses' monastery of Saint Elizabeth on the Mount of Zion in Brussels, kept by me, Sister Jane van Ophem. An Ave Maria to God for me and all souls.
monastery: Saint Elizabeth on Mount Zion, Brussels, Belgium, 1432

title: Brussels, Bibliothèque royale Albert Ier, II 651; Full manuscript
transcription: Suster lijsken tack. Anno domini M vc ende vj den yersten dach in december is dit boeck vol eynt ter eeren gods Ende tot orbaer den ghemeynen zusteren vander derden regel van Sint Franciscj binnen Antwerpen diet orbaert die gedenct om gods wil der gheender ziele diet screef wt minnen Een Aue maria.
translation: Sister Lijsken Tack. In the year of our Lord 1506, on the first day of December, this book was completed in honor of God and for the benefit of the common sisters of the Third Order of Saint Francis within Antwerp. Whoever benefits from it, remember for God's sake the soul of the one who wrote it out of love. Amen.

title: Brussels, Bibliothèque royale Albert Ier, IV 1140; Full manuscript
transcription: Desen boeck heeft gheschreue(n) Suster Johanna Matthijs Anno mv°lxv die jare(n) haerdt(er) outheit by den lxxix tot ghu(n)st sust(e)r paulijnke(n) van vossel voer dancbaerheit haers mi(n)lijcke(n) dienst. Ad laudem dei
translation: This book was written by Sister Johanna Matthijs in the year 1565, at the age of 79, as a gesture of gratitude to Sister Paulijnken van Vossel for her kind service. To the praise of God.
monastery: Our Lady of Bethany, Augustinian, Malines/Mechlen, Belgium, 1421

title: Brussels, Bibliothèque royale Albert Ier, IV 1164; Full manuscript
transcription: Claisgin van hirsfelt byn ich genant vnd hain geschreue(n) myt mynre hant dijt boich vnd \die/ edel leren ... Sa(nc)t(us) Marc(us) ewangelist vp synen dag dijt boich vs geschreue(n) is dijt beste got is der beste Dat is wair. veirzhen hündert Jair vnd xxx ... (f. 104v)
translation: Claisgin von Hirsfelt am I called, and I have written this book with my own hand and the noble teachings [it contains]… On the feast day of Saint Mark the Evangelist this book was written out. The best is God, who is the best — that is true. In the year fourteen hundred and thirty […].

title: Brussels, Bibliothèque royale Albert Ier, IV 133; Full manuscript
transcription: Int iaer ons heeren M CCCC end xxxvj. Vp den helighen Assencioens auent so was desen bouc vanden helighen leuene ons heeren vul screuen Ter heeren van gode ende van sijnder saligher moeder ende magher Maria. Ende ic bidde alle die ghone die in desen bouc sulle lesen dat si willen bidden voer die ghone die desen bouc heeft ghescreuen dat haer god gheue dat eewighe leuen in sijn soete rike AMEN.
translation: In the year of our Lord 1436, on the eve of the Holy Ascension, this book of the Holy Life of our Lord was fully written for the honor of God and his blessed mother, Virgin Mary. And I pray to all those who shall read in this book to pray for those who have written this book, that God may grant them eternal life in his sweet kingdom. Amen.

title: Brussels, Bibliothèque royale Albert Ier, IV 242; Full manuscript
transcription: Dit boexken hoort tee den clooster van sunte Gheertruden in tzhertoghen bosch. Ende suster berber hoernken heuet des sondaechs ende des heilighen daeehs gheschreuen doen si oudt was seuen en dertich iair. ende si begheert datmens niet en vercoope Ende oeck begheert si leuende ende doodt deelachtich te syn alle des goedts datter aff comt. Gheeyndt indt iair ons heren dusent .iiijC. ende lxxix
translation: This booklet belongs to the cloister of Saint Gertrude in 's-Hertogenbosch. And Sister Berber Hoernken has written it on Sundays and holy days when she was thirty-seven years old. And she desires that it not be sold. Also, she desires, both living and dead, to share in all the good that comes from it. Finished in the year of our Lord one thousand four hundred seventy-nine.
monastery: Saint Gertrude convent, s-Hertogenbosch, Netherlands

title: Brussels, Bibliothèque royale Albert Ier, IV 368; Full manuscript
transcription: Hic liber scriptus e(st) p(er) sorore(m) elisabeth schuermans. Anno d(omi)ni M v/c xx.
translation: This book was written by Sister Elisabeth Schuermans in the year of our Lord 1520.
monastery: Blijdenberg, Beguine, Mechelen/Malines, Belgium, 1253

title: Brussels, Bibliothèque royale Albert Ier, IV 402; Full manuscript
transcription: Hier ynden die sermoenen ons Eerweerdeghen paters welke ic van velen een weynich vergadert hebbe tot mijns selfs orbore ende der gheendere dier in believen sal te studeren. Ende sij waren volscreven int jaer ons heren m. cccc. ende. lxxxvi: op den xxiiii. dach in mey dat doen was des heilichs sacrament avent."
translation: Here end the sermons of our Venerable Fathers, which I have gathered a little from many for my own use and for anyone else who wishes to study them. And they were completed in the year of our Lord 1486, on the twenty-fourth day of May, which was the eve of the Holy Sacrament.
monastery: Cloister Notre-Dame of the Rose of Jericho, Augustinian, Brussels, Belgium, 1247

title: Brussels, Bibliothèque royale Albert Ier, IV 474; Full manuscript
transcription: Dit boeck is geschreuen Ter eeren gods ende sijnder gebenedider moeder ende tot lof van alle gods heilighe Ende is voleijnt bijder gracien gods Bij mij suster mariken pompen Int. iaer ons heeren doemens schref.M D XXX Vi den XIX october Bidt om gods wil voer mi Dat mij godt alle mijn sonden wil vergeuen Ende dat hij door sijn. lijden Mijn siele inder ewicheit wilt verblijden Amen Deo gracias. Deo gracias. Deo gracias.
translation: This book is written in honor of God and His blessed mother, and for the praise of all God's saints. It was completed by the grace of God by me, Sister Mariken Pompen, in the year of our Lord 1536, on the 19th of October. Pray for me, that God may forgive all my sins, and through His suffering, may He bring joy to my soul for eternity. Amen. Thanks be to God. Thanks be to God. Thanks be to God.

title: Brussels, Bibliothèque royale Albert Ier, Ms. 15141; f. 1-30, 116-122
transcription: Scriptum a.d. 1555 Een Ave Maria voer die dit heet geschreven op dat sy eewelyck met God magh leven. S. Anna van Thienen
translation: Written in the year of our Lord 1555. A Hail Mary for the one who wrote this, so that she may live eternally with God. Sister Anna of Thienen.

title: Brussels, Bibliothèque royale Albert Ier, Ms. 22012; Full manuscript
transcription: Gheen ende volschreven is dit boeckske te Brussel int iaer ons heeren MCCCCC ende Liii op den XVI dach van Appril. Bid altyt voer den schryver wt charitaten.
translation: Completed and written is this little book in Brussels, in the year of our Lord 1553, on the 16th day of April. Always pray for the scribe out of charity.

title: Brussels, Bibliothèque royale Albert Ier, Ms. 22153; Full manuscript
transcription: ad finem perduxit nomine P. Peckii infirmantis Rosa 26 oct. 1576
translation: Brought to completion in the name of P. Peckii, the sick person, by Rosa, on October 26th, 1576.

title: Brussels, Bibliothèque royale Albert Ier, Ms. 3986-89; Full manuscript
transcription: Desen bouc heeft Ghescreue Joncfrou Adriane vanden houtte Ter eeren gods ende synder lieuer Moeder Maria Tot behouf der edelder ghemeynte van vorst Anno 1577
translation: This book was written by Lady Adriane vanden Houtte to the glory of God and His dear Mother Mary for the benefit of the noble community of Vorst. In the year 1577.
monastery: Forest Abbey, Benedictine, Forest-lez-Bruxelles, Belgium

title: Brussels, Bibliothèque royale Albert Ier, Ms.10209-11; f. 1r-108v, 116r-120v
transcription: Dit boecj is gescreuen int iaer ons dusent vijf hondert ende sesentach-tentich begon te scriuen int seluer iaer. in Julius opten vijf en tuyntichsten dach [- begonne te scriuen] ende is voleynt opten achtiensten dach september int selfste iaer eende heeft gescreuen suster katherijn van eyck. ten bagarden wonede int cloester Tot behoeft der gemeynten Ende begert allt goet deellechtich te worden.
translation: This little book was written in the year of our Lord one thousand five hundred and eighty-six. It was begun in the same year, on the twenty-fifth day of July, and completed on the eighteenth day of September in that same year. It was written by Sister Katherijn van Eyck, living at the Begarden, in the convent, for the use of the community, and she desires to become a sharer in all that is good.
monastery: College of the Society of Jesus, ’s-Hertogenbosch, s-Hertogenbosch, Netherlands

title: Brussels, Bibliothèque royale Albert Ier, Ms.11156-58; f.190r-334r
transcription: DIt boec was vol screuen int iaer ons heren duysen t cccc lxviii den derden dach in iunius bi my suster lijsbet euerdeijs.
translation: This book was fully written in the year of our Lord 1468, on the third day of June, by me, Sister Lijsbet Everdeijs."

title: Brussels, Bibliothèque royale Albert Ier, Ms.11156-58; f.1r-188r
transcription: Suster Margriet Andries.
translation: Sister Margriet Andries.

title: Brussels, Bibliothèque royale Albert Ier, Ms.11173-77; Full manuscript
transcription: Dit boec was ghescreven anno m cccc lxviii opten xxiii dach van mey
translation: This book was written in the year 1468 on the twenty-third day of May.
monastery: Saint Margaret, Bergen op Zoom, Netherlands

title: Brussels, Bibliothèque royale Albert Ier, Ms.11359; f.1r-116r
transcription: Dit boecksken heeft gescreuen suster lijsken vander beke int iaer ons heeren xiiii ende xcviii. Ende sij bidt vriendelijc alle den susteren die daer gherief af selen hebben voir haer te bidden.
translation: This little book was written by Sister Lijsken vander Beke in the year of our Lord fourteen ninety-eight. And she kindly asks all the sisters who will benefit from it to pray for her.

title: Brussels, Bibliothèque royale Albert Ier, Ms.11797; f. 220r-235v
transcription: Ghescreven gheset ende volbracht metter gracien gods van enen armen sondigen mensche welcs name ic wilde dat bekent ware ende onvutdoenliken gescreven in dat boec des ewighe levens ende op dat dat gescien mach soe biddic alle den ghenen die dit of sijn uutscrift sullen sien oft horen lesen voir hem willen bidden Int Jair ons heren dusent vierhondert ende eenen vijftich als die gracie vanden gulden jare te mechelen was
translation: Written, set, and completed with the grace of God by a poor sinful person whose name I would like to be known, and indelibly written in the book of eternal life, and so that this may happen, I ask all those who will see or hear or read this or its copy to pray for them. In the year of our Lord one thousand four hundred and fifty-one, when the grace of the golden year was at Mechelen.
monastery: Saint Margaret, Bergen op Zoom, Netherlands

title: Brussels, Bibliothèque royale Albert Ier, Ms.15067; f. 1-170
transcription: Dit boec wort gheeyndet. Int Jaer ons heren M cccc ende xxij. Des woensdaech voor Sunte Victoers dach. Bidt om gods wil voor dese scrijfster. Die hoors selfs is een groot.
translation: This book is completed in the year of our Lord 1422, on the Wednesday before the feast of St. Victor. Pray for the sake of God for this scribe, who herself is a sinner.

title: Brussels, Bibliothèque royale Albert Ier, Ms.15067; f. 170-174v
transcription: Dit boec wort gheeyndet. Int Jaer ons heren M cccc ende xxij. Des woensdaech voor Sunte Victoers dach. Bidt om gods wil voor dese scrijfster. Die hoors selfs is een groot.
translation: This book is completed in the year of our Lord 1422, on the Wednesday before the feast of St. Victor. Pray for the sake of God for this scribe, who herself is a sinner.

title: Brussels, Bibliothèque royale Albert Ier, Ms.15069; f. 175r-192v
transcription: Dit boec hoert toe den cloester der roosen gheplant in jherico binnen bruesel bij sinte kathlinen.
translation: This book belongs to the cloister of the Roses Planted in Jericho within Brussels, near Saint Kathlinen.
monastery: Cloister Notre-Dame of the Rose of Jericho, Augustinian, Brussels, Belgium, 1247

title: Brussels, Bibliothèque royale Albert Ier, Ms.15071; Full manuscript
transcription: Desen boeck wert gheschreven Int Jaer ons heren .xvc .x. van Suster Johannen Colijns doen sij out was .lvi. jaer. Ende sij schincten den convente In goeder minnen van Jericho opden viijsten dach In Julio alst viel haers incomst Jubileo Int Jaer .xv.c xi. Biddende haerer armer zielen ghetrouw te sine Op dat sij mach met christo leven ten fine. Amen. Desen boeck hout inne. xxxi. quarternen. ende daer es toe ghegaen .v. boecken panpiers ende .v. blaren
translation: This book was written in the year of our Lord 1510 by Sister Johanna Colijns when she was fifty-six years old. And she donated it to the convent out of goodwill from Jericho on the eighth day of July, when her income fell on the Jubilee Year of the year 1511. Praying for her poor soul to be faithful so that she may live with Christ in the end. Amen. This book contains thirty-one quaternions and it took five reams of paper and five leaves.
monastery: Cloister Notre-Dame of the Rose of Jericho, Augustinian, Brussels, Belgium, 1247

title: Brussels, Bibliothèque royale Albert Ier, Ms.15134; Full manuscript
transcription: Dit boec behoert toe den cloester van gruenendale in zonijen gheleghen ij mijlen van bruysel.
translation: This book belongs to the Grünendale monastery located in Zonien, two miles from Brussels.
monastery: Cloister Notre-Dame of the Rose of Jericho, Augustinian, Brussels, Belgium, 1247

title: Brussels, Bibliothèque royale Albert Ier, Ms.15136; Full manuscript
transcription: INt Jaer ons heren M cccc lxxii tich. Op sinte peeters ende pauwels dach in junio. Begonste suster katherina van ghiseghem profes nonne in onsen cloester te iericho aen dit boec vanden tabernakel te scriuen. Ende sij volyndet int selue iaer iiii dage in april op sinte ambrosius dach. die viel opten sondach. Dit heeftse ter eren gods ende om gemeyn stichtinge met groeter nersticheit bearbeit in allen wtgesochten tijden als sij int gemeyn werck niet sijn en moeste. doense was out xxvi tich iaer. Bidt om die minne gods voer haer ewige salicheit. Dit boec behoert toe. den cloestere van onser lieuer vrouwen rose geplant in iericho. bynnen bruesele bi sinte katherinen. der ordenen sinte augustijns. soe wie dat vint geeft den relygiosen ioffrouwen weder om gods wille.
translation: In the year of our Lord one thousand four hundred seventy-two. On the feast day of Saints Peter and Paul in June, Sister Katherina van Ghiseghem, professed nun in our cloister at Jericho, began to write this book on the tabernacle. And she completed it in the same year, on the fourth day of April, on the feast day of Saint Ambrose, which fell on a Sunday. She did this in honor of God and for the common edification with great diligence, working on it diligently at all chosen times when she was not engaged in communal work. She was twenty-six years old at the time. Pray for her eternal salvation out of love for God. This book belongs to the cloister of Our Lady Rose-planted in Jericho, within Brussels, near Saint Catherine's, of the Augustinian order. Whoever finds it, return it to the religious ladies for the love of God.
monastery: Cloister Notre-Dame of the Rose of Jericho, Augustinian, Brussels, Belgium, 1247

title: Brussels, Bibliothèque royale Albert Ier, Ms.15139; Full manuscript
transcription: Dit boeck hoert toe te onser lieuer vrouwen der Roosen gheplant in iherico dat men heet te sinte katherinen binnen bruesele. Inden iaer ons heren. m cccc ende lxxiiii soe heeft suster lijsbeth vlieghe desen boeck volscreuen ende met groeten arbeyde op sinte symon ende iuden auont volyndet ter eeren gods ende tot stichtinghen ende salicheit alre deuoter menschen doen sij out was. li. iaer. Bidt ghetrouwelijc om die minne gods voer haer. want sij seer neerstelijc ende vlietelijc vele iaren ghearbeit heeft in vele goeder boeken te scruene.
translation: This book belongs to Our Lady of the Roses planted in Jericho, known as Saint Catherine's within Brussels. In the year of our Lord 1474, Sister Lijsbeth Vlieghe completed this book with great effort on the eve of Saint Simon and Jude, for the glory of God and for the edification and salvation of all devout people, when she was fifty-one years old. Pray faithfully for her out of love for God, as she diligently and diligently worked for many years in writing many good books.
monastery: Cloister Notre-Dame of the Rose of Jericho, Augustinian, Brussels, Belgium, 1247

title: Brussels, Bibliothèque royale Albert Ier, Ms.15156; Full manuscript
transcription:
f.284v: Hier ynt dat yerste boeck. gheheeten malogranatum. dat volscreuen wert op sinte nychasius dach. Int iaer ons heeren m cccc ende lxxxv van suster katherinen van molenbeke. als si out was xliiii iaer. dit heeft sij om die minne gods ghedaen ende tot ghemeynder stichtinghen. waer af ons heere haer loen wil sijn inder ewicheit Amen.
(2nd hand): Dit boeck hoert toe den cloester der rosen gheplant in jherico binnen bruesel bij Sinte katherinen
translation:
f.284v: Here ends the first book called "Malogranatum", completed on the day of Saint Nichasius, in the year of our Lord 1485, by Sister Katherinen van Molenbeke, when she was forty-three years old. She did this out of love for God and for the common good. May the Lord reward her for it in eternity. Amen.

(Second hand): This book belongs to the convent of the Rosary planted in Jericho within Brussels, near Saint Katherine.

title: Brussels, Bibliothèque royale Albert Ier, Ms.1678; Full manuscript
transcription: Dit boec hoert toe den cloester van Jherico binnen Bruesel bi sinte Katherinen ende het hevet ghescreven suster Lijsbeth Waelbeerts
translation: This book belongs to the convent of Jericho within Brussels near Saint Catherine's, and it was written by Sister Lijsbeth Waelbeerts.
monastery: Cloister Notre-Dame of the Rose of Jericho, Augustinian, Brussels, Belgium, 1247

title: Brussels, Bibliothèque royale Albert Ier, Ms.1683-87; Full manuscript
transcription: Desen boeck es bleven van onser eerwerdegher priorinne suster Lysbeth mols. die sij in haren tijden voer dat convent van Jherico dede scriven ter eeren gods ende sijnder ghebenedider moeder marien ende der heylegher glorioser maghet sinte katherinen harer liever patronersse
translation: This book remained from our honorable prioress Sister Lysbeth Mols, which she had written for the honor of God, His blessed mother Mary, and the holy glorious virgin Saint Catherine, her beloved patroness, during her time for the convent of Jericho."
monastery: Cloister Notre-Dame of the Rose of Jericho, Augustinian, Brussels, Belgium, 1247

title: Brussels, Bibliothèque royale Albert Ier, Ms.2086; Full manuscript
transcription: Ce breuiaire a este escript lan mil Vc lv par madame catherinne de ligne abbesse de leglise nostre dame de le thure pour ses soeurs chanosniesses de saincte Wauldrud a mons en haynnaut.
translation: This breviary was written in the year one thousand five hundred and fifty-five by Madame Catherine de Ligne, abbess of the Church of Our Lady of Le Thure, for her canoness sisters of Saint Waltrude in Mons, Hainaut.
monastery: Saint Waudru Convent, Benedictine, Mons, Belgium, 680

title: Brussels, Bibliothèque royale Albert Ier, Ms.2136; Full manuscript
transcription: Dit boec hoert toe den cloester van jericho, binnen bruesel by Sinte Katherinen. ende het hevet ghescreven Suster lijsbet van poelc
translation: This book belongs to the convent of Jericho, within Brussels, by Saint Catherine's, and it was written by Sister Lijsbet van Poelc.
monastery: Cloister Notre-Dame of the Rose of Jericho, Augustinian, Brussels, Belgium, 1247

title: Brussels, Bibliothèque royale Albert Ier, Ms.2549-50; Full manuscript
transcription: Dit boeck heeft doen scriven Gheerdrwt Ghijsbert Staden weduwe, en ghaeftet tot een ewich testament na hare doot suster Haes van Heeswijck ende suster Kathrijn van Werconden. hoer twe susteren ende ghemenen convent susteren thans woenende onder die swede binnen Utrecht. Int jaer ons heren 1442 opten paesdach den yrsten dach van april. Bidt voer Gheertrwt Staden om Gods willen Pater nr. ave Maria, voer Heinrich van Werconden, voer Ian van Heeswije, voer Ghijsbert Stade, voer Jan de Vroede.
translation: This book has been written by Gheerdrwt Ghijsbert Staden, widow, and is dedicated as an eternal testament after her death to Sister Haes van Heeswijck and Sister Kathrijn van Werconden, her two sisters and the common convent sisters, currently living under the Swedes in Utrecht. In the year of our Lord 1442, on Easter Sunday, the first day of April. Pray for Gheerdrwt Staden, for God’s sake: Our Father, Hail Mary, for Heinrich van Werconden, for Jan van Heeswijck, for Ghijsbert Staden, for Jan de Vroede.

title: Brussels, Bibliothèque royale Albert Ier, Ms.3005-08; Full manuscript
transcription: Int iaer ons here M Vc ende lij. Soe was desen boec volscre bij my Suster yda van rillaer Bidt voer my om den sueten naem gods.
translation: In the year of our Lord 1551, this book was completed by me, Sister Yda van Rillaer. Pray for me for the sweet name of God.

title: Brussels, Bibliothèque royale Albert Ier, Ms.3059; f. 91r-95v
transcription: DIt boeck heeft ghescreuen suster Lijsbeth van Elderen Jnt iaer ons heren M Vc ende xlix Ter bede van Suster Lodowijca van Brigille Donatinne gheprofessijt int clooster van sinte Elyzabeth in den berch van synay binnen Bruesel Jnt iaer ons heren M Vc xlix den xxv dach van Augustus Op sint lodowijcks dach. Laus deo in sempiternum. Om gods wil eenen aue maria voer diet ghescreuen heeft.
translation: This book was written by Sister Lijsbeth van Elderen in the year of our Lord 1549 at the request of Sister Lodowijca van Brigille, professed in the Cloister of Saint Elizabeth on Mount Sinai in Brussels. In the year of our Lord 1549, on the 25th day of August, on Saint Lodowijck's day. Praise be to God forever. An Ave Maria for the one who wrote it, for the love of God.
monastery: Saint Elizabeth on Mount Zion, Brussels, Belgium, 1432

title: Brussels, Bibliothèque royale Albert Ier, Ms.3063-64; Full manuscript
transcription: f.230v: Ad laudem domini nostri iesu christi gloriosissime virginis marie matris eius et omnium sanctorum et iste libellus finitus completus et conscriptus per me ceciliam hermans sanctimonialem ordinis beati augustini est in connuentu sanctissimi saluatoris in monte thabor prope machliniam Anno eiusdem domni. 1.5.12. die.26. May. Deo gratias. Oretis pro ea ex caritate dei.
translation: f.230v: To the praise of our Lord Jesus Christ, the most glorious Virgin Mary, His mother, and all the saints, and this little book completed and written by me, Cecilia Hermans, a nun of the Order of Saint Augustine, is in the convent of the Most Holy Savior on Mount Thabor near Mechelen. In the year of the same Lord, May 26, 1512. Thanks be to God. Pray for her out of the love of God.

title: Brussels, Bibliothèque royale Albert Ier, Ms.3401; Full manuscript
transcription: DIt boeck heeft gheschreuen suster katherijna van eyck Ende begert nae haer doot. die eerwerdige paters der societeyt Jesus. sullen hebben: Ende bidt om gods wil voor haer te willen bidden wt caritaten Dat ons lieue heer haer wil bermhertich sijn.
translation: This book was written by Sister Katherijna van Eyck. And after her death, she desires that the venerable fathers of the Society of Jesus shall have it. And she asks, out of charity, that people pray to God for her, that our dear Lord may be merciful to her.
monastery: College of the Society of Jesus, ’s-Hertogenbosch, s-Hertogenbosch, Netherlands

title: Brussels, Bibliothèque royale Albert Ier, Ms.4227-28; Full manuscript
transcription: Item Dit es den Ordinarius des cloosters. ende Abdije van vorst. ghescreuen. Anno domini. 1568. van een onweerdighe. Religieuse der seluer Abdije wijens name god bekent es... Tot behoef der cantersse der voerscreuen Abdije...
translation: This is the Ordinarius of the cloister and Abbey of Vorst, written in the year of our Lord 1568 by an unworthy religious of the same Abbey, whose name is known to God... For the use of the prioress of the aforementioned Abbey...
monastery: Forest Abbey, Benedictine, Forest-lez-Bruxelles, Belgium

title: Brussels, Bibliothèque royale Albert Ier, Ms.4287; Full manuscript
transcription: f.254v: voorlaatste schutblad verso: "Dit boeck heeft ghescreven suster Anna Joerdaens zalegher ghedachten, en het hoert toe den cloester van Jerico by Sinte Katherine"
translation: "f.254v: penultimate endpaper verso: "This book was written by Sister Anna Joerdaens, of blessed memory, and it belongs to the convent of Jericho by Saint Katherine."
monastery: Cloister Notre-Dame of the Rose of Jericho, Augustinian, Brussels, Belgium, 1247

title: Brussels, Bibliothèque royale Albert Ier, Ms.4297-98; f. 1r-230v
transcription: Dese voorscreuen xxvij sermoonen opten pater noster syn wtghescreuen by Jon c frauwe Adriane vanden houtte tot profyt ende salicheit vander heylegher ghemeynte der abdyen van vorst ende alle der gheender diese sullen lesen oft hooren lesen Jnt Jaer ons heeren xvc lxviij vollent op sinte maghiels avent des selue Jaers.
translation: These aforementioned twenty-seven sermons on the Our Father were transcribed by Sister Adriane vanden Houtte for the benefit and salvation of the holy community of the abbey of Vorst and all those who shall read or hear them read. In the year of our Lord 1568, completed on the eve of Saint Michael of the same year.
monastery: Forest Abbey, Benedictine, Forest-lez-Bruxelles, Belgium

title: Brussels, Bibliothèque royale Albert Ier, Ms.4367-68; Full manuscript
transcription: Dit boeck was volscreven Int jaer ons heren doemen screef.Dusent. vierhondert. seven ende tsestich. des sesten daeghs in septembri. op enen sondach
translation: This book was completed in the year of our Lord when it was written. Fourteen hundred and sixty-seven, on the sixth day of September, on a Sunday.
monastery: Cloister Notre-Dame of the Rose of Jericho, Augustinian, Brussels, Belgium, 1247

title: Brussels, Bibliothèque royale Albert Ier, Ms.516; Full manuscript
transcription: Anno domini. 1595. den ix mey. Te brussel int Closter van Sinte Elizabeth opden berch Sion was desen boeck volscreuen Van Suster Catherine Wouters. Eenen Aue Maria om gods wille.
translation: In the year of our Lord 1595, on the 9th of May, at Brussels, in the Cloister of Saint Elizabeth on Mount Zion, this book was completed by Sister Catherine Wouters. An Ave Maria for the love of God.
monastery: Saint Elizabeth on Mount Zion, Brussels, Belgium, 1432

title: Brussels, Bibliothèque royale Albert Ier, Ms.614; Full manuscript
transcription: Dit sermoen is ghepredict den 30 dach merte int jaer ons heere 1594 vanden eerwerdeghen pater costerius ende uut sijnen mont ghescreven van Suster Hester Malcoet religiose in ons closter van Jherico
translation: This sermon was preached on the 30th day of March in the year of our Lord 1594 by the venerable Father Costerius and transcribed from his words by Sister Hester Malcoet, religious in our monastery of Jericho.
monastery: Cloister Notre-Dame of the Rose of Jericho, Augustinian, Brussels, Belgium, 1247

title: Brussels, Bollandist Society, 487; Full manuscript
transcription: f.30v: "Dese leghende heeft ghescreven suster lijsken vlieghe bidt voer haer om gode"; f.50v: "Dit boeck heeft ghescreven Suster lijsbeth vlieghe conversinne profes Int cloester ter clusen. Bidt voer haer om gods wille"
translation:
"f.30v: "This legend was written by Sister Lijsken Vlieghe. Pray for her to God."

f.50v: "This book was written by Sister Lijsbeth Vlieghe, conversant nun in the monastery of the Clares. Pray for her for God's sake.""

title: Budapest, National Széchényi Library, Cod. Holl. 6; Full manuscript
transcription: Scriptum et explicitum est prasens orarium per me sororem Aleidim Reineri O. S. Ioh. Hieros sacre domus in pratis Werphum ob petitionem et dictionem sor. Christine Bruchters eiusfem Ord. et domus a. nostre salutis M. VI. (1486?) 5 Kal. ianuar. Illuminatum vero et rubricatum per sor. Kunnigundim eiusdem Ord. et domus a. d. ut supra 7 KL. Octob.
translation: “Written and completed is the present book of hours by me, Sister Aleidis Reineri of the Order of St. John of Jerusalem, of the sacred house in Werfen, at the request and dictation of Sister Christine Bruchters of the same order and house, in the year of our salvation 1486, 5th day before the Kalends of January (December 28). It was illuminated and rubricated by Sister Kunigunde of the same order and house, in the year as above, 7th day before the Kalends of October (September 25).”

title: Burgos, Santa María la Real de Las Huelgas, Ms. 11; Full manuscript
transcription: The colophon «Iohannes Roderici me fecit» appears on five pieces

title: Cambrai, Bibliothèque municipale, Ms.300; Full manuscript
transcription: Name "MA - DAL - BER - TA" inscribed in the initial, f.155.
translation: Name "MA - DAL - BER - TA" inscribed in the initial, f.155.

title: Capit. E 2 9; Full manuscript
transcription: D Stefina de Giussano comm. 1485

title: Chantilly, Bibliothèque et Archives du Château, Ms. 617; Full manuscript
transcription: f.28: Explicit. Per manus Bourlet.
translation: f.28: Explicit. By the hand of Bourlet.

title: Colmar, Bibliothèque des Dominicains, ms. 472; Full manuscript
transcription: Istum librum scripsit Soror Magreta Wurzerin
translation: This book was written by Sister Margreta Wurzerin.
monastery:
Unterlinden, Dominican, Colmar, France, 1232-
1789

title: Colmar, Bibliothèque des Dominicains, Ms. 717 II; Full manuscript
transcription: Ich swester Dorothea uon Kippenheim ein conuent Swester deß wirdigen loͤblichen gotzhuß Sancti Johannis baptiste in vnderlinden zuͦ Colmar hab diß buͦch vß dem latin zuͦ tútzsch geschriben got zu lob vnd och zuͦ eren Sancto Sebastiano vnd den anderen lieben heilgen die doran stond vnd ich beger bemuͤticlich dz die alle got wellen fúr mich bitten die do werden leßen an dißem buͦch Amen); das ist nicht die in VL 2 (1980) Sp. 218 genannten Dorothea von Kippenheim OP (zu ihr die biographischen Notizen von moderner Hand 325r), sondern eine gleichnamige Schwester, die Anfang des 16. Jahrhunderts im Kloster Unterlinden lebte (VL 11 [2004] Sp. 380); rote Strichel und Überschriften, Lombarden rot, z. T. mit blauem Federwerk, blau, z. T. mit rotem Federwerk.
translation: I, Sister Dorothea von Kippenheim, a convent sister of the venerable and praiseworthy house of God, Saint John the Baptist in Unterlinden near Colmar, have written this book from Latin into German for the praise of God and also in honor of Saint Sebastian and the other dear saints mentioned therein. I humbly ask that all who read this book may be willing to pray to God for me. Amen.
monastery:
Unterlinden, Dominican, Colmar, France, 1232-
1789

title: Colmar, Bibliothèque municipale, Ms. 267bis; f. 1-73v
transcription: S. Angnes wirttnerin ist disz buoch vnd hatt disz mins grosz vatters schwester geschriben angnes minsingerin von Frondeck wollehrwurttig Öptisze in dem loblichen gotzhusz zu augen.
translation: Sister Agnes Wirttnerin wrote this book, and she wrote it for my great-aunt, Agnes Minsingerin of Frondeck, a venerable abbess in the worthy house of God at Augsburg.
monastery:
Unterlinden, Dominican, Colmar, France, 1232-
1789

title: Colmar, Bibliothèque municipale, Ms. 343; Full manuscript
transcription: Bittent got fvr die schriberin Soror Elselin de Bisel
translation: Pray to God for the scribe, Sister Elselin of Bisel.
monastery:
Unterlinden, Dominican, Colmar, France, 1232-
1789

title: Cologne, Erzbischöfliche Diözesan- und Dombibliothek, 238; Full manuscript
transcription: Schreiberschluß f.272v: "Byddet got vor suster Ayllet van Lych, dye dir boch geschreuen hayt, dat sych got over sy erbarmenwylle."
translation: Colophon on f.272v: “May God reward Sister Ayllet of Lych, who had this book written, that she may obtain God’s mercy.”

title: Cologne, Erzbischöfliche Diözesan- und Dombibliothek, Ms. 63; Full manuscript
transcription:
Her name was noted on f.86v: "Gisbalda scripsit"
Her name was noted on f.174v: "Gislildis scripsit"
