Her name was noted on f.263v: "Agilberta scripsit"
translation:
"Gisbalda wrote" (on f.86v)
"Gislildis wrote" (on f.174v)
"Agilberta wrote" (on f.263v)
monastery: Chelles Abbey, Benedictine, Chelles, France, 660

title: Cologne, Erzbischöfliche Diözesan- und Dombibliothek, Ms. 65; Full manuscript
transcription:
Her name was noted on f.73v: "Adruhic scripsit"
Her name was noted on f.151v "Altildis scrip[sit]"
Her name was noted on f.224v: "Gisledrudis scrip[sit]"
Her name was noted on f.289v: "Eusebia scripsit"
One quire is missing at the end, so the last nun-scribe's name was not preserved
translation:
Her name was noted on f.73v: "Adruhic wrote"
Her name was noted on f.151v "Altildis wrote"
Her name was noted on f.224v: "Gisledrudis wrote"
Her name was noted on f.289v: "Eusebia wrote"
One quire is missing at the end, so the last nun-scribe's name was not preserved
monastery: Chelles Abbey, Benedictine, Chelles, France, 660

title: Cologne, Erzbischöfliche Diözesan- und Dombibliothek, Ms. 67; Full manuscript
transcription:
Her name was noted on f.105v: "Vera scripsit"
Her name was noted on f.183v: "Agnes scripsit"
translation:
Her name was noted on f.105v: "Vera wrote"
Her name was noted on f.183v: "Agnes wrote"
monastery: Chelles Abbey, Benedictine, Chelles, France, 660

title: Cologne, Historisches Archiv der Stadt Köln, W* 25; Full manuscript
transcription: f.129r: "Dese legende van desen heiligen tiendusent maertelaeren is begonnen ende voleindet int jaer ons heren doe men screiff M° CCCC ende LXXXVII suster Katrin van rade. Myn lieve moeder ick heb uch dese legende geschreven om dat ik wael weit dat ure liefste heiligen synt"
translation: "f.129r: "This legend of the holy ten thousand martyrs was begun and completed in the year of our Lord when one writes M° CCCC and LXXXVII, by Sister Katrin van Rade. My dear mother, I have written you this legend because I know well that your dearest saints are.""

title: Cologne, Wallraf-Richartz-Museum, Inv.-Nr. 67-71; Full manuscript
transcription: Soror Gertrudis van dem Uorst qu[a]e hunc librum scribere incepit, sed non perfectit, quia morte pr[a]euenta est. Orate pro ipsa. (inscription appears next to miniature of Schreiberin on frag. 67, as quoted in Mattick 1984 p. 296)
translation: “Sister Gertrude van dem Uorst, who began to write this book, but did not complete it, because she was prevented by death. Pray for her.”

title: Copenhagen, Kongelige Bibliotek, Gl. kgl. S. 3452 8°; Full manuscript
transcription: f.140: a.d. 1408 completus est liber iste in die Egidii abbatis scriptus per manum Cecilie de Monte humilis ancille Christi
translation: “In the year of our Lord 1408, this book was completed on the day of Saint Giles the Abbot, written by the hand of Cecilia de Monte, humble servant of Christ.”

title: Dallas, Bridwell Library, Southern Methodist University, BRMS 155; Full manuscript
transcription: last page: "Este libro se acabò a vii. dias del mes de Noviembre. año de quinientos xxiii. escriviole Mari. Dies de Oña, monja professa deste monasterio."
translation: last page: "This book was finished on the 7th day of November in the year 1523, written by Maria Dies de Oña (a nun professed within this monastery)."

title: Darmstadt, Hessische Landes- und Hochschulbibliothek, 1640; Full manuscript
transcription: f.5v: Hunc librum sancte walburge Hitda abbatissa pro se suisque
translation: “This book of Saint Walburga [was made] by Hitda the abbess for herself and for her community.”

title: Darmstadt, Hessische Landes- und Hochschulbibliothek, 1912; Full manuscript
transcription: achterin: "Item dit boec heeft ghescreven Suster Aef Heynricxdochter van Haerlem, bid voer haer om Gods willen"
translation: "In the back: "Also, this book was written by Sister Aef Heynricxdochter from Haarlem, pray for her for God's sake.""

title: Deventer, Athenaeumbibliotheek, 10 T 3 KL; Full manuscript
transcription: Dit boec heeft ghescreven ende gheeyndet suster griete des vrien op sancte Agnieten octava Anno domini M° cccc° lxvi° Och bidt voer haer propter deum
translation: This book was written and completed by Sister Griete des Vrien on the octave of Saint Agnes, in the year of our Lord 1466. Oh, pray for her, for God's sake.
monastery: Diepenveen Monastery, Regulars of St. Mary and St. Agnes, Diepenveen, Netherlands

title: Deventer, Athenaeumbibliotheek, 10 V 2 KL; Full manuscript
transcription: Sayings int iaer us gentlemen M.CCCCC and xxij on sunte claren auent. God have this praise in the ewicheit Amen. Diet reads that pray for God's sake for that poor sister who has this song.
translation: Sayings in the year of our Lord 1522 on Saint Clare's eve. God have this praise in eternity. Amen. Whoever reads this, pray for God's sake for that poor sister who possesses this book.

title: Deventer, Athenaeumbibliotheek, 101 D 13 KL; Full manuscript
transcription: f.150v: "Hier eynden die sermoenen des somers vanden hoechtiden. Ghescreven int jaer ons heren M cccc ende lj. Deo gracias.
translation: f.150 verso: "Here end the sermons of the summer for the high holy days. Written in the year of our Lord 1451. Thanks be to God."
monastery: Diepenveen Monastery, Regulars of St. Mary and St. Agnes, Diepenveen, Netherlands

title: Deventer, Athenaeumbibliotheek, 101 D 14 KL; Full manuscript
transcription: f.IIr: "Dit boeck hoert ten dyepenveen int cloester by deuenter". - Aantekening op f.219r(=221r): "Dit is dat derde stucke der sermoenen. des eerweerdigen deuoete prior van thabor gheheten brueder beernt arboestier. Ende is vol screuen m cccc liij Deo gratias".
translation:
f.II recto: "This book belongs to Diepenveen in the convent near Deventer."
Note on f.219 recto (=221 recto): "This is the third part of the sermons of the venerable and devout prior of Thabor called Brother Beern Arboestier. And it is fully written in the year 1453. Thanks be to God."
monastery: Diepenveen Monastery, Regulars of St. Mary and St. Agnes, Diepenveen, Netherlands

title: Deventer, Athenaeumbibliotheek, 101 D 4 KL; Full manuscript
transcription: f.1v: "Dit boeck hoert den susterenbynnen deuenter in Sunte vrsulen huus". - Colofon op f.178r: "Dit boeck hoert toe den susteren in sunte vrsulen huus bynnen deuenter. Een aue maria om godes wil voer die arme scriuester".
translation:
f.1 verso: "This book belongs to the sisters within Deventer in Saint Ursula's house."
Colophon on f.178 recto: "This book belongs to the sisters in Saint Ursula's house within Deventer. A Hail Mary for God's sake for the poor scribe."

title: Deventer, Athenaeumbibliotheek, 101 D 9 KL; Full manuscript
transcription: Aantekening op f.2r (rubriek): "Dit boeck hoert den susteren in sunte vrsulen huys toe deuenter inder beghinen strate". - Aantekening op f.57v (rubriek): "Dit boeck hoert den susteren in sunte vrsulen huys toe deuenter. Inder beghinen strate". - Aantekeningen op f.193r (rubriek): "Dit boeck is geeyn[sic] op die octaue van sunte laurens [is dit boeck geeyndet, doorgehaald]." en "Int iaer ons heren dusent iiii hondert l.xxiiii." en "Biddet om godes wil een. Aue maria voer die arme scriuester. [die dit scref..., doorgehaald]" en "Dit boeck hoert den susteren in sunte vrsulen huys toe deuenter inder beghinen strate". - Vormde op grond van band en inhoud waarschijnlijk een set met Deventer, SAB : 101 D 8 KL (I, 38).
translation:
Annotation on f.2 recto (rubric): "This book belongs to the sisters in Saint Ursula's house in Deventer, in the Beguine street."
Annotation on f.57 verso (rubric): "This book belongs to the sisters in Saint Ursula's house in Deventer, in the Beguine street."
Annotations on f.193 recto (rubric): "This book was finished on the octave of Saint Lawrence [this book was finished, crossed out]." and "In the year of our Lord one thousand four hundred twenty-four." and "Pray for the sake of God once. Hail Mary for the poor scribe. [who wrote this..., crossed out]" and "This book belongs to the sisters in Saint Ursula's house in Deventer, in the Beguine street."
Based on the binding and content, likely formed a set with Deventer, SAB: 101 D 8 KL (I, 38).

title: Deventer, Athenaeumbibliotheek, 101 E 11 KL; Full manuscript
transcription: f.335v: "Biddet voer diegene die dit gescreuen heeft want sie in voelen gebreken gebleuen is Een Aue Maria". - Notitie op f.Iv: "Dijt boeck hoert toe Elijzabeht Wijthagens".
translation:
f.335 verso: "Pray for the one who has written this, for she has remained in many faults. A Hail Mary."
Note on f.IV: "This book belongs to Elizabeth Wijthagens."
monastery: Diepenveen Monastery, Regulars of St. Mary and St. Agnes, Diepenveen, Netherlands

title: Deventer, Athenaeumbibliotheek, 101 E 26 KL; Full manuscript
transcription:
(f.iir): "Dit bock heeft ghescreuen suster griet essinchghes ende gheendet op des hillighen cruces dach Exaltacio Anno domini M vc xxiiij".
Note by copyist on the first original front endpaper (f.ir): "Liber"en "Liber monasterij beate marie in dyepenvenn ordinis Regularissarum sancti Augustini"
translation:
f.ii recto: "This book was written by Sister Griet Essinchghes and completed on the day of the Exaltation of the Holy Cross in the Year of our Lord 1524."
Note by the copyist on the first original front endpaper (f.i recto): "The book" and "The book of the monastery of Blessed Mary in Diepenveen, of the Order of the Most Regular Sisters of Saint Augustine."
monastery: Diepenveen Monastery, Regulars of St. Mary and St. Agnes, Diepenveen, Netherlands

title: Deventer, Athenaeumbibliotheek, 101 F 15 KL; Full manuscript
transcription: Dating based on the following: f.97r en 182r. - Aantekening op schutblad voorin, f.IIv: "Dit boeck hoert toe deuenter In sunte vrsulen huys of anders geheiten brandes huys". - Aantekening op f.97r: "Int [sic] ons heren .m.cccc.ende.lix.". - Aantekening op f.182r: "Dit boeck hoert tho den susteren van sunte vrsulen huys. Anders gheheiten brandes huys bynnen deuenter Dit is ghescreuen Int iaer ons heren M.cccclix.".
translation:
Note on the front flyleaf, f.II verso: "This book belongs to Deventer, in Saint Ursula's house or otherwise called Brandes house."
Note on f.97 recto: "In the year of our Lord 1459."
Note on f.182 recto: "This book belongs to the sisters of Saint Ursula's house. Otherwise called Brandes house within Deventer. This was written in the year of our Lord 1459."

Based on these notes, the book was written and belonged to Saint Ursula's house, also known as Brandes house, in Deventer, in the year 1459.

title: Deventer, Athenaeumbibliotheek, 101 F 16 KL; Full manuscript
transcription: Ir: "Dit boec hoert int cloester ten dyepenveen by deuenter". - Aantekening op f.242v: "Hier eyndet dat vierde stucke der sermoenen. des eerweerdigen deuoete prior van thabor. ghenoemt brueder beernt arboestier. Ende is gescreuen m cccc liiij Deo gracias Bidet vmmer voer suster adriaen mant. die dit gescreuen heeft om gods wil want si seer behoeftich is. In hoeren leuen die gracie gods, na hoerre doot sine bermherticheit.".
translation:
f.I recto: "This book belongs to the monastery at Diepenveen near Deventer."
Note on f.242 verso: "Here ends the fourth part of the sermons of the venerable and devout prior of Thabor, called Brother Beern Arboestier. And it is written in the year 1454. Thanks be to God. Pray always for Sister Adriaen Mant, who has written this for the sake of God because she is very needy. May she receive the grace of God in her life, and after her death, His mercy."
monastery: Diepenveen Monastery, Regulars of St. Mary and St. Agnes, Diepenveen, Netherlands

title: Deventer, Athenaeumbibliotheek, 101 F 17 KL; Full manuscript
transcription: Aantekeningen op f.168r: "Dit waert gescreuen int iaer ons heren. m cccc l x" en "Dit boeck hoert toe den susteren bynnen deuenter van brandes huus den eluen m megeden".
translation: Annotations on f.168 recto: "This was written in the year of our Lord 1450." and "This book belongs to the sisters within Deventer of Brandes house, commemorated on the 11th of May."

title: Deventer, Athenaeumbibliotheek, 101 F 2 KL; Full manuscript
transcription: f.121r: "Hier eyndet een stuck der bedudinghe op cantica canticorum coninc salomons. Gghescreven int jaer ons heren dusent vierhondert ende xxvi op der X[m] martalaren dach Deo laus"
translation: f.121r: "Here ends a section of the interpretation of the Song of Songs of King Solomon. Written in the year of our Lord one thousand four hundred and twenty-six, on the tenth day of the martyrs. Thanks be to God."
monastery: Diepenveen Monastery, Regulars of St. Mary and St. Agnes, Diepenveen, Netherlands

title: Deventer, Athenaeumbibliotheek, 101 F 3 KL; Full manuscript
transcription: Datering gebaseerd op colofons op f.143v en 171r, f.1-143 zijn gekopieerd in 1462, f.144-171 in 1464. - Aantekeningen op f.143v, beide in rubriek: "Dit is ghescreuen inden iaer ons heren m cccc.lxij bynnen die octaue van paesschen ist gey [doorgehaald] geyndet. Biddet om die mynne godes voer die arme scryfster die dit scref want sie in voelen gebreken bleef"en "Dit boeck hoert tot sunte vrsulen huus wilneer gheheiten kersteken brandes bynnen deuenter". - Aantekeningen op f.171r: "Dit boeck is gheeyndet bynnen die octaue van paesschen. Int iaer ons heren .m.cccc lx iiij. Biddet om godes wil voer die arme scriuester die dit screef want sie in voel gebreken bleef" en "Dit hoert te deuenter in sunte vrsulen huus inder beghinen strate".
translation:
Dating based on colophons on f.s 143 verso and 171 recto; f.s 1-143 were copied in 1462, f.s 144-171 in 1464.
Annotations on f.143 verso, both in rubric: "This was written in the year of our Lord 1462 within the octave of Easter it was finished. Pray for the love of God for the poor scribe who wrote this because she remained in many faults" and "This book belongs to Saint Ursula's house, commonly known as Kersteken Brandes, within Deventer."
Annotations on f.171 recto: "This book was finished within the octave of Easter. In the year of our Lord 1464. Pray for the sake of God for the poor scribe who wrote this because she remained in many faults" and "This belongs to Deventer in Saint Ursula's house in the Beguine street."

title: Deventer, Athenaeumbibliotheek, 101 F 5 KL; Full manuscript
transcription: 118v-119r: "Bidt omme godes willen voer mii arme sundersche die dit boec ghescreuen heeft dat si hoer bekieren moet tot onsen lieuen heren [met andere hand:] suster grete van houdaen".
translation: 118 verso - 119 recto: "Pray for the sake of God for me, poor sinner, who has written this book, that she must repent to our dear Lord. [With another hand:] Sister Grete van Houdaen."
monastery: Diepenveen Monastery, Regulars of St. Mary and St. Agnes, Diepenveen, Netherlands

title: Deventer, Athenaeumbibliotheek, 101 F 7 KL; Full manuscript
transcription: 256r: "Bidt om gods wil voer die arme dierne die dit screef.want sie in vele gebreken bleef.Een cort gebedeken" en "Ghe eindet int iaer ons heren dusent vier hondert ende lxvj".
translation: 256 recto: "Pray for God's sake for the poor servant who wrote this, because she remained in many faults. A short prayer." and "It ends in the year of our Lord one thousand four hundred and sixty-six."
monastery: Diepenveen Monastery, Regulars of St. Mary and St. Agnes, Diepenveen, Netherlands

title: Deventer, Athenaeumbibliotheek, 11 F 3 KL; Full manuscript
transcription: 66v: "Iste liber scriptus est per manus soror daye Aue maria et pertinet in scolis".
translation: 66 verso: "This book was written by the hand of Sister Daye. Hail Mary and it belongs in the schools."
monastery: Diepenveen Monastery, Regulars of St. Mary and St. Agnes, Diepenveen, Netherlands

title: Dresden, Saechsische Landesbibliothek, M 291; Full manuscript
transcription: f.334r: "Dit boeck is gheeyndet op sunte Magnus dach des avents toe vijff uren doer .s. Ghese ten broeke een nonne toe zelwert int cloester voer die devote suster Anne tyddinghes soe welt ghebruket die bidde om godes willen voer hem beyden"
translation: f.334r: "This book was completed on the eve of Saint Magnus at five o'clock by Sister Gese ten Broeke, a nun herself, in the convent, for the devout Sister Anne Tyddinghes, who desires to use it; pray for both of them for God's sake."

title: Dresden, Saechsische Landesbibliothek, M.283; Full manuscript
transcription: 30r: [ Dysß bu e chly han ich arme swo e ster Vrsul Schanfiggin v i ch allen minen minen [!] reht lieben mu e tren vnd swo e stren ze sant Katrinen ze Nu e renberg von gro u sser minn vnd tru i w geschriben han [!] , [30v] vnd beger mit ganczem herczen, das ir min alzit ernstlich vnd getrw i lich gedenkint vnd fu i r mich bittent vnd fu i r miner hertz lieben mu o ter selgen sel vnd fu i r v i nsers erwirdigen getru i wen vatter meister Hansen selgen sel. Vnd vernement ir minen to u d, ach so lo u nd v i ch min armen ellenden sel durch got getru i lich alzit beuolhen sin.]
translation: On f.30r: "This little book, I, poor Sister Ursula Schanfiggin, have written with great love and faithfulness for all my dear sisters and sisters at Saint Catherine's in Nuremberg. I beg with all my heart that you always remember me earnestly and faithfully and pray for me and for my dear departed mother's soul, and for our revered faithful father, Master Hans, who has passed away. And if you hear of my death, oh then, I commend my poor wretched soul faithfully to God."

title: Düsseldorf, Universitäts- und Landesbibliothek, B 38; Full manuscript
transcription: f.233r: Finitus et completus est liber iste per nos sorores Katterinam de Westhoven priorissam et Annam Kyttelers et Katrinam Regis. Anno Domini M° CCCC° LXXIII° circa tempus illud, quando regnavit pestis epidemii
translation: On f.233r: "This book was finished and completed by us, Sisters Katherine de Westhoven, prioress, Anna Kyttelers, and Katherine Regis, in the year of our Lord 1473, around the time when the epidemic plague reigned."

title: Düsseldorf, Universitäts- und Landesbibliothek, B 44; Full manuscript
transcription: Explicit Vita sancti Bernardi abbatis.‹ Scripta per manus sororis Elyzabeth de Strabach ordinis Cisterciensis, monialis professe in Rubo divi Georgii martiris
translation: "Here ends the Life of Saint Bernard, Abbot. Written by the hand of Sister Elizabeth of Strabach, Cistercian nun professed in the Monastery of Saint George the Martyr."

title: Eichstätt, Stiftsbibliothek St. Walburg, Cod. germ. 5; Full manuscript
transcription: f.236v: Item das puch ist voldent worden da man zalt 1400 und in dem 89. jar und hat gescrhiben Swester Margaret Zürlin und begert durch got ein Ave Maria.
translation: “Also, this book was completed in the year 1489, and it was written by Sister Margaret Zürlin. She asks, for God’s sake, for an Ave Maria.”

title: Eichstätt, Universitätsbibliothek, Ms. st 760; Full manuscript
transcription:
(228v) Darby auch gedencken schryberin dis büchlins in dem ein jetlicher mensche lere vnd
vnderwysung gnug findt alles des er begert vff welchen sinn oder wege ers will alles bewert von den
heilligen götlichen lerern besunder vnsers heilligen vnd engelschen lerers sant Thoma von Aquin vs dem
es aller meist genumen ist
translation: (228v): “Here the scribe of this little book should also be remembered. In it, every person can find enough instruction and teaching, according to whatever purpose or path they desire, all based on the teachings of the holy divine doctors, especially our holy and angelic teacher, Saint Thomas Aquinas, from whom most of the content is taken. It was written by a scribe from Reutin, in the hand of Barbara von Rottenburg, and completed on June 29, 1507

title: Einsiedeln, Stiftsbibliothek, Ms. 652; Full manuscript
transcription: f.150r: Bitten got fur die bössen schriberinen sch. Katherina von Karpfen, amen.
translation: f.150r: Pray to God for the sinful scribe Sister Katherina von Karpfen. Amen.

title: Einsiedeln, Stiftsbibliothek, Ms. 654; Full manuscript
transcription: Bitten got fu"r die bo"ssen schriberinen sch. Katherina von Karpfen, amen. (CMO) bitten got fu"r die bo"sen schriberinen sch(wester) Katharina von Karpfen, amen (SMAH V/153)
translation: Pray to God for the sinful women scribes, Sister Katherina von Karpfen. Amen.

title: Einsiedeln, Stiftsbibliothek, Ms. 657; Full manuscript
transcription: Bitt Gott für die arme Schriberin
translation: Pray to God for the poor woman scribe

title: Einsiedeln, Stiftsbibliothek, Ms. 661; Full manuscript
transcription: Diss buechle gehörtt minen in gott geliebten trüwn frommen andächtigen gaistlichen tochttren üwer unwürdigen fro Elisabett Filingerin suppriorin und fro Künigund Zumermenin von mir üwer unwürdigen emvotter zuo s. Claren in Vilingen schw. Efrosina Som (?) scripsit.
translation: “This little book belongs to my beloved in God, true, pious, and devout spiritual sisters, under the unworthy hand of Sister Elisabett Filingerin, Subprioress and Sister Küningund Zumermenin from my unworthy mother at S. Claren in Villingen, Swabia. Efrosina (?!) wrote it.”

title: Einsiedeln, Stiftsbibliothek, Ms. 671 (655); Full manuscript
transcription:
106v: Hoͤr fil vnd wenig sag / antwort nüt vf all frag / lüg scheident früntschaft fil / da man den lügen gloͮben wil. - Dis wart vs geschriben an sant johans baptisten abent do man zalt M cccc vnd xlviiij yar (1449, Juni 23) von schwester angnes foͤisinen. 1449.
164v: gedenkent min durch got schwester angnes (foͤisin zuͦ sant frennen. zürich).
translation:
"106v: Listen much and say little, answer nothing to every question, trust a lie, sever friendship greatly, where one believes the lie. - This was written on the eve of Saint John the Baptist, in the year 1449, by Sister Agnes Foͤisinen. 1449.
164v: Remember me in God's grace, Sister Agnes (Foͤisin) in Saint Frennen, Zurich."

title: Einsiedeln, Stiftsbibliothek, Ms. 752 (746); Full manuscript
transcription: 357r [Lang]): Do man zalt von der geburt unsere heren Christi 1483 an s. Silvestertag han ich Dorothe von Hof dis buoch ungeschriben und bin davor ze herbst an s. Frenentag im 1482 iar alt gesin 24 iar und ist gesin nün iar an s; Pallus bekert im 83 iar, das Jerg und ich elich zesamen kamen. Liebe überwint alle alle ding. Deo gratias. Item und do ich alt bin gesin 19 iar uf s. Verenatag, do gieng ich uf des hl. crütztag nächst darnach genden Einsideln uf ain engelwiche und Satz do den sturtz uf und let etliche weltliche claider und clainet hin, das ich yr nit me truog.
translation: 357r (Lang): "Dorothea von Hof"

title: Escorial (El), Real Biblioteca de San Lorenzo, a. I. 13; Full manuscript
transcription: f.185v: O vos omnes qui legeritis hunc codicem mementote //// clientula et exigua Leodigundie qui hunc scripsi in monasterio Bobatelle regnante Adefonso principe in era 950 quisquis pro alium oraverit semetipsum deum (domino?) commendat.
translation: “O all you who shall read this book, remember the little servant and humble one, Leodigundie, who wrote this in the monastery of Bobatelle, during the reign of Prince Alfonso, in the era 950 (1012 CE). Whoever prays for another commends himself to the Lord (or to God).”

title: Escorial (El), Real Biblioteca de San Lorenzo, e. IV. 7; Full manuscript
transcription: f.57: Explicit expliceat. Scriptrix deo gratias. Que me scribebat. Gertrudis nomen habebat.
translation: “It is finished. May it be explained. The scribe gives thanks to God. She who wrote me had the name Gertrude.”

title: Évora, Biblioteca Pública de Évora, BPE, Cód. Manizola 115; Full manuscript
transcription: Domino uiuo et uº u lego. Qui perfecit hoc opus non ego. Gratias sint pro eu rogo. Este liuro he do mosteiro de jhesu. E escreveu Isabel Luys. Freira do dito conuentu. Acabouse descrever fferia Vª. xv. dias de fevereiro. Era do nacimento do nosso senhor ihesu christo. De mil. iiiicentos. lxxxj:. Sit nomem domini benedictum in secula.
translation: “=To the living Lord and I, who bequeath this. He who completed this work, not I. Thanks be to Him, I ask. This book belongs to the monastery of Jesus. It was written by Isabel Luys, a nun of the said convent. It was finished being written on the fifth feria, the 15th day of February, in the era of the birth of our Lord Jesus Christ, 1381. Blessed be the name of the Lord forever.
monastery: Convent of Jesus of Aveiro, Aveiro, Portugal

title: Faro, Biblioteca Municipal de Faro, Ms. 03347; Full manuscript
transcription: flyleaf

title: Florence, Archivio di Stato, Monastero di Santa Brigida detto del Paradiso 78; Full manuscript
transcription: Possession note by copyist inside front cover: Suor Maria Matilde Chiavacci, Monaco del Paradiso chi lo accatta lo renda
translation: Possession note by copyist inside front cover: "Suor Maria Matilde Chiavacci, Monaco del Paradiso chi lo accatta lo renda."
monastery: Santa Brigida del Paradiso, Brigittine, Florence, Italy

title: Florence, Biblioteca Medicea Laurenziana, 7 sin 9 (F Minoru conv. Flor.); Full manuscript
transcription: Vivat in caelis cum xpo Ventura fidelis. Deo gratias. Amen. Qui scripsit hunc librum collocetur in paradisum.
translation: “May Ventura, the faithful, live in heaven with Christ. Thanks be to God. Amen. Whoever wrote this book may be placed in paradise.”

title: Florence, Biblioteca Medicea Laurenziana, Acquisti e doni 10; Full manuscript
transcription: f.138vA (same hand as text) Questo libro è delle monache di Sancta Maria a Monte Celi fuori della porta a Sancto Piero Gattolini
translation: f.138vA (same hand as text): "This book belongs to the nuns of Santa Maria a Monte Celi outside the gate at San Pietro Gattolini."

title: Florence, Biblioteca Medicea Laurenziana, Acquisti e doni 12; Full manuscript
transcription: f.208v (in red, same hand as text) Questo libro è delle monache di Monte Celi fuori della porta a Sam Piero Ghattholi.
translation: f.208v (in red, same hand as text): "This book belongs to the nuns of Monte Celi outside the gate at San Pietro Gattolini."

title: Florence, Biblioteca Medicea Laurenziana, Acquisti e doni 85; Full manuscript
transcription: f.1rB-vA in hand of Raffaella: “Al nome di messer (Yesu) (Christo) [then ‘ella’ crossed out] e della gloriosa vergine Maria, madre di Dio, e di messere sancto Giovanni Batista, nel dì della cui conceptione questo libro s’ è incominciato, addì XXIIII di settembre 1488” f.72rB, in red: “Questo libro è delle monache del Paradiso, copiato da me suora Raffaella con assai mia faticha (et) disagii. Et è l’ottavo ch’io ò copiato, tutti a spirituale consolatione delle mie in (Christo) sorelle (et) non credo copiarne più eccetto la Corona de’monaci, la quale ò cominciato ‘n altro volume. E sse la lettera è rusticha l’auctore e lle parole son degni, et in però sia riguardato”; f.99rA: “Amen. Finito è a dì 23 di giugno 1496”
translation:
f.1rB-vA in hand of Raffaella: "In the name of Lord (Jesus) (Christ) [then 'ella' crossed out] and of the glorious Virgin Mary, mother of God, and of Lord Saint John the Baptist, on the day of whose conception this book was begun, the 24th day of September 1488."

f.72rB, in red: "This book belongs to the nuns of the Paradiso, copied by me Sister Raffaella with much effort and hardship. And it is the eighth that I have copied, all for the spiritual consolation of my sisters in (Christ), and I do not believe I will copy more except for the Corona of the monks, which I have started in another volume. And if the letter is rustic, the author and the words are worthy, and therefore it should be regarded."

f.99rA: "Amen. Finished on the 23rd day of June 1496"
monastery: Santa Brigida del Paradiso, Brigittine, Florence, Italy

title: Florence, Biblioteca Medicea Laurenziana, Conv. Soppr. 235; Full manuscript
transcription: f.142vb Colophon in alternating black and red ink) in hand of nun-scribe Piera: “(red) Petra soror, claro (black) Medicorum sanguine nata, (red) hoc sacrum virtutis (black) opus transcripsit, habendum (red) virginibus sancto viride (black) cognomine dictis. (red) Librum hunc transcripsit Petra Bivigliani de Medicis, (black) una ex sororibus in monasterio Sancti Iohannis Gualberti et Beate Verdiane Deo devotissime servientibus (red) ordinis Vallis Umbrosae”
translation:
f.142vb (Colophon in alternating black and red ink) in the hand of the nun-scribe Piera:
(red) "Petra, sister, born of the illustrious blood of the Medici,
(black) transcribed this sacred work of virtue,
(red) to be held by the virgins named with the holy green name.
(black) Petra Bivigliani de Medicis transcribed this book,
(red) one of the sisters in the monastery of Saint John Gualbert and Saint Veridiana,
(black) serving God most devotedly,
(red) of the Vallombrosan order."

title: Florence, Biblioteca Medicea Laurenziana, Conv.Sopp. 90; Full manuscript
transcription: f.427r: “Hoc Brevarium inceptium? et expletum fuit a me Domina Angela domini Antoni de Rabatti, filia monasterii Sancti Ambrogii de Florentia, digno moniale. De ordinis Sancto Benedicto, sub anno domini MCCCCCXVIII. Scripsit per manum Domina Constantia moniale decto monasterii. Deo gratias.”
translation: f.427r: "This Breviary was begun and completed by me, Lady Angela, daughter of Lord Antonio de Rabatti, a worthy nun of the monastery of Saint Ambrose of Florence, of the Order of Saint Benedict, in the year of our Lord 1418. Written by the hand of Lady Constance, a nun of the said monastery. Thanks be to God."

title: Florence, Biblioteca Medicea Laurenziana, Conv.Soppr.353; Full manuscript
transcription: f.150 hand of Suor Cleofe (in red): “Finito il libro sexto (et) ultimo di beato Effrem diacono. Finito a dì 3 di marto [sic] 1481, il quale è delle monache del Paradiso. Qui scripsit scribat (et) semper cum Domino vivat. Amen.”
translation: f.150 hand of Sister Cleofe (in red): "Finished the sixth and final book of Blessed Ephrem the Deacon. Finished on the 3rd of March 1481, which belongs to the nuns of the Paradiso. Let whoever writes hereafter write, and may they always live with the Lord. Amen."
monastery: Santa Brigida del Paradiso, Brigittine, Florence, Italy

title: Florence, Biblioteca Medicea Laurenziana, Conv.Soppr.466; Full manuscript
transcription: Possession note and note from scribe Cleofe f.179vA: “Questo libro è delle monache (et) convento del Paradiso, chi llo achatta lo riguardi (et) rendalo in fra sei mesi l’arà tenuto, (et) dicha una Ave Maria per l’anima di chi s’è affatichata scrivendolo. Deo gratias.” Colophon with date on f.120rA same hand of Cleofe: “Finito il libro a laude di (Yesu) (Christo) a dì cinque di giugno mille quatrocento ottanta cinque. Deo gratias.”
translation: Possession note and note from scribe Cleofe f.179vA: "This book belongs to the nuns and convent of the Paradiso; whoever buys it should keep it for six months, and say an Ave Maria for the soul of the one who labored to write it. Thanks be to God." Colophon with date on f.120rA, same hand as Cleofe: "Finished the book in praise of Jesus Christ on the fifth of June, fourteen hundred and eighty-five. Thanks be to God."
monastery: Santa Brigida del Paradiso, Brigittine, Florence, Italy

title: Florence, Biblioteca Medicea Laurenziana, Conv.Soppr.469; Full manuscript
transcription: f.197rA: “Questo libro è del Convento delle monache del Paradiso, presso a fFirençe. Finissi addì 25 di gennaio 1545. Scripto per mano di suora Cicilia da Diacceto.”
translation: f.197rA: "This book belongs to the Convent of the nuns of Paradiso, near Florence. Finished on the 25th of January 1545. Written by the hand of Sister Cicilia from Diacceto."
monastery: Santa Brigida del Paradiso, Brigittine, Florence, Italy

title: Florence, Biblioteca Moreniana, Moreni 219; Full manuscript
transcription:
f.191r in red:“Finis. Finisce el libro della vita del beato Ieronimo e sua compagni scritto per me peccatrice suora Petronilla Nelli; prieghovi lettori devoti oriate pro me” 
“Questo libro è del monasterio di Santa Caterina da Siena di Firenze e possiedelo Suora Plautilla Nelli monaca del detto monasterio, sorella della sopra detta suora Petronilla et dipintora, et prego tutte quelle persone a chi verrà alle mane glelo rimandino perchè lo tiene molto caro per la pretiosità del libro et per memoria della sua sorella la quale è passata a miglior vita”
translation:
f.191r in red: "End. This is the end of the book about the life of the blessed Jerome and his companions, written by me, the sinner Sister Petronilla Nelli. I ask you, devout readers, to pray for me."

"This book belongs to the monastery of Santa Caterina da Siena in Florence and is owned by Sister Plautilla Nelli, nun of the said monastery, sister of the aforementioned Sister Petronilla and a painter. I ask all those to whom it comes into their hands to return it, as it is very dear to her for the preciousness of the book and in memory of her sister who has passed away."

title: Florence, Biblioteca Nazionale Centrale di Firenzi, Banco Rari 322; Full manuscript
transcription: f.178r: “Explicit liber iste anno Domini MoCCCCoLXXoVIIIo die XXVIIo novembris in monasterio Muratarum de Florentia ordinis sancti Benedicti.”
translation: f.178 recto: "This book ends in the year of our Lord 1478, on the 27th day of November, in the monastery of Murate in Florence, of the order of Saint Benedict."

title: Florence, Biblioteca Nazionale Centrale di Firenzi, Conv.Soppr.B.IV.1503; Full manuscript
transcription: “Lui si degni intercedere per me peccatrice suora Cleophe. A llaude (et) onore del quale ò scripto questo divino libro del Dialogo. Amen.”
translation: "May he deign to intercede for me, sinful sister Cleofe. To the praise and honor of whom I have written this divine book of the Dialogue. Amen"
monastery: Santa Brigida del Paradiso, Brigittine, Florence, Italy

title: Florence, Biblioteca Nazionale Centrale di Firenzi, Conv.soppr.C.IV.1437; Full manuscript
transcription: 168vB: “Finito le hepistole del seguente libro. Le quale à scripte una suora indegniamente monacha nel monastero del Paradiso. Et furno copiute a dì 15 di maggio 1532. Ad honore (et) laude di Dio. Deo gratias” c. 174rB: “Questo libro è del monastero (et) convento del Paradiso, fuori della porta di Sancto Niccholò, fuori di Firençe 1o miglio. Laus Deo.”
translation:
f.168 verso (back): "Having finished the epistles of the following book. Which a unworthy nun-monk in the Monastery of Paradiso wrote. And they were completed on the 15th of May 1532. To the honor and praise of God. Thanks be to God."

f.174 recto (back): "This book belongs to the Monastery and Convent of Paradiso, outside the gate of Saint Nicholas, outside Florence, 1 mile away. Praise be to God."
monastery: Santa Brigida del Paradiso, Brigittine, Florence, Italy

title: Florence, Biblioteca Nazionale Centrale di Firenzi, Conv.Soppr.C.V.1489; Full manuscript
transcription: .119vA after explicit, written in the hand of Suor Raffaella, “Qui finisce il libro intitulato il Giardino dell’oratione. Et detto libro fu finito di scrivere a dì ventiotto di março (et) fu la quarta domenica della quaresima (et) ss’è il dì del nostro perdono, correndo gli anni del nostro signiore (Iesu) Cristo mille quartrocento ottanta quatro. Questo libro è del convento de’ frati (et) monache del monasterio di sancta Brigida detto il Paradiso, di presso a fFirençe. Deo gratias. Amen. Finis.”
translation: f.119 verso (front): After the explicit, written in the hand of Sister Raffaella: "Here ends the book entitled Il Giardino dell'oratione. And said book was finished being written on the 28th day of March, and it was the fourth Sunday of Lent, and it is the day of our forgiveness, in the year of our Lord Jesus Christ 1484. This book belongs to the convent of the friars and nuns of the monastery of Saint Bridget, called Paradiso, near Florence. Thanks be to God. Amen. End."
monastery: Santa Brigida del Paradiso, Brigittine, Florence, Italy

title: Florence, Biblioteca Nazionale Centrale di Firenzi, Conv.Soppr.D.I.1326; Full manuscript
transcription: colophon but no scribal signature - attribution to Raffaella’s hand by Miriello; f.121rA: “Questo libro è delle monache (et) convento del Paradiso, scripto per mano d’una di quelle nel M. CCCC LXX9”
translation: f.121 recto (front): "This book belongs to the nuns and convent of Paradiso, written by the hand of one of them in the year 1479."
monastery: Santa Brigida del Paradiso, Brigittine, Florence, Italy

title: Florence, Biblioteca Nazionale Centrale di Firenzi, Conv.soppr.D.I.1631; Full manuscript
transcription: added at end of first text by Enrico Susone on f.106rB in hand of suor Cleofe (attribution by Miriello) (in red): Qui finisce il libro el quale è chiamato Oriuolo della sapientia. Cominciossi a scrive [sic] nel m cccc octanta octo (et) finissi [followed by same hand, ink of a different red, clearly added at the end of the copying] nel mille cccc octanta nove
translation: added at end of first text by Enrico Susone on f.106rB in hand of Suor Cleofe (as attributed by Miriello) (in red): "Here ends the book which is called the Dial of Wisdom. It began to be written in 1488 and finished in 1489."
monastery: Santa Brigida del Paradiso, Brigittine, Florence, Italy

title: Florence, Biblioteca Nazionale Centrale di Firenzi, Conv.soppr.D.II.1434; Full manuscript
transcription: f.69r: ""Finito il lobro [sic] sesto (et) ultimo di beato Efren diacono addì primo d’aprile, il quale è delle monache del Paradiso. Qui scrisit scribatta [sic] (et) seper [sic] cum domino vivat. Amen"
translation: f.69r: "Finished the sixth (and) last book of Blessed Ephrem the Deacon on the first of April, which belongs to the nuns of Paradiso. May whoever writes (it) write, and may (they) always live with the Lord. Amen."
monastery: Santa Brigida del Paradiso, Brigittine, Florence, Italy

title: Florence, Biblioteca Nazionale Centrale di Firenzi, Conv.soppr.D.II.1527; Full manuscript
transcription: f.105vB: Finito è questo libro a ore dua, la sera di sancto Tomaso, veschovo di Contrubia, nel 1547. (festival of Saint Thomas is 5 May) Possession note f.106vB: Questo libro è del monastero del Paradiso fuori della Porta di Sancto Niccholò, di suor Maria Maddalena (et) di poi di suor Gostança. Laus Deo
translation: f.105vB: "This book was finished at the second hour, in the evening of Saint Thomas, Bishop of Contrubia, in 1547. (festival of Saint Thomas is 5 May) Possession note f.106vB: This book belongs to the monastery of Paradiso outside the Gate of Saint Nicholas, (formerly) of Sister Maria Maddalena and then of Sister Gostança. Praise to God."
monastery: Santa Brigida del Paradiso, Brigittine, Florence, Italy

title: Florence, Biblioteca Nazionale Centrale di Firenzi, Conv.Soppr.D.VII. 344; Full manuscript
transcription: f.203v: "Finito libro isto. Laus et gloria sit domino Iesu Christo. Iesus. Ego soror Angela indigna serva domini nostri Iesu Christi scripsi manu propria hoc collectarium. Deus sit laudatus et pro me deprecatus. Qui scripsit scribat semper cum domino vivat. Vivat in Coelis semper cum domino felix. Facta fine pia benedicat virgo maria."
translation: f.203v: "This book is finished. Praise and glory to our Lord Jesus Christ. Jesus. I, Sister Angela, unworthy servant of our Lord Jesus Christ, wrote this breviary with my own hand. May God be praised and prayed for me."
monastery: San Jacopo di Ripoli, Florence, Italy

title: Florence, Biblioteca Nazionale Centrale di Firenzi, Conv.soppr.E.I.1323; Full manuscript
transcription:
f.168vB, in hand of Cleofe: “Explicit la espositione di sancto Bernardo sopra la Cantica canticorum di Salamone, scripta per me suor Cleophe, moniali Paradisi. Finissi di scrivere a dì 5 di settenbre et negli anni della salute della incarnatione del nostro signiore (Yesu) (Christo) M.CCCCC I. A gloria (et) onore di (Yesu) (Christo) sposo della sancta madre Eclesia. Referamus gratia Christi. Amen.”
f.170rB, also in hand of Cleofe: “Questo libro si è delle monache del Paradiso.”
translation:
f.168vB, in hand of Cleofe: "Here ends the exposition of Saint Bernard on the Song of Songs of Solomon, written by me, Sister Cleophe, nun of the Paradiso monastery. Finished writing on the 5th of September and in the year of the incarnation of our Lord Jesus Christ M.CCCCC I. To the glory and honor of Jesus Christ, spouse of the holy mother Church. Let us give thanks to Christ. Amen.”

f.170rB, also in hand of Cleofe: “This book belongs to the nuns of the Paradiso monastery.”
monastery: Santa Brigida del Paradiso, Brigittine, Florence, Italy

title: Florence, Biblioteca Nazionale Centrale di Firenzi, Conv.Soppr.E.I.1324; Full manuscript
transcription: f.190vB in hand of Raffaella: “Questo libro è delle monache (et) convento del monasterio del Paradiso. Scripto negl’anni del Signore 1480 a dì 12 di febbraio. Orate pro me” (this is s.f.date – so = 1481)
translation: f.190vB in the hand of Raffaella: "This book belongs to the nuns and convent of the Paradiso monastery. Written in the year of our Lord 1480 on the 12th of February. Pray for me."
monastery: Santa Brigida del Paradiso, Brigittine, Florence, Italy

title: Florence, Biblioteca Nazionale Centrale di Firenzi, Conv.soppr.E.V.1328; Full manuscript
transcription: Possession note in hand of Suor Raffaella, f.76vA: Questo libro e’ delle monache (et) frati del monasterio del Paradiso di presso a Firençe.
translation: Possession note in the hand of Suor Raffaella, f.76vA: "This book belongs to the nuns and friars of the Paradiso monastery near Florence."
monastery: Santa Brigida del Paradiso, Brigittine, Florence, Italy

title: Florence, Biblioteca Nazionale Centrale di Firenzi, Conv.soppr.G.VII.1493; Full manuscript
transcription:
f.212v colophon in hand of scribe Raffaella: “Questo libro è delle monache del Paradiso, scripto da una di loro medesima” then by same scribe, in a different (cursive) script she adds “cioè suora Raffaella” 
Same f.f.212v, at the bottom of page she also writes, in the same cursive “Questo libro è di suor Raffaella e del convento (et) monasterio del Paradiso”
translation:
f.212v, colophon in the hand of scribe Raffaella: "This book belongs to the nuns of Paradiso, written by one of them."
Then, by the same scribe, in a different cursive script: "that is, Sister Raffaella."
At the bottom of the same page, f.212v, she also writes, in the same cursive: "This book belongs to Sister Raffaella and to the convent and monastery of Paradiso."
monastery: Santa Brigida del Paradiso, Brigittine, Florence, Italy

title: Florence, Biblioteca Nazionale Centrale di Firenzi, Fondo Nazionale II 130; Full manuscript
transcription: f.154vB in hand of Suor Cleofe: Finissi di scrivere il detto libro negli anni del Signore mille quattrocento novanta Quattro, addì X d’aghosto. Iscritto con gran faticha e disagio la maggior parte di nocte al lume di lucerna. Prieghovi non ghuardiate alla rusticità della lettera, ma pigliate la sana e verace doctrina data dalla bocca della verità e della sua gloriosa madre virgho Maria alla nostra madre sancta Brigida. Priegho che chi llo leggie con diligentia lo tengha e cchi ll’acatta sì lo renda in the lower margin of the same f.(c. 154v), possession note in the hand of Cleofe: Questo libro è delle suore e monache del Paradiso. Suor Cleofe.
translation: f.154vB, in the hand of Sister Cleofe: "I finished writing the said book in the year of the Lord one thousand four hundred ninety-four, on the 10th of August. Written with great effort and hardship, mostly at night by lamplight. I ask you not to judge the simplicity of the letter, but to take the sound and true doctrine given by the mouth of the Truth and his glorious mother, the Virgin Mary, to our holy mother, Saint Bridget. I pray that whoever reads it diligently may keep it, and whoever buys it may return it." In the lower margin of the same f., possession note in the hand of Cleofe: "This book belongs to the sisters and nuns of the Paradiso. Sister Cleofe."
monastery: Santa Brigida del Paradiso, Brigittine, Florence, Italy

title: Florence, Biblioteca Nazionale Centrale di Firenzi, Fondo Nazionale II II 509; Full manuscript
transcription: ‘colophon’ f.ix verso: gives date of 31 January 1597 and is signed “Indeg[n]a e minima sorella nel Sig[n]ore Su[uor]a Justina Niccolini” scribe and author identified on ff.179 recto and verso in D. Agostino Rinuccini’s letter to the nuns.
translation: The colophon on f.ix verso indicates the completion date as January 31, 1597, and is signed "Unworthy and humble sister in the Lord, Sister Justina Niccolini." The scribe and author are identified on f.s 179 recto and verso in a letter from D. Agostino Rinuccini to the nuns.

title: Florence, Biblioteca Nazionale Centrale di Firenzi, Fondo Nazionale II.III.247; Full manuscript
Florence, Biblioteca Nazionale Centrale di Firenzi, Fondo Nazionale II.III.270; full manuscript
transcription: Hand of suor Cleofe, f.137vA: Fu conpiuto di scrivere a dì 26 aprile nel M 495. Fu scricto con molta fatica e con molto disagio la maggior parte al lume di lucerna, et però chi ll’acacta con diligiença si lo tenga et alle monache del Paradiso sì llo renda. Amen. c. 149vB, hand of Cleofe: Questo libro è delle monache del Paradiso, decte di sancta Brigida. Chi llo leggie prieghi Idio per chi l’à scricto.
translation: f.137vA, hand of Sister Cleofe: "It was completed on the 26th of April in the year 1495. It was written with much effort and hardship, mostly by lamplight, so whoever acquires it with diligence, may keep it, and return it to the nuns of Paradiso. Amen." c. 149vB, hand of Cleofe: "This book belongs to the nuns of Paradiso, also known as Saint Bridget's. Whoever reads it, pray to God for the one who wrote it."
monastery: Santa Brigida del Paradiso, Brigittine, Florence, Italy

title: Florence, Biblioteca Nazionale Centrale di Firenzi, Fondo Nazionale II.IV.103; Full manuscript
transcription: possession note: f.60r: delle suore (et) convento del Paradiso
monastery: Santa Brigida del Paradiso, Brigittine, Florence, Italy

title: Florence, Biblioteca Nazionale Centrale di Firenzi, Magl. XXXV 88; Full manuscript
transcription: f.160v-161r (see pics)

title: Florence, Biblioteca Nazionale Centrale di Firenzi, Magl. XXXVIII.128; Full manuscript
transcription: f.113v-114r: "Finita è la vita e mircogli di sancta Brigida e alquante orationi rivelate da Dio e dalla vergine Maria a sancta Brigida, madre nostra, del reame di Svetia et del dominio del re del regno di Novergia, il quale è nelle parti di setentrione, ultimo di tutti i regni. Negli anni Domini 1458 utimo dì di novembre fu compiuto di scrivere per mano suor Katerina nel monastero del Paradiso"
translation: f.113v-114r: "The life and miracles of Saint Bridget, and some prayers revealed by God and the Virgin Mary to Saint Bridget, our mother, from the kingdom of Sweden and under the dominion of the king of Norway, which is in the northern parts, the last of all kingdoms. Completed in the year of our Lord 1458, on the last day of November, written by the hand of Sister Katerina in the monastery of Paradiso."
monastery: Santa Brigida del Paradiso, Brigittine, Florence, Italy

title: Florence, Biblioteca Nazionale Centrale di Firenzi, Magl.XXXVIII.93; Full manuscript
transcription: f.120v: “Fu finito el dì della Nattività del nostro Signore. Iscrisse suora Margherita Nicholini, indegnia religiosa del monastero di Sancta Brigida, chiamato Paradiso. Ora pro nobis beata mater Brigida et beata C(aterina)”
translation: f.120v: "It was finished on the day of the Nativity of our Lord. Inscribed by Sister Margherita Nicholini, unworthy religious of the monastery of Saint Bridget, called Paradiso. Pray for us, blessed Mother Bridget and blessed Catherine."
monastery: Santa Brigida del Paradiso, Brigittine, Florence, Italy

title: Florence, Biblioteca Nazionale Centrale di Firenzi, Pal. VII 130; Full manuscript
transcription: Fu scritto questo libro a di 20 daprile 1413 in casa di sora Maria della Rossa da Siena
translation: “This book was written on the 20th of April, 1413, in the house of Sister Maria della Rossa of Siena.”

title: Florence, Biblioteca Nazionale Centrale di Firenzi, Palatino 75; Full manuscript
transcription: f.38v: 'Quod scripsit scribat, semper cum Domino vivat, vivat in celis soror Seraphina cum Domino felix. Finis. Laus Deo. Amen.'
translation: f.38v: "May she who wrote, continue to write, always living with the Lord, may Sister Seraphina live happily with the Lord in heaven. The end. Praise be to God. Amen."
monastery: San Jacopo di Ripoli, Florence, Italy

title: Florence, Biblioteca Nazionale Centrale di Firenzi, Palatino 77 (E.5.6.43;223); Full manuscript
transcription: f.177rA, hand of Cleofe: “Fu scritto nel MCCCCLXXXX4, finisse di scrivere addì XI di março. Laus Deo. Amen.”
translation: f.177rA, hand of Cleofe: "It was written in the year MCCCCLXXXX4, finished writing on the 11th day of March. Praise be to God. Amen."
monastery: Santa Brigida del Paradiso, Brigittine, Florence, Italy

title: Florence, Biblioteca Nazionale Centrale di Firenzi, Tordi 55; Full manuscript
transcription: Questo libro è di suora Chatarina di Ceccho di Bertuccio del monas(tero) di sancto Lucha da Montepulciano.
translation: “This book belongs to Sister Chatarina, daughter of Ceccho di Bertuccio, from the monastery of Saint Lucia of Montepulciano.”

title: Florence, Biblioteca Riccardiana, Ricc. 1414; Full manuscript
transcription: f79v: Finisce la solenne amonitione come si debbe a honore di Duo usar l'anima, el corpo, la roba, e figliuoli, e beato a chi la observera, copiata per me s(uor)a N. del monastero di Sancta Lucia di via di San Gallo***, compiuta a di 27 di septembre 1518. Laus Deo semper.
translation:
f.79v:
“Here ends the solemn admonition on how one should use the soul, the body, possessions, and children to the honor of God, and blessed is the one who observes it. Copied by me, Sister N., of the Monastery of Saint Lucia on Via di San Gallo, completed on the 27th of September, 1518. Praise to God always.”

title: Florence, Biblioteca Riccardiana, Ricc. 2102; Full manuscript
transcription: f.i verso (in red): Incomincia el divoto libro chiamato Specchio di Croce// facto e compilato pel venerabile religioso in christo yesu Reverendo// padre frate Domenico Cavalca da vico pisano dell or// dine de fra predicatori scricto da me indegna serva e schi// ava di yesu christo suor Angelica del decto ordine. f.120v: Qui scrissit scribat semper cum domino vivat vivat in ce// lis semper cum domino felix. Facto fine pia laudetus Virgo Maria.// Questo libro fu finito di scrivere nel 1460 addì 2 di Iunio.
translation:
f.i verso (in red): "Here begins the devout book called 'Specchio di Croce,' made and compiled by the venerable religious in Christ, Reverend Father Frate Domenico Cavalca from Vico Pisano of the Order of Friars Preachers, written by me, unworthy servant and slave of Jesus Christ, Sister Angelica of the said order." 

f.120v: "Let whoever writes here live always with the Lord, may they live in heaven always with the Lord, happy. With pious praise, Blessed Virgin Mary. This book was finished writing on the 2nd of June, 1460."
monastery: San Jacopo di Ripoli, Florence, Italy

title: Florence, Biblioteca Riccardiana, Ricc.1267; Full manuscript
transcription: Colophon with possession note f.190B in hand of copyist Raffaella: “Deo gratias. Sit laus Deo patri. Finito è il [libro crossed out] libro detto Dialogo di sancta Caterina da sSiena. Fu finito di scrivere a dì ventidue dicembre correndo gli anni del nostro (Iesu) (Christo) M quatrocento ottanta cinque. (Et) è il detto libro del monasterio di Santa Brigida chiamato il Paradiso, di presso a fFirençe” Possession note in red, erased in part and only partly leggible f.201vA: “[...] di Sancta Brigida al Paradiso”
translation: Colophon with possession note f.190B in hand of copyist Raffaella: "Thanks be to God. Let praise be to God the Father. Finished is the [book crossed out] book called 'Dialogue of Saint Catherine of Siena.' It was finished writing on the twenty-second of December, in the year of our (Jesus) (Christ) M four hundred eighty-five. And the said book is from the monastery of Santa Brigida called the Paradiso, near Florence." Possession note in red, partially erased and partly legible f.201vA: "[...] of Santa Brigida at the Paradiso."
monastery: Santa Brigida del Paradiso, Brigittine, Florence, Italy

title: Florence, Biblioteca Riccardiana, Ricc.1291; Full manuscript
transcription: Colophon on f.141v: 'Gloria laus et honor tibi Christe, simulque Senensi virgini Caterine benedicite. Qui scripsit scribat semper cum Domino vivat, vivat in celis soror Checha serva fidelis. Factum est anno Domini M° CCCC°LXVIII° die XXVI mensis aprilis'
translation: Colophon on f.141v: "Glory, praise, and honor to you, O Christ, and likewise, blessings to the virgin Catherine of Siena. May she who wrote this, write forever with the Lord, may she live forever in heaven, faithful servant Sister Checha. Done in the year of the Lord M° CCCC°LXVIII°, on the twenty-sixth day of the month of April."
monastery: San Jacopo di Ripoli, Florence, Italy

title: Florence, Biblioteca Riccardiana, Ricc.1381 [N.IV.33]; Full manuscript
transcription: f.134r: Qualunque persona leggerà [then a crossed out "qu"] questa divota ["divota" repeated twice, the first crossed out] leggenda prieghi Iddio per me soror Sara povera [then two crossed out words] che sse voi nol farete quando sarò morta vi strangholerò [last phrase difficult to read; later hand rewrote text underneath].
translation: f.134r: "Whoever reads this devout legend, pray to God for me, Sister Sara, poor. If you don't do it when I'm dead, I'll haunt you."

title: Florence, Biblioteca Riccardiana, Ricc.1391 [P.II.19]; Full manuscript
transcription: Date on f.201v: Anno Domini MºCCCCLXXIIII die X mensis octubris.
translation: f.201v: "In the year of our Lord 1474, on the 10th day of the month of October."
monastery: San Jacopo di Ripoli, Florence, Italy

title: Florence, Biblioteca Riccardiana, Ricc.1401 (Q.II.8); Full manuscript
transcription: Colophon with scribal signature and note of exchange f.1r: Questo libro è delle suore di San Jacopo di Ripoli, el quale ho scritto io suora Felice per consolatione di chi lo vorrà leggiere. E con licentia della madre priora suora Angela l’ò dato a suora Purità Buonarrighi; f.243r: Laus deo finito é questo libro el quale si chiama vita fratrum ..... di Dio et della gloriosa Vergine Maria e della patriarcha San Domenico.
translation:
f.1r: "This book belongs to the sisters of San Jacopo di Ripoli, which I, Sister Felice, have written for the consolation of those who will read it. And with the permission of Mother Prioress Sister Angela, I have given it to Sister Purità Buonarrighi."

f.243r: "Praise be to God, this book is finished, which is called the life of the brothers ... of God and of the glorious Virgin Mary and of the patriarch Saint Dominic."
monastery: San Jacopo di Ripoli, Florence, Italy

title: Florence, Biblioteca Riccardiana, Ricc.1429; Full manuscript
transcription: f.56v: «Finiti i venti sermoni del prefato santo Aghostino, molto a nostro ammaestramento. Sritti (sic) e chopiati per mano della Benedetta donna di Piero d'Antonio Nicholi, fatti nel 1464 a dì venti di marzo»
translation: "f.56v: "The twenty sermons of the aforementioned Saint Augustine are finished, very instructive for us. Written and copied by the Blessed lady, daughter of Piero d'Antonio Nicholi, made on the 20th of March 1464.""

title: Florence, Biblioteca Riccardiana, Ricc.1709; Full manuscript
transcription: f.26r Orate per lo scriptore f.B.; possession note f.28v: Iste liber est monialium monasterii Sancti Iacobi de Ripolis de Florentia ordinis predicatorum
translation:
"f.26r: Pray for the scribe f.B."
"f.28v: This book belongs to the nuns of the monastery of San Giacomo de' Ripoli in Florence, of the Order of Preachers."
monastery: San Jacopo di Ripoli, Florence, Italy

title: Florence, Biblioteca Riccardiana, Ricc.1794; Full manuscript
transcription:
in red or reddish-sepia ink, much faded, f.369 bottom of column of text: “[O]* llaude e gloria dello omnipotente Dio e della gloriosa vergine Maria et di sancto Benedetto, P.N. è finito parte di questo libro, cioè capitoli 40, per mano di suora Paula, indengna serva di Yesu Christo, a consolatione di chi lo leggerà, e a chi piacerà, farà prece a dio con quello affetto di carità col quale essa l’à scripto con licentia della sua superiora.” 
f.370 colophon continues at top of column of text: “Nell’anno della salutifera incarnatione del Nostro Signore Yesu Christo Mccccc90 e a dì X del mese di settenbre. Finis.”
translation:
"f.369 bottom of column of text: "To the praise and glory of the Almighty God and of the glorious Virgin Mary and of Saint Benedict, P.N., part of this book is finished, namely chapters 40, by the hand of Sister Paula, unworthy servant of Jesus Christ, for the consolation of those who will read it, and to whom it may please, she will pray to God with that affection of charity with which she wrote it, with the permission of her superior."
f.370 colophon continues at top of column of text: "In the year of the salutary incarnation of Our Lord Jesus Christ MCCCCXC, and on the 10th day of the month of September. End."

title: Florence, Biblioteca Riccardiana, Ricc.2627; Full manuscript
transcription: f.158v “Questo libro è di suora Cicilia da Diacceto, indegna badessa del Paradiso, chi l’acchata lo renda”
translation: f.158v: "This book belongs to Sister Cicilia from Diacceto, unworthy abbess of the Paradiso. Whoever buys it, return it."
monastery: Santa Brigida del Paradiso, Brigittine, Florence, Italy

title: Florence, Museo di San Marco, Ms.561 Graduale F; Full manuscript
transcription: Possession note on the front controguardia: Iste liber est monialium moniasteri Sancti Iaccobi de Ripolis de Florentia ordinis predicatorum. attribution through identification of hand to other liturgical manuscripts attributed to 16th-c. Ripoli nuns.
translation: Possession note on the front endpaper: "This book belongs to the nuns of the monastery of San Jacopo de Ripoli in Florence, of the Dominican order."
monastery: San Jacopo di Ripoli, Florence, Italy

title: Florence, Museo di San Marco, Ms.630; Full manuscript
transcription: Colophon on f.259v: 'Iste liber scriptus fuit a duabus so/ roribus monasterii sancti Iacobi de/ Ripolis ad honorem domini nostri yesu Christi/ Nomina carorum fuit Suor Angela et Suor/ Lucretia quas deus scribat in li/ bro vite'
translation: Colophon on f.259v: "This book was written by two sisters of the monastery of San Jacopo de Ripoli in honor of our Lord Jesus Christ. The names of the dear ones were Sister Angela and Sister Lucretia. May God write them in the book of life."
monastery: San Jacopo di Ripoli, Florence, Italy

title: Florence, Museo di San Marco, Ms.634 Corale P; Full manuscript
transcription: Colophon on the back of the controguardia: 'Iste liber scripsit Suor Angela de Rucella/ rus et Lucretia de Panciaticis eum/ notavit et fuit moniales Sancti Iacobi de/ Ripolis. Laus deo et virgini gloriose'
translation: Colophon on the back of the front endpaper: "This book was written by Sister Angela de Rucellai and Lucretia de Panciatichi noted it, and they were nuns of San Jacopo de Ripoli. Praise be to God and the glorious Virgin."
monastery: San Jacopo di Ripoli, Florence, Italy

title: Frankfurt am Main, Staats- und Universitäts-bibliothek, MS Barth. 42; Full manuscript
transcription: 110vb Octave after Pentecost = Portrait of the nun Guda with scroll: GVDA peccatrix mulier scripsit et pinxit hunc librum
translation: Guda, a sinful woman, wrote and painted this book.

title: Freiburg im Breisgau, Stadtarchiv, 152 (IX. KH. e. i. 2) (partim); Full manuscript
transcription: Anno domini M.CCC. L.IIII. in Aprili wart diz selebu/o/ch gemachet dem closter ze sante Katherinen bi Friburg von suester Adelheit von Ma/e/ngen der scaffenerin und von suester Agnesen Kemphinen der priolinen und von suester Katherinen von Chu/o/nnehein der selmeisterin... [es folgt ein ausradierter Text, dann:} Anno domini M.CCC.L.IIII.IIII. idus Aprilis scriptus est liber testamentorum nostrorum a Johanne de Constancia sacerdote. Omnes orate pro eo amen. HKOLHagenmaeier 1988 p. 180-181
translation:
“In the year of our Lord 1354, in April, this book of wills was created for the monastery of St. Catherine near Freiburg by Sister Adelheit von Maengen, the steward, Sister Agnes Kemphin, the prioress, and Sister Katharina von Chounnehein, the cellarer. [A section of the text is erased.]

In the year of our Lord 1354, on the fourth Ides of April [April 10], this book of wills was written by John of Konstanz, a priest. Pray for him, all of you. Amen.”

title: Freiburg im Breisgau, Stadtarchiv, B 4 101; Full manuscript
transcription: Dis buch wart gescriben in dem jare do man zalte von gottes geburte drizehen hundert jar und 9 jar. An sant Johannes tag baptisten. in dem ogsten. Und wart gescriben under einre priolin du hies swester Anna Trullmennin und screib es Fena Tulenhoptin. Die bittent das ir ir gedenkent zu unserem herren ihu cristo. Amerum." (no info on Fena's status) AQI Lindgren 2001 p. 81-2 and 186
translation: “This book was written in the year of the Lord 1309, on the feast day of St. John the Baptist, in the East. And it was written under a prioress named Sister Anna Trullmennin, and it was written by Fena Tulenhoptin. They ask that you remember them before our Lord Jesus Christ. Amen.”

title: Freiburg im Breisgau, Universitätsbibliothek, 149; Full manuscript
transcription: cjc transcription: diz buoch het geten schriben margared hoffelden / bittent got fu"r mich
translation: “This book has been written by Margared Hoffelden / she asks God for me.”

title: Fulda, Landesbibliothek, Ms. Aa 125; Full manuscript
transcription: 27v: Ora deum pro me peccatrice soror Maria Horns
translation: “Pray to God for me, a sinner, Sister Maria Horns”

title: Full manuscript
transcription: Pries Nostre Seigneur, si vous plaîs, pour la povre seur Bernardine Dunant, qui a escript ce livre l’an de grace mille CCCC LXXXVI. Deo gracias.
translation: Pray to Our Lord, if you please, for the poor sister Bernardine Dunant, who wrote this book in the year of grace 1486. Thanks be to God.

title: Gaesdonck, Collegium Augustinianum, 17; Full manuscript
transcription: f.288r: “Orate pro me scryptore Ave Maria ... Amen Soror [...] johanna de schild Orate pro eo”
translation: f.288r: "Pray for me the scribe. Hail Mary ... Amen. Sister [...] Johanna de Schild. Pray for him."

title: Genoa, Biblioteca Civica Berio, Ms.m.r.Cf.2.16; Full manuscript
transcription:
f.282r: “Finito il libro di sancto Augustino XXII° de civitate Dei et ultimo a laude et reverentia di Dio'. 
same f.282r, below: 'Hunc veneranda soror scripsit Veronica librum Veronae in Sacro Spiritus alme tuo' e quindi la data 'M°CCCCLXXII die XXVIII augusti.”
translation:
f.282r: "The book of Saint Augustine XXII° on the City of God is finished, to the praise and reverence of God.
Same f.282r, below: "This venerable sister Veronica wrote this book in Verona in your Sacred Spirit, and then the date '1472, August 28th.'"

title: Gent, Kon VI. Acad., Ms.10; Full manuscript
transcription: Item dit boeck is gescreven te maestricht int besloeten suster huis opter meechden dries. Ende voleindet Op sancte Cristina dach Ende het heeft gescreven ein arme susterken arm van doechden suster katrijn van rade int jaer ons heeren doe men screiff M°CCCC ende lxxxvii Bidt om gods wil voer die scrivers einen Ave marien van mynnen dat ich alle mijn gebreken moet verwynnen ende mijnen god getrouwelicken mynnen Ende men in mach dijt boeck niet vercoupen want daer op sonnendage ende heilige dage in gescreven is
translation: Also, this book was written in Maastricht in the enclosed sisters' house at Meerssener Dries. And it was completed on Saint Christina's day. And it was written by a poor sister, poor in virtues, Sister Katrijn van Rade, in the year of our Lord when it was written, 1487. Pray for God's will for the scribes. An Ave Maria in love, that I may overcome all my shortcomings and love my God faithfully. And this book cannot be sold because it contains writing done on Sundays and holy days.

title: Gent, Universiteitsbibliotheek, Ms.663; Full manuscript
transcription: f.198v: ghescreven suster Machteld Gherijts dochter.
translation: f.198v: Written by Sister Machteld, daughter of Gherijt

title: Gent, Universiteitsbibliotheek, Ms.693; Full manuscript
transcription: f.396r: "Dit boec was vol eynt Int jaer ons heeren dusent vier hondert ende .lxxx. opten xxsten dach in april van suster martine van woelputte procuratarsse te berghen int besloeten cloester sinte margrieten int dal van josaphat"
translation: f.396r: "This book was fully completed in the year of our Lord one thousand four hundred and eighty, on the twenty-first day of April, by Sister Martine van Woelputte, procurator at the enclosed convent of Saint Margaret in the Valley of Josaphat in Bergen."

title: Gent, Universiteitsbibliotheek, Ms.902; Full manuscript
transcription:
f.1v: "Men sal oec weten dat alle dese sermoene sijn ghescreven uut der predicaren monde alsoe na ende ghelijck als men can van twee onse religiose susteren ... Der eender name es suster baerbara cuyermans ..." f.2r: "Die ander es ghenaemt suster elizabeth van poelke ..." 
f.2r: "... Nu com ic suster mergriete van steenberghen ... Ende hebbe ... desen boeck ghescreven ende vergadert met aerbeyde ..." 
f.255v: "Desen boeck es volscreven opden heileghen trinityt avent inden jaer ons heren dusent .cccc. ende lxxix. God sij gheloeft ende ghemint ewijlijck Amen"
translation:
f.1v: "It should also be known that all these sermons are written from the preaching of our Dominican sisters, as accurately and faithfully as possible, by two of our religious sisters ... One of them is named Sister Barbara Cuyermans ..."
f.2r: "The other is named Sister Elizabeth van Poelke ... Now I, Sister Margriete van Steenberghen, come ... And I have ... written and compiled this book with labor ..."
f.255v: "This book is fully written on the Holy Trinity Eve in the year of our Lord one thousand four hundred and seventy-nine. God be praised and loved eternally. Amen."
monastery: Cloister Notre-Dame of the Rose of Jericho, Augustinian, Brussels, Belgium, 1247

title: Gent, Universiteitsbibliotheek, Ms.904; Full manuscript
transcription: f.173r: "Dit boeck van sinte Jheronimus es vol screven int jaer ons heren .m. iiii[c]. ende .lx. op onser liever vrouwen avont nativitas op den sondach van suster lijsken vlieghe Ghedinct harer"
translation: f.173r: "This book of Saint Jerome is fully written in the year of our Lord 1460 on the Feast of the Nativity of Our Lady, on the Sunday, by Sister Lijsken Vlieghe. Remember her."
monastery: Cloister Notre-Dame of the Rose of Jericho, Augustinian, Brussels, Belgium, 1247

title: Gent, Universiteitsbibliotheek, Ms.966; Full manuscript
transcription: f.236r: "Dit boec is ghescreven inden besloten regularersen cloester dat ghelegen is bynnen oestmal in dat mercgrefscap van hantwerpen Ende ghesticht is inder eeren der precentacien der saligher maghet ende ghebenedider moeder gods Maria Ende is gheeynt op die vigilie pasione petri et pauli der glorioser ende heiligher apostelen: van mi suster heilken jacops Een vanden vieren die dit cloester hebben helpen begynnen ter eeren gods: mer die mynste in duechden Enen Ave maria uut mynnen / Men en maech dit boec niet vercopen. want tis veel op heilighe dage ghescreven"
translation: f.236r: "This book is written in the enclosed regular cloister located in Oostmalle in the county of Antwerp and established in honor of the Presentation of the Blessed Virgin Mary. It was completed on the vigil of the Passion of the Glorious and Holy Apostles Peter and Paul by me, Sister Heilken Jacobs, one of the four who helped establish this cloister to the glory of God, albeit the least in virtues. An Ave Maria from me. It is not permitted to sell this book, for it has been written on many holy days."

title: Gera, Stadtarchiv, HB 7623; Full manuscript
monastery: Saint Katharina, Dominican, Nuremberg, Germany, 1295

title: Göttingen University Library, 8° Cod.Ms. theol. 200; f. 1r-355v
transcription: zo wellicher rasten die gutheit godes vns brengen wulle durch dat gebeth syns aller heilichsten knechtes vnsers gloriosen vaders Augustyni, amen. Scriptus et finitus est liber presens anno domini mille quadringentesymo quinquagesimo sexto ipso die beatorum martyrum Prothi et Jacincti. Sit laus et honor inde omnipotenti deo. Amen.
translation: “so that God’s goodness may grant us such rest, through the prayer of his most holy servant, our glorious father Augustine, amen. This present book was written and finished in the year of our Lord 1456, on the very day of the holy martyrs Protus and Hyacinthus. May praise and honor for this be given to Almighty God. Amen.”
monastery: Augustinian Hermit Nunnery of St. Mary in Kamp, Beguine, Boppard, Germany, 1378

title: Göttingen University Library, 8° Ms. Ms. theol. 292; Full manuscript
monastery:
Maria Medingen, Dominican, Mödingen, Germany, 1246-
1542

title: Gouda, Streekarchief Midden-Holland, Librije 159; Full manuscript
transcription: f.238v°: Explicit collectarius scriptus per manus septem monialium scilicet marie johannis geze yzenoudi. ave tricijacobe gerardi agathe nycolai. marie martini et marie gerardi. finitus anno domini millesimo quadringentesimo quinquagesimo quarto ipso die sancti odulphi confessons (textualis formata). Isti sunt libri latinipertinentes ad librariam conventus sancte Margarete in gouda (catalogue, ajouté après coup en littera hybrida).
translation: f.238 verso: Here ends the collectary written by the hands of seven nuns, namely Marie, Johannis, Geze, Yzenoudi, Ave, Tricijacobe, Gerardi, Agathe, Nycolai, Marie, Martini, and Marie, Gerardi. Finished in the year of our Lord one thousand four hundred fifty-four, on the very day of Saint Odulph, confessor. These are the Latin books belonging to the library of the convent of Saint Margaret in Gouda (catalog, added later in hybrid letter).

title: Graz, Universitaetsbibliothek, 36; Full manuscript
transcription: f.4 Que me scribebat Margarete Vincherina nomen habebat.
translation: “She who wrote me was named Margarete Vincherina.”

title: Haarlem, Stadsbibliotheek, Ms.187 D 15; Full manuscript
transcription: f.120: Hier is nu dat eynde (...) Ende heeft ghescreven ende gheeyndet bider hulpen ons heren jhesu christi sybrich willem enghels dochter een arm susterkijn wonende in beverwijc mitten regulierissen Intjaer ons heren Mcccc xlvi bid voer haer om goeds willen. Des si god ghelovet nu ende in ewicheit Amen. F.121: Dit boec hoert totten regulierissen in beverwijc (copiste)
translation: f.120: Here is now the end (...) And it was written and finished with the help of our Lord Jesus Christ by Sybrich Willem, daughter of an Englishman, a poor little sister living in Beverwijk with the regular sisters, in the year of our Lord 1446. Pray for her for God's sake. Thus she praised God now and forever. Amen. f.121: This book belongs to the regular sisters in Beverwijk. (Scribe)

title: Halle, Universitäts- und Landesbibliothek, Qu. Ms. 105; Full manuscript
transcription: f.202v; Geschrieben 1486 von einer Ilzs muttercken für ihre Irluchtede gnedighe vnnd eddele vorstinne vnnd lyebe dochterke.
translation: “Written in 1486 by a certain Ilz’s mother for her illustrious, gracious, and noble princess and dear daughter.”

title: Hamburg, Staats-und Universitätsbibliothek, Ms. 105 in scrin.; Full manuscript
transcription: f.295r: Hie endet sich daz buch der wirckunge der apostelen in dem iar vnsers heren XIV vnde iiij iare sint sie gesch[rieben]. (Es folgt von einer anderen Hand der Zusatz:) von suster Gertrut von buren.
translation: Here ends the book of the Acts of the Apostles in the year of our Lord 1404, and these were written. by Sister Gertrut von Buren.

title: Hamburg, Staats-und Universitätsbibliothek, Ms. 207 in scrin.; Full manuscript
transcription: f.13v: Mechthild von Dassel [O sanctissime Jacobe ego indigna famula tua M[echthild von] das[sel] confugio ad te ]
translation: f.13v: O most holy James, I, your unworthy servant Mechthild von Dassel, take refuge in you.

title: Hamburg, Staats-und Universitätsbibliothek, Ms. 209 in scrin.; Full manuscript
transcription: 77v: Elisabeth Elebeke [ pro me misera peccatrix Elyzabeth ele[beck] ]
translation: f.77v “Pray for me, miserable sinner Elisabeth Elebeke.”

title: Hamburg, Staats-und Universitätsbibliothek, Ms. theol. 2052; Full manuscript
Hannover, Landesbibliothek, Ms. 190; Full manuscript
transcription: f.160: Completus est liber praesens a. d. 1509 ipso die Crisogoni m. quem scripsit Agnes Klencke monialis in Visbeke ad laudem dei ac s. mariae v. sanctique Iohannis bapt. patroni nostri. Oretur igitur pro scriptrice ut post hanc vitam perducatur ad eterna gaudia.
translation: “The present book was completed in the year 1509 on the very day of St. Chrysogonus’ feast, written by the nun Agnes Klencke in Vischbeck, for the praise of God, of the Virgin Mary, and of St. John the Baptist, our patron. Therefore, let prayers be said for the scribe, that after this life she may be led to eternal joy.”

title: Harvard University, Houghton Library, Ms.Riant 91; Full manuscript
transcription: f.1r, "gescreuen door Catarina in Sveden den xxi in somer maen van den jare MDxxii
translation: f.1r: Written by Catarina in Sweden, on the 21st day of the summer month, in the year 1522

title: Hasselt, PM, s.o.; Full manuscript
transcription: f.1r: "leest een pater noster voer die siele van suster anna swilden, die dit boec gescreven heeft om gods wil. Requiescant [!] in pace. amen. Op sondage ende heilich dach gescreven"
translation: f.1r: "Read a Our Father for the soul of sister Anna Swilden, who has written this book for God's sake. May they rest in peace. Amen. Written on Sunday and holy day."

title: Heidelberg, Universitätsbibliothek, 257; Full manuscript
transcription: f.78: An der pen und straff die solichen zaubrern und verfurern zugehort die will ich nennen und erzelen an dem ende diss puchs und daby durch die geschrift bewaren wa es geschriben stat. Clara Hatzlerin.
translation: “At the end and with punishment, those who belong to such witches and sorcerers, I will name and tell at the end of this book, and by means of the writing, preserve where it was written. Clara Hatzlerin.”

title: Heidelberg, Universitätsbibliothek, 310; Full manuscript
transcription: f.45: Clara Hatzlerin
translation: f.45: Clara Hatzlerin

title: Heidelberg, Universitätsbibliothek, Cpg 214 (old number: 119); Full manuscript
transcription: a.d. 1321 iar do wart dis buoch volle schriben Iunefrow Guoteline von Esselingen die da wonet ze Spire. -- Amen.
translation: “In the year 1321, this book was completely written by Iunefrow Guoteline of Esslingen, who lives in Speyer. – Amen.”

title: Heidelberg, Universitätsbibliothek, Ms.Salem IX 66; Full manuscript
transcription:
f.151v
Istum librum procuravit fr. Iacobus ad honorem S. Marie Virg. et eius filio et ordinavit eundem in chorum prioris qui secus fecerit anathema coram summo deo sit et scriptus est a venerabili sorore Katherina de Brugg moniali in rubeo monasterio sub a.d. 1366 Quicunque cantat vel legat in eo habeat nostri memoriam aput deum. Ego kathe dicta zebrugg in rubeo monasterio.
translation: “This book was procured by Brother Jacob in honor of the Virgin Mary and her Son, and he placed it in the prior’s choir. Whoever does otherwise [with this book] may be anathema before the Almighty God. It was written by the venerable Sister Katherine of Brugg, a nun in the Red Monastery, in the year of our Lord 1366. Whoever sings or reads from it, may they keep us in memory before God. I, Katherine, called ‘Zebrugg,’ in the Red Monastery.”

title: Heidelberg, Universitätsbibliothek, Pal. germ. 478; Full manuscript
transcription: 78v: Clara Hätzlerin
translation: 78v: Clara Hätzlerin

title: Heidelberg, Universitätsbibliothek, Pal. germ. 677; Full manuscript
transcription: 45r: Clara Hätzlerin
translation: 45r: Clara Hätzlerin

title: Heidelberg, Universitätsbibliothek, Pal. Germ. 807; Full manuscript
transcription: [Hunc librum mihi donavit reverenda et generosa dna Iustina a Lupffen abbatissa ecclesie XI milium virginum eumque propria sua manu conscripsit mihique Stephano Isaaco praedictae ecclesiae canonico eium perp. memoriae signum tradidit. Sit ei deus propitius. a. 1571.]
translation: “This book was given to me by the reverend and noble Lady Iustina a Lupffen, abbess of the Church of the Eleven Thousand Virgins, and she wrote it with her own hand, giving it to me, Stephen Isaac, a canon of the same church, as a sign of perpetual remembrance. May God be merciful to her. In the year 1571.”

title: Hildesheim, Cathedral Library, Hs. J 27; Full manuscript
transcription: f.146v: Explicit exp/iciunt / que cordis intima promunt / scriptando manu /totoque corporis usu / ut clare patebit I oculo quas [ ?) cuncta rimabit / Scripta cum floribus / picturam sie sociamus / omnia hec fecit / et famula sola peregit / in Meding claustro / Luneborch prope situato / ordinis ut fateor / Cisterciensis et utor / Sed si queratur / quod nomen mihi debetur / omnibus et cognita / de Winsen sie vocitata / Elyzabeth proprio / de quo et gloria Christo / anno milleno quadruplex centum addito deno / sexaginta tribus cum quinario sociatus / corporis in festo Christi die venerando / Iubente venerabili domino preposito Tylemanno / de Bauenstede et necessaria ministrando I ob amorem dilecte stte amice Elyzabeth / de Bauenstede
translation: f.146v: "Here ends what the deepest thoughts of the heart reveal, written by hand and with the full use of the body, as will be clearly seen by the eye that examines all. Written with flowers, so let us join illustration with text. All this was done and completed by the servant alone in the cloister of Meding, situated near Luneburg. I confess that I belong to the Cistercian order and use the name known to all, called Elisabeth of Winsen. To my own glory and to the glory of Christ, in the year one thousand, four hundred, and ten, with ten added and sixty-three with five combined, on the venerable feast day of Christ, by the command of the venerable Lord Provost Tylemann of Bavensted, and for the sake of ministering to the needs, for the love of my beloved friend, Elisabeth of Bavensted."

title: Hildesheim, Cathedral Library, Hs. J 29; Full manuscript
transcription: f.212r: Anno domini M°CCCC° LXXVIII° conpletus est liber iste ...
translation: f.212r: "In the year of our Lord 1478, this book was completed ..."

title: Jena, Thüringer Universitäts und Landesbibliothek, Ms. GB f.3; Full manuscript
transcription: f.332va: Felicitas Lieber [ Anno domini MV and in the next year [] the book was written by S. Felicitas Lieberin ]
translation: “In the year of our Lord M.V. and in the following year [], the book was written by S. Felicitas Lieberin.”

title: Karlsruhe, Badische Landesbibliothek, Donaueschingen 422; f. 1r-69v
transcription: [scribal hand: Elisabeth Muntpratin d.J.]

title: Karlsruhe, Badische Landesbibliothek, HS. Don. 830; Full manuscript
transcription: f.39: Clara Hatzlerin lxviij.
translation: f.39: Clara Hatzlerin lxviij.

title: Karlsruhe, Badische Landesbibliothek, L 15; Full manuscript
transcription: Alle die an disseme bo"che wollent singen eder (!) lesen, die solent gedenken alle der die dis bu/o/ch hant gemachet. Anegenges der von INgenheim, darnach Manegoldes selgen. Requiescant in pace in vitam eternam. (72r, AQI HKOL Heinzer and Stamm, 1987, p. 95); a "Methildis de Ingenheim" is in the oldes layer of the Lichtenthaler Nekrology (ibid)
