translation: “All who want to sing or read from this book should remember all those who made this book. First of all, those from Ingenheim, and then Manegold’s late (soul). May they rest in peace and in eternal life.”
monastery:
Lichtenthal, Cistercian, Baden-Baden, Germany, 1 Jan 1245-
1789

title: Karlsruhe, Badische Landesbibliothek, Lichtent. 47; Full manuscript
transcription: f.312v: Liber iste schripsit (!) soror mea Elisabeth von Entzberg
translation: f.312v: “This book was written by my sister Elisabeth von Entzberg.”
monastery:
Lichtenthal, Cistercian, Baden-Baden, Germany, 1 Jan 1245-
1789

title: Karlsruhe, Badische Landesbibliothek, Lichtent. 65; Full manuscript
transcription:
f.125r: Finita et completa est hec glosa super
psalterio Sabbato infra Octavam Corporis Cristi (14. Juni) Anno eiusdem 1460.
translation: f.125r: This gloss on the Psalter was finished and completed on the Saturday within the Octave of Corpus Christi (14 June), in the year 1460.
monastery:
Lichtenthal, Cistercian, Baden-Baden, Germany, 1 Jan 1245-
1789

title: Karlsruhe, Badische Landesbibliothek, Ms. Donaueschingen 145; Full manuscript
transcription: f.2r: Anna von Stoffeln [ anna frie zv stoffel ]
translation:
"f.2r: Anna von Stoffeln [ anna frie zv stoffel ]
"

title: Karlsruhe, Badische Landesbibliothek, Perg. germ. (St. Georgen) 103; Full manuscript
transcription: Sit laus deo et finitus est libellum in octava s. Francisci a. antivitate (sic) d. 1572 per iuvenem sororres (sic) nomine S. Ottilia Schede in Maria Rosarium O. scissime virg. Clare. Orate deum pro me.
translation: “Let praise be to God, and the little book is finished on the octave of Saint Francis in the year of antiquity (sic) 1572 by the young sister named Saint Ottilia Schede in the Maria Rosarium, most holy virgin of Clare. Pray to God for me.”

title: Karlsruhe, Badische Landesbibliothek, Schwarzach 19; Full manuscript
transcription: Subskriptionen Anna Schotin hat diß buechelgeschriben anno domini 1480 (lr; s. Abb. 28) und Diß wart ußgeschriben anno domini MIIIFLXXX beten ein Ave Maria der Ann Schötin (265v)
translation: "Subscriptions: Anna Schotin has written this booklet in the year of our Lord 1480 (on the left margin; see Figure 28), and This was completed in the year of our Lord 1480. Say an Ave Maria for Ann Schötin (on 265v)."

title: Karlsruhe, Badische Landesbibliothek, St. Georgen 68; Full manuscript
transcription: Finitus est iste liber per me soror Agnes bu"tzlin O.S. Clare in Vilingen a.d. 1297 (lege 1497) in octava corporis Ihesu xpi. Benedicamus domno deo gratias. (f.147)
translation:
f.147:
“This book was completed by me, Sister Agnes Bützlin, of the Order of St. Clare in Villingen, in the year of our Lord 1297 (read: 1497), on the octave of the feast of Corpus Christi. Let us bless the Lord — thanks be to God.”

title: Karlsruhe, Badische Landesbibliothek, St. Georgen 8a; Full manuscript
transcription: f.1v: “[N]ach xÞi gepurt mxxxx vnd yn dem lix iar. Hatgebeßert diß boch vnd vil dar czu geschriben. Schwesterkunegund holzschuherin des closters czu sant katherin in Nürnberg þdiger orden. Czu nutz dem closter czu demheiligen grab in Bamberg pitt got für sye.”
translation: f.1v: "After Christ's birth in 1490 and in the 66th year, this book was amended and much added thereto. Sister Kunegund Holzschuherin of the convent of Saint Catherine in Nuremberg, a devout order. For the benefit of the convent, pray to God for her."
monastery: Saint Katharina, Dominican, Nuremberg, Germany, 1295

title: Karlsruhe, Badische Landesbibliothek, St. Georgen Pap. 8b; Full manuscript
transcription: corr. Kunigund Holzschuherin
translation: corr. Kunigund Holzschuherin
monastery: Saint Katharina, Dominican, Nuremberg, Germany, 1295

title: Karlsruhe, Badische Landesbibliothek, St. Georgen Pap. germ. 68; Full manuscript
transcription: Finitus est iste liber per me soror Agnes Butzlin O. S. Clare in Vilingen a. d. 1297 (lege 1497) in octava corporis Ihesu xpi. Benedicamus domno deo gratias.
translation: “This book was completed by me, Sister Agnes Butzlin, of the Order of Saint Clare in Villingen, in the year of our Lord 1297 (read: 1497), on the octave of the Feast of the Body of Jesus Christ. Let us bless the Lord — thanks be to God.

title: Karlsruhe, Badische Landesbibliothek, St. Peter pap. 1; Full manuscript
transcription: Lob sye gott geendet an sant Maria Magdalena obent bittent gott vnd Marie syn wirdige mutter für mich Schwester Katherine Repplyn von Hamberg
translation: Praise be to God. Completed on St. Mary Magdalene’s Day. Pray God and Mary his worthy mother for me, Sister Katherine Repplyn of Hamberg (district Pforzheim).

title: Karlsruhe, Badische Landesbibliothek, St. Peter pap. 4; Full manuscript
transcription: f.146: Dasbüch ist swesler Elysabeth Bißnerin zü sanct Katherinen zü Strosburg vnd het sy es selbs geschriben
translation: f.146: "This book belongs to Sister Elizabeth Bisnerin of Saint Catherine's in Strasbourg, and she herself has written it."

title: Karlsruhe, Badische Landesbibliothek, St. Peter Perg. 101; Full manuscript
transcription: S. Agnes Huberin scripsit hoc libr(um). Habeatis iste eius memoriam in oracionibus vestris.
translation: Sister Agnes Huber wrote this book. Keep her in your prayers.

title: Karlsruhe, Badische Landesbibliothek, St. Peter perg. 109; Full manuscript
transcription: 172v Got mache selig zu aller zit Swester Agnes Rössin sei und lip, die dis büchelin bet geschriben und ir zit do mit vertriben. von Christus gebürt zalte sy do MCCCCXXXIX ior
translation: "172v May God bless Sister Agnes Rössin in soul and body, who both wrote and spent her time with this booklet. She was born in the year of Christ's birth, counting from the year 1439."

title: Karlsruhe, Badische Landesbibliothek, St. Peter Perg. 44; Full manuscript
transcription: Professionformula: Ego soror Wunnaborgis offerens trado me ipsam ecclesie sancte Marie...promitto eciam obedenciam in Christo domino Theodorico, prefate ecclesie patri...
translation: I, Sister Wunnaborgis, offering myself, entrust myself to the Church of Saint Mary… I also promise obedience in Christ to Lord Theodoric, father of the aforesaid church…
monastery: Augustinian Canonesse of Neuwerk, Erfurt, Augustinian, Erfurt, Germany

title: Karlsruhe, Badische Landesbibliothek, St. Peter Perg. 72; f. 1-94v
transcription:
Geschriben
und geendet durch soror Agnes Rytzmeni von Ulm, closterfraw in dem closter sant Ulrichs zu
Dillingen predicatorum ordinis. In die sancte Cristina Virginis. Nach Christus (!) gebürt M.CCCCC
und XV Jahr
translation: Written and completed by Sister Agnes Rytzmeni of Ulm, nun in the monastery of St Ulrich at Dillingen of the Order of Preachers, on the feast of St Christina, virgin. After the birth of Christ (!) in the year 1515 (24 August 1515).
monastery:
Saint Ulrich, Dominican, Dillingen on the Danube, Germany, 1318-
1792

title: Karlsruhe, Badische Landesbibliothek, Thennenbach 4; Full manuscript
transcription: hie bi gedenken durch gott Swester Magdalena Steimerin ein unwirdige Swester Sant Clären Ordens die diß buoch geschriben hett mit einem Ave Maria
translation: Hereby, in remembrance, by the grace of God, Sister Magdalena Steimerin, an unworthy Sister of the Order of Saint Clare, who wrote this book, with an Ave Maria.
monastery: Strasbourg, St. Clare's Monastery on the Wörth, Poor Clares, Strasbourg, France

title: Klosterneuburg, Stiftsbibliothek, Ms. 1226; Full manuscript
transcription: f.11r: Agnes von Stain
translation: f.11r: Sister Agnes von Stain sends you this prayer

title: Laon, Bibliothèque municipale, Ms. 362; full manuscript
transcription: "Id est ego Paula Scolaris scripsi istam sommam domino officiali Turonensi" (f.242v)
translation: "That is, I, Paula Scolaris, have written this summary for the Lord Official of Tours." (f.242 verso)

title: Laon, Bibliothèque municipale, Ms.423; Full manuscript
transcription: Colophon f.79v: 'Ego Dulcia scripsi et susscripsi istu[m] libru[m]' (f.79v)
translation: "I, Dulcia, wrote and undersigned this book of the planetary orbits/ liber rotarum"

title: Leiden, Universiteitsbibliotheek, BPL 2541; Full manuscript
transcription: Bidt om gods wil een ave maria voer die scrijverse Dat sy mit gode ewelic moet leven. Item dit boeck is gescreven Int jaer ons heren M C C C C ende lxxxiiii Ende geeynt op [last three words on erasure] sancte mauricius dach. in der stat van susteren daer wi schulende waren al te samen doen ons cloester verbrant was.
translation: Pray, for God’s sake, an Ave Maria for the scribe, that she may live eternally with God. Item: this book was written in the year of Our Lord 1484 and finished on [last three words erased] St Maurice’s Day, in the town of Susteren, where we were all living together as boarders when our cloister had burned down.
monastery: Maaseik Saint Agnes, Benedictine, Maaseik, Belgium, 1429

title: Leiden, Universiteitsbibliotheek, BPL 2879; Full manuscript
transcription: Anno domini Millesimo quadringentesimo Tricessimo octavo. Scriptus et finitus fuit liber iste. In profesto sancti victoris. in monasterio sancte marie ten poel prope leidis ordinis regularium per manus sororis elizabeth de gorinchem. Orate pro ea.
translation: In the year of our Lord one thousand four hundred and thirty-eight, this book was written and completed. On the feast of Saint Victor, in the monastery of Saint Mary ten Poel near Leiden, of the Regular Order, by the hand of Sister Elizabeth de Gorinchem. Pray for her.

title: Leiden, Universiteitsbibliotheek, BPL 46 A; Full manuscript
transcription: Lan Ixxvii fut fait et accomplis par sour Johanne de Malone cest legent dore manant a sains victore. Dit pour son ame Requiescant in pace Amen.
translation: In the year 77 of the reign of Louis, this was made and completed by Sister Johanne de Malone, this reading gift to Saint Victor. Said for her soul. May they rest in peace. Amen.
monastery: Saint Victor-a-Huy, Benedictine, Huy, Belgium, 1144

title: Leiden, Universiteitsbibliotheek, BPL 48 E; Full manuscript
transcription: Biidt om godts willen voer den scriiver die dit heeft ghescreven want sii is eerm van duechden blesen. Dit sii goede bequaem Suster Mariiken Wouters van breda is heren naem
translation: Pray for the writer, for God’s sake, who has written this, for she is blessed with virtues. This being the good and capable Sister Mariiken Wouters of Breda, in the name of the Lord.
monastery: Great Beguinage in Malines, Mechelen/Malines, Netherlands

title: Leiden, Universiteitsbibliotheek, Letterk. 219; Full manuscript
transcription: f.195: Dit boec heeft ghescreven Suster alijt lambert dochter op sommighefeest daghen intjaer ons heren M iiiic ende lxxvia Bidt voer haer om gods willen.
translation: This book was written by Sister Alijt Lambert's daughter on certain feast days in the year of our Lord 1466. Pray for her for God's sake.
monastery: Saint Ursula's Tertiaries, Amsterdam, Netherlands

title: Leiden, Universiteitsbibliotheek, Letterk. 235; Full manuscript
transcription: Dit boeck ende solter is gheeyndiget in dat jaer ons heren dusent vijfhundert ende sovenendetwintich des vridaghes voor jubilate, s.d.
translation: This book and psalter were completed in the year of Our Lord one thousand five hundred and twenty-seven, on the Friday before Jubilate, etc.
monastery: Monastery of Germania, Thesinge, Benedictine, Thesinge, Netherlands

title: Leiden, Universiteitsbibliotheek, Letterk. 240; Full manuscript
transcription: Dit boec is wt Gog si geloeft Bid om gods willen een pater noster ende een Ave Maria voer Margriete van Beleyn(s) dochter diet gescreven heeft.
translation: This book is with God, His will. Pray to God, for God’s sake, one Our Father and one Hail Mary for Margriete van Beleyn(s) daughter who has written this.
monastery: Saint Agnes, convent of, Delft, Netherlands

title: Leiden, Universiteitsbibliotheek, Letterk. 306; f. 1-120
transcription: Dit boeck heeft ghescreven Margriete Iheronimus dochter ter eeren gods ende sijn lievever moeder bidt voer haer om gods wil een Ave Maria.
translation: This book was written by Margriete, daughter of Iheronimus, in honor of God and His dear mother. Pray for her, for God’s sake, with an Ave Maria.
monastery: Elfduizend Maagden, Warmond, Warmond, Netherlands

title: Leiden, Universiteitsbibliotheek, Letterk. 354; Full manuscript
transcription: Die heeft ghescreven Maritgen Ijans dochter stom ende doef gheboren bit voer haer om gods villen
translation: This was written by Maritgen, daughter of Ijan, born mute and deaf; pray for her for God’s sake.

title: Leiden, Universiteitsbibliotheek, Letterk. 604; Full manuscript
transcription: Gescreve, int jaer ons heren M vc en XXXI des enderen dages geernt na des heiligen cruys verheffinge bidt om gods wil voer die scryffester een ave maria. Suster mary groters
translation: Written in the year of our Lord 1531 on the evening of the day after the exaltation of the Holy Cross. Pray for the scribe's soul, an Ave Maria. Sister Mary Groters.
monastery: Ten Orten, the house of the Brothers and Sisters of the Common Life, ’s-Hertogenbosch, s-Hertogenbosch, Netherlands

title: Leiden, Universiteitsbibliotheek, Voss lat. 8°; Full manuscript
transcription: f.40: Hic liber est scriptus: qui scripserit Helene dictus.
translation: “This book is written by: the one called Helene.”

title:
Leipzig, Deutsches Buch- und Schriftmuseum
derDeutschen Bücherei, Klemm-Sammlung, Ms.Klemm-Sammlung I, 104; Full manuscript
transcription: f.275v: Item In dem M cccc vnd lxxxj. ior wart geschriben vnd vsbereit dis büchli vor dem hochgezit Annunciacione marie von schwester Elysabeth schriberin [Randnachtrag: oder voͤgtin] der gedenckent durch gott
translation: 275v: Also in the year 1481 this booklet was written and prepared for the wedding of the Annunciation of Mary by Sister Elisabeth, scribe [margin note: or prioress], remembering through God

title: Leipzig, Universitätsbibliothek, Rep. II. 157b; Full manuscript
transcription: f.158: Von xpi gepurt 1511 jar han ich Ursula Heckin diss biechlin geschriben.
translation: “Since the birth of Christ, in the year 1511, I, Ursula Heckin, have written this little book.”

title: Linköping City Library, T 229; Full manuscript
transcription: f.37v: “Thässen bok aer skriffuet uppå thz perman som systr birgitta iohannis gudmundi aategudh alzwallogher the siälena miskwnne bidhin kära systra för henne oc glömen ey mik sum skreff oc wrt thenna bok lyktat oppa sancte michaells affton anno domino MDXVII gudh till hedher oc edher almaent oppa badha chora till hugnat”.
translation: “This book is written on the parchment owned by Sister Birgitta Johannis Gudhmundi. May God, all-merciful, have mercy on her soul. Dear sisters, pray for her and do not forget me, who wrote this book, which was completed on the eve of Saint Michael, in the year of our Lord 1517, to the honor of God and for the spiritual benefit of you all, both in the choir and beyond.”
monastery:
Vadstena Abbey, Bridgettine, Vadstena, Sweden, 1346-
1595

title: Lisbon, Biblioteca Nacional de Portugal, LC 117; Full manuscript
transcription: “Este livro he do moesteiro de nossa sñra da anunciada de Lixboa e mãdou fazer a Madre dona britiz de meneses segũda p[ri]oressa e p[ri]meira deste moesteiro foi scripto he acabado no ano de < > por soror antonia indi[g]na serva das servas de deus” (f.72v.)
translation: “This book belongs to the monastery of Our Lady of the Annunciation of Lisbon and was commissioned by Mother Dona Britiz de Meneses, second prioress and first of this monastery. It was written and completed in the year of < > by Sister Antonia Indi[g]na, servant of the servants of God.” (f.72v.)
monastery: Convent of Anunciada in Lisbon, Lisbon, Portugal

title: Lisbon, Biblioteca Nacional de Portugal, LC 123; Full manuscript
transcription: Este livro he do moisteiro de nossa senhora da nũncida de Lisboa. Mãdou escrever A Madre dona britiz de meneses segũda priuresa E_p[r]imey[ra] deste moistey[ro] foi acabado na era de. M. [et] b [et] l p. Soror antonia escrava das servas de deus
translation:
This book belongs to the monastery of Our Lady of the Annunciation of Lisbon. It was commissioned by Mother Dona Britiz de Meneses, second prioress and first of this monastery, and was completed in the year of M. [and] B. [and] L. p. Sister Antonia, servant of the servants of God.
... it was finished in the year 1550 by sister Antónia, slave of the Lord's servants?
monastery: Convent of Anunciada in Lisbon, Lisbon, Portugal

title: Lisbon, Biblioteca Nacional de Portugal, LC 133; Full manuscript
transcription: “Este livro he do moisteiro de nossa senhora da anunciada mandou escrever a madre dona britiz de menezes segũda p[ri]oreza e p[ri]meira deste moisteiro a honra e louvor do Senhor foi acabado nesta era de mil e b lj p. Soror antonia indigna serva do Senhor mandou encadernar ho muito v[ir]tuoso bastiã dias” (f.105v)
translation: “This book belongs to the monastery of Our Lady of the Annunciation. It was commissioned by Mother Dona Britiz de Menezes, second prioress and first of this monastery, for the honor and praise of the Lord. It was completed in the era of 1500 and something. Sister Antonia, unworthy servant of the Lord, ordered it to be bound by the very virtuous Bastiã Dias.”
monastery: Convent of Anunciada in Lisbon, Lisbon, Portugal

title: London, British Library, Add. 11847; Full manuscript
transcription: Hie niemet diz ende nv lobe dines lieben kindes Alheide hende.
translation: Here we come to an end, so commend the hands of you dear child Alheide.

title: London, British Library, Add. 15103; Full manuscript
transcription: Item Das buch Jst usz geschriben worden an der octa[vo] omnium Sanctorum do man zalt Nach unsers lieben herren geburt Mcccco und Jn dem lxxxviij Jar vnd hat es geschriben Schwester Martha felderin zu nutz gem gotz husz zu Madlingen bregier orden.
translation: Also, this book was written on the octave of All Saints, in the year 1488 after the birth of our dear Lord. And it was written by Sister Martha Felderin for the benefit of God's house in Madlingen, Brigittine order.
monastery:
Maria Medingen, Dominican, Mödingen, Germany, 1246-
1542

title: London, British Library, Add. 16950; Full manuscript
transcription: Finito libro laus sit Christo. Orate pro scriba que scripsit hunc librum. Nomen eius Elysabeth
translation: Finished the book, praise be to Christ. Pray for the scribe who wrote this book. Her name is Elizabeth.

title: London, British Library, Add. 1847; Full manuscript
transcription: p. 329: Finito libro laus sit xpo. Orate pro scriba que scripsit hunc librum nomen eius Elizabeth. 1260 Bey erster frau abbatissin Agnes graddin Preyssing dis grosse ambt buech geschriben worden von kloster frau Elizabetha. 1462 Hat auch eine closter frau Elisabetha Hyttlen das Gradual Buech verfertiget war 35 jahr cantorin.
translation:
“With the book finished, praise be to Christ. Pray for the scribe who wrote this book; her name is Elizabeth.
In 1260, under the first abbess, Agnes Graddin von Preyssing, this great office book was written by the nun Elizabeth.
In 1462, another nun, Elizabeth Hyttlen, also completed the Gradual Book. She served as cantor for 35 years.”

title: London, British Library, Add. 21984; Full manuscript
transcription: Ego Hippolyta Maria Vicecomes filia Ill[ustrissi]mi principis Francisci Sforciae ducis Mediolani exscripsi mea manu hunc libellum sub tempus pueritiae meae et sub Baldo praeceptore anno a natali christiano MCCCCLVIII octavo idus iulias
translation: I, Ippolita Maria Visconti, daughter of the most illustrious prince Francesco Sforza, Duke of Milan, wrote this little book in my hand around the time of my childhood and under my tutor Baldo, 8 July 1458

title: London, British Library, Add. 22562; Full manuscript
transcription: Expliciunt Deo laus omnipotenti-quinque libri de vita et conuersatione sanctorum patrum scripti per manus sororum Aue Trici et Gheeze Ysenoudi in festiuis diebus suis consororibus dilectis in memoriam earum. Finiti anno domini MoCCCCo XLIXo in festo decollationis sancti Johannis Baptiste ante summam missam. Et habebat ad hoc pergamenum sibi ex caritate prouisum de venerabili presbitero domino nycolao Wyt tunc temporis earundem patre spirituali et sibi ipsius spirtualiter ac in domino sat reuerenter dilectio...
translation: Here ends. To God be praise Almighty – the five books about the life and conduct of the holy fathers, written by the hands of sisters Aue Trici and Gheeze Ysenoudi, on their feast days, for their beloved fellow sisters, in their memory. Finished in the year of our Lord 1449, on the feast of the beheading of Saint John the Baptist before High Mass. And for this purpose, she had parchment provided for her out of charity by the venerable priest Lord Nicholas Wyt, at that time their spiritual father and, with great reverence, her spiritual father in the Lord...
monastery: Canonesses Regular of St. Margaret, Gouda, Augustinian, Gouda, Netherlands

title: London, British Library, Add. 25904; Full manuscript
transcription: f.210v: "Item diit boeck is volscreven int jaer ons heren vijftien hondert ende xxx ende heeft geeynt op sante antonys avont ende heeft gescreven suster foelsken hoeymans diet uut mynnen om gods wil int sieck huys gescreven heeft in hoeren enen tachtichsten jaren een Ave maria uut mynnen om gods wil."
translation: "Also, this book was fully written in the year of our Lord fifteen hundred and thirty, and was completed on the eve of Saint Anthony, and it was written by Sister Foelsken Hoeymans, who wrote it out of love for God, in the infirmary, in her eighty-first year. An Ave Maria out of love for God."

title: London, British Library, Egerton 675; Full manuscript
transcription: Dit booc is gescreven int iaer ons heren MCCCC ende lxi op sinte leonaerdus dach gheeyndet
translation: This book was written in the year of Our Lord 1461, completed on the feast day of Saint Leonard.

title: London, British Library, Harley 2975; Full manuscript
transcription: Soror Modesta me scripsit Deo gracias.
translation: Sister Modesta wrote me. Thanks be to God.

title: London, British Library, Harley 3099; Full manuscript
transcription: Hec sunt nomina illarum quae scripserunt librum istum. / Gerdrut. Sibilia. Dierwic. Walderat. Hadewic. / Lugart. Derta (or Ota). Cunigunt. Ipse namque scripserunt mo/nasteriensibus dominis quatinus deum pro eis rogent ut a pe/nis eas liberet & in paradyso collocet. Quisquis eis ab/stulerit anatematizatus sit'
translation: These are the names of those who wrote this book: Gerdrut, Sibilia, Dierwic, Walderat, Hadewic, Lugart, Derta (or Ota), Cunigunt. They wrote it for the lords of the monastery so that they may pray to God for them to be liberated from punishment and placed in paradise. Whoever takes it away from them shall be cursed.

title: London, Lambeth Palace Library, Ms. 546; Full manuscript
transcription: f.55r: Good Syster of your charyte I you pray remember the scrybeler when that ye may wit/i on aue maria or els thys swete word ihesu have marcy on my wreched syster whose name by the marcy of god rj trust"1 shall be wrytyn In the boke of lyfe Good deuote Syster I pray you to lerne thys lesson well of your master our sauyour cryst ihesu that sayth lerne of me for I am mylde and meke in hart and pray for me that I may do and haue the same
translation: "f.55r: Good sister, in your charity, I pray you to remember the scribe when you may, with an Ave Maria or else this sweet word: 'Jhesu, have mercy on my wretched sister, whose name, by the mercy of God, I trust shall be written in the book of life.' Good devout sister, I pray you to learn this lesson well from your master, our Savior Christ Jhesu, who says, 'Learn of me, for I am mild and meek in heart,' and pray for me that I may do and have the same."
monastery:
Syon abbey, Bridgettine, Isleworth, United Kingdom, 1414-
1539

title: Lübeck, Stadtbibliothek, Ms. theol. lat. 2° 33; Full manuscript
transcription: Cum ageretur a partu virginis annus vicesimus secundus post mille quingentos scripsit librum hunc soror Magdalena Buxtehuden hic regulari professione Christo dicata. Sumptus provenere ex diversis fidelium elemosinis. Exoretur deus pro omnibus qui manus hoc porrexere adiutrices.
translation:
When the 22nd year after the birth of the Virgin’s Son was being counted (i.e., in the year 1522), this book was written by Sister Magdalena Buxtehuden, here consecrated to Christ by religious profession.
The costs were covered by various offerings from the faithful.
May God be entreated on behalf of all who extended helping hands in this work.
monastery:
St. Anne's Priory, Augustinian, Lübeck, Germany, 1502-
1532

title: Lübeck, Stadtbibliothek, Ms. theol. lat. 2° 34; Full manuscript
transcription: Anno verbi incarnati supra millesimum quingentesimum vicesimo donatus est liber hic monasterio beatissime Anne ex pia largitione honesti viri et civis Lubicani cui nomen Hans Grothe
monastery:
St. Anne's Priory, Augustinian, Lübeck, Germany, 1502-
1532

title: Lucerne, Provincial Archives of the Swiss Capuchins, PAL L; Full manuscript
transcription: (f.126r) Hie ist volendet di legend von sand Franciscen. Die hat geschriben Elspet von Amberk in den iar, do man zalt von Chistes geburt tausent und driuhundert und in dem xxxvij iar. So hat Katerina von Purchhausen geschriben di legend von sancto Antonio. Und diu was in den lxvij iar alt, da si di legend schreip. Und di legend wurden peid geschriben vnd erleuht und volpraht nah sand Bartholomeus des na’htes tages. Swer di legend les, der pit got fur si, und fur [durchgestrichen] vᵒch fur di, di daz permeid und daz pinten habent verrihte, daz uns Got allen helfe zu den erlichen scharen des lieben herren sand Franciscen und der werden frowen sand Chlaren. Amen.
translation: (f.126r) Here ends the legend of Saint Francis. This was written by Elspet von Amberk in the year counted from Christ's birth as one thousand three hundred and thirty-seven. Then Katerina von Purchhausen wrote the legend of Saint Anthony. She was sixty-seven years old when she wrote the legend. The legends were completed, illuminated, and perfected after Saint Bartholomew's day at night. Whoever reads the legend, pray to God for her, and for [crossed out] also for those who have sponsored and arranged it, may God help us all to the honorable company of the beloved Saint Francis and the venerable lady Saint Clare. Amen.

title: Luik, Gent, Universiteitsbibliotheek, 2328; Full manuscript
transcription:
f.301v = tweede schutblad achterin verso: “Suster Johanna moys de ruremunda Des selichen meyster Joahn moys van breda doctoer dochter Geeynt Int Jaer ons heren MV[c] ende iiii in die maent Marcius Mit ons selfss hand Deo gracias semper” 
f.301v = tweede schutblad achterin verso (doorgestreept): “Magdalena moys de colonia, Des selichen meyster Johan moys van breda doctoer dochter”
translation:
"f.301v = second endpaper at the back, verso: "Sister Johanna Moys from Roermond, daughter of the blessed Master Johan Moys from Breda, doctor. Completed in the year of our Lord 1504, in the month of March. With our own hand. Thanks be to God forever."

f.301v = second endpaper at the back, verso (crossed out): "Magdalena Moys from Cologne, daughter of the blessed Master Johan Moys from Breda, doctor's daughter.""

title: Milan, Biblioteca Ambrosiana, 11 (587); Full manuscript
transcription: Scritto di sua mano della B. Catharina da Bologna
translation: Written in her own hand by Blessed Catherine of Bologna.

title: Milan, Biblioteca Nazionale Braidense, AF.IX.68; Full manuscript
transcription: f.112r: Finito libro laus sit gloria Christo. Hunc Comitisa virens annis teneraque inventa / transcripsit librum Matre favente Dei. Vivida quam virtus radiat celerisque propago / exornatque decor atque pudicitia.
translation:
“With the book finished, let praise and glory be to Christ.
This book was transcribed by a young countess, blooming in years and tender of age, with the favor of the Mother of God.
Lively virtue shines in her, swift descent adorns her, as do grace and modesty.”

title: Milan, Biblioteca Nazionale Braidense, Gerli 60; Full manuscript
transcription: f.325r: Iste liber scriptus est per manus sororis Margarete Blocs quae ipsum finivit circa festum Gereonis, Victoris et aliorum martirum anno Domini M CCCC L II. Oretis pro ea propter Deum.
translation:
f.325r:
“This book was written by the hand of Sister Margarete Blocs, who completed it around the feast of Gereon, Victor, and the other martyrs, in the year of our Lord 1452. Pray for her, for the sake of God.”

title: Ms. 365; Full manuscript
transcription: a.d. 1473 iar ist disz puch auszgeschriben worden von s. Durothea Reichingen und gehort in daz closter zu Medingen prediger ord
translation: “In the year of our Lord 1473, this book was written by Sister Dorothea Reichingen and belongs to the Dominican monastery at Medingen.”

title: Munich, Bayerische Staatsbibliothek, Cgm 5139; Full manuscript
transcription: 128r: Els
translation: 128r: Els

title: Munich, Bayerische Staatsbibliothek, Cgm 516; Full manuscript
transcription: identity of colophon with Cgm 518. Item das puch ward auSSgeschr[iben] am mitwoch vor sant Merteins tag als man zelt von cristus (203vb) gepurt M CCCC und in dem LIX iar Und das hat geschriben die Barbra Gew/3/derin alles mit iren henden Got der helf ir das sy das ervolg mit irem leben nach dem liebsten willen gotes Des helf mir got der vater und der sun und der heilig geist amen. AQI (and discussed by) Schneider 1975 217.
translation:
Colophon (Cgm 518, f.203vb):
“This book was written out on the Wednesday before Saint Martin’s Day, in the year of Christ 1459. And it was written by Barbara Gew…derin entirely with her own hands. May God help her to live according to His most loving will. May God the Father, the Son, and the Holy Spirit help me in this. Amen.”

title: Munich, Bayerische Staatsbibliothek, Cgm 518; Full manuscript
transcription: Schwester Anna Zinerin 1470
translation: “Sister Anna Zinerin, 1470.”

title: Munich, Bayerische Staatsbibliothek, Cgm 5234; Full manuscript
transcription: Liber Bartholomeus ich bekenn und waiss daz ir ain fraind seit gelerter lu"tt...so han ich... aus latein zu teuschtz pracht (229r)--SHE TRANSLATED!; COLOPHON (241r): Siech und schweig, hör und leid, Sich und schweig, hoer und leid ... so bistu güt. Scriptum et finitum per me sororem Elisabeth Warrüßin professe in cenobio sante Katherine ordinis predicatorum anno clomini M°CCCC°LXXIII in vigilia sanctorum Fabiani et Sebastiani martirum (=19. Jan.). Sit laus deo, 1473.01.19, 1473 (Initium for the treatise is "siech und schwieg...")
translation:
Translation Note (f.229r): “Book of Bartholomew: I acknowledge and know that you are a friend, a learned person… so I have translated it from Latin into German.”

Colophon (f.241r):

“See and be silent, listen and endure. See and be silent, listen and endure… and thus you will be good.”
(This is also the incipit of the treatise: “siech und schwieg…”)

“Written and completed by me, Sister Elisabeth Warrüßin, professed in the convent of Saint Katherine of the Order of Preachers, in the year of our Lord 1473, on the vigil of Saints Fabian and Sebastian, martyrs (i.e. January 19).”

“Praise be to God.”

title: Munich, Bayerische Staatsbibliothek, Cgm 5235; Full manuscript
transcription: f.157rb: Lysa
translation: f.157rb: Lysa

title: Munich, Bayerische Staatsbibliothek, Cgm 5244; Full manuscript
transcription: 109v Gedenckt der schreiberin mit einem salve regina.
translation: f.109v: “Remember the woman scribe with a Salve Regina.”

title: Munich, Bayerische Staatsbibliothek, Cgm 5292; Full manuscript
transcription: 211r: Anna Jäckin, prioress of the Augustinian choir women's monastery in Inzigkofen
translation: 211r: Anna Jäckin, prioress of the Augustinian choir women's monastery in Inzigkofen

title: Munich, Bayerische Staatsbibliothek, Cgm 65; Full manuscript
transcription: f.164r: Schlußschrift 'Das puch hat geschriben swester adelheydis strosserin zu lob vnd eren got dem almehtigen vnd dem heiligen vater sant franciscen vnd zu trost dem couent leueterlich durch got vnd ist uolent worden da man zalt von Christi gepurt MCCCCXLIIII Jar zu sant franciscen tag.'
translation: f.164r: Conclusion inscription 'This book was written by Sister Adelheidis Strosserin for the praise and honor of God Almighty and the Holy Father St. Francis and for the comfort of the convent, faithfully through God, and was completed in the year of Christ's birth 1444 on St. Francis' day.'
monastery:
Saint Klara, Poor Clares, Nuremberg, Germany,-
1525

title: Munich, Bayerische Staatsbibliothek, Cgm 7264; Full manuscript
transcription: VD (a. 1478 in Medingen).

title: Munich, Bayerische Staatsbibliothek, Cgm 750; Full manuscript
transcription: f.Iv: Gedenckt der lieben unser geislich muter Anna Ebyn die daz puch und gar und vil pu/e/cher dem convent hat geschriben die ungezelt sind (librarian's entry). Also, on 1r, librarian has written "Daz puch ist der ffrawen zu Pillennrewt und sol allczeit pey dem clostr beleyben. In the 4th item (14v-24r), Joh. von Marienwerder's 37 Zeichen der Gottesliebe der Dorothea von Montau, Anna Ebin announces "Aber an eim roten puch da etlich heyligen an steen (=Wolf cod. 17.9.Aug.4o, see Ringler VL 2nd ed 2, 295 and MTU 72 s. 55-57) hab ich dy geschriben ... alz ez meister Nycloz prediger zum newen spital zu Nurmberg Dorothee peichtigers schulgesell beschryben hat. (15r). For 9th item, Schwesternbuch von Weiler, colophon reads "Geendet am eritag nach der h. trinitat in die Marci und Marcelliani (=18 June) anno domini M. CCCC. LIIII. im covent zu Bildenrew/e/t. At end of 17th item (145r-174v), Vita of H. Eufrasia, dt. von Kaspar KreSS, "Geendet am freytag nach dem achten tag dez obersten in die sancte Prysce ... anno domini M. CCCC. LX. (=18 Jan)... Pitet got fu"r dye schreyberin und auch fu"r den dew"tschmacher diser legend eins gelerten pryster sanct Benedicten ordens zu sancto Egydigio (!) zu Nu"rmbeg genant mgr. C. Kr. (=Kaspar KreSS). A SECOND HAND COPIED Item 22 (252v-274v) shows that she consciously copied this as a "buchlein" -- in sections. For Bonaventura, De quinque festivitatibus pueri Jesu (dt), she says "Also hat ende das puchelein wi Yesus Xc kind ist worden und entfangen geportn geislich etc. 1461

title: Munich, Bayerische Staatsbibliothek, Cgm 851; Full manuscript
transcription: f.17v: Engla[ri]n
translation: f.17v: Engla[ri]n

title: Munich, Bayerische Staatsbibliothek, Clm 10899; Full manuscript
transcription: Anno Domini MCCCCLXXVI scriptus est hic liber per manus sororis Katherina Mast monialis per fessae in valle ducis orate pro ea propter Deum ex caritate. Pro monasterio Villariensi.
translation: In the year of our Lord 1476, this book was written by the hand of Sister Katherina Mast, nun of the monastery of Fessae in the valley of the duke. Pray for her for the sake of God out of charity. For the monastery of Villariensi.

title: Munich, Bayerische Staatsbibliothek, Clm 10929; Full manuscript
transcription: (77r) Qui me scribebat Elisabeth nomen habebat petit unum Ave Maria soror Susanna und (144v) Soror ELISABET DE SENGIN
translation: "(77r) The one who was writing me, Elisabeth, had the name. Pray one Ave Maria. Sister Susanna. And (144v) Sister ELISABET DE SENGIN."

title: Munich, Bayerische Staatsbibliothek, Clm 10930; Full manuscript
transcription: (Scripsit Dorothea de Mittelhusen c. a.1449.)
translation: ”(Written by Dorothea of Mittelhusen around the year 1449.)”

title: Munich, Bayerische Staatsbibliothek, Clm 11004; Full manuscript
transcription:
Latin (Verse Colophon):
“Materia libri fecit Diemuod pia scribi.
Sancto Ruoberto celi pro munere certo.
Celestis vite scribant in ordine scribe.”
translation:
“The content of the book was caused to be written by the pious Diemuod,
As a sure offering to Saint Rupert of Heaven.
May the scribes be written in the ranks of heavenly life.”

title: Munich, Bayerische Staatsbibliothek, Clm 17052; Full manuscript
transcription: f.214v "Scripsit Sophya"
translation: f.214v: “Sophya wrote [this].”
monastery: Schäftlarn Abbey, Schäftlarn, Germany

title: Munich, Bayerische Staatsbibliothek, Clm 17053; Full manuscript
transcription: f.108v "Sophia scripsit"
translation: f.108v: Sophia wrote [this].
monastery: Schäftlarn Abbey, Schäftlarn, Germany

title: Munich, Bayerische Staatsbibliothek, Clm 17087; Full manuscript
transcription: f.223v: Scripsit soror Irmengart obtentu praepositi Hainrici
translation: f.223v: Sister Irmengart wrote [this] at the request of Provost Heinrich.
monastery: Schäftlarn Abbey, Schäftlarn, Germany

title: Munich, Bayerische Staatsbibliothek, Clm 17116; Full manuscript
transcription: Iste liber pertinet ad sanctum Dyonisium (scestla ren TBD) quem scripsit soror Irmengart obtentu domi. Hainrici prepositi.
translation: "This book belongs to Saint Dionysius (sceptrum TBD), written by Sister Irmengart by the order of Dom Hainricus, the provost."
monastery: Schäftlarn Abbey, Schäftlarn, Germany

title: Munich, Bayerische Staatsbibliothek, Clm 23014; Full manuscript
transcription: a. 1499 die s. Ambrosii ego soror Dorothea Derietheain professa monasterii mariae in Medlingen O.P. mandato Margarethae Schlicherin priorissae incepi Graduale istud de tempore quod complevi a. 1500 altera Assumptionis Mariae ...
translation: “In the year 1499, on the feast of Saint Ambrose, I, Sister Dorothea Derietheain, professed in the monastery of Mary in Medlingen, of the Order of Preachers, began this Gradual for the Temporal cycle at the command of Prioress Margaretha Schlicherin, and I completed it in the year 1500, on the day after the Assumption of Mary.”

title: Munich, Bayerische Staatsbibliothek, Clm 23046; Full manuscript
transcription: (Imago Adelhaidis quae codicem scripsit); Hernad 2000 p. 45 transcribes the text "Finis adest operis mercedem posco laboris. Et qui me scribebat Adelhaidis nomen habebat. Sanctus Bernhardus. Dominus noster Jhesus Christus ipse erit merces tua, fiat fiat." (144r); Adelhaid is before Hl. Bernhard.
translation: “The end of the work is here, I ask for the reward of my labor. And the one who wrote me had the name Adelhaid. Saint Bernard. Our Lord Jesus Christ himself will be your reward, let it be, let it be.”

title: Munich, Bayerische Staatsbibliothek, Clm 23166; Full manuscript
transcription: Scripsit Iuliana Friesingerin
translation: “Written by Juliana Friesingerin.”

title: Munich, Bayerische Staatsbibliothek, Clm 23172; Full manuscript
transcription: Sprecht der schreiberin ein Ave Maria, dem pintter auch so vil, und ein gutz iar.
translation: Say an Ave Maria for the writer, and to the painter as well, and a good year.

title: Munich, Bayerische Staatsbibliothek, Clm 23287; Full manuscript
transcription: Swer diz buch hab der gedench ... der armen swester Agnes von Waldeke ... (sequuntur versus) ... Gedencht auch ... Adelheid von Smaehing din diez buoch hat geschriben.
translation: Whoever has this book, remember … the poor Sister Agnes of Waldeke … (following verses) … Also remember … Adelheid of Smaehing, this book has been written by her.

title: Munich, Bayerische Staatsbibliothek, Clm 23453; Full manuscript
transcription: Scriptus per me Barfabri (?) dictum Haribaudet
translation: “Written by me, Barfabri (?) called Haribaudet.”

title: Munich, Bayerische Staatsbibliothek, Clm 28638; Full manuscript
transcription: (1r) das ist der erst vnd scholt vorn styn (getilgt); (13r) dis ist der ander sechstern vund geho"rt nach dem hernach (405v) des puchs ist als XXXV sechstern. THOSE ARE STRUCTURAL COMMENTS, THE BOOK IS BOUND IN SEXTERNS. Colophon (405v): Das puch ward auSS geschriben an der helligen marter tag Johannes vnd Paulus tag als man zalt von Christus gepurt MCCCC. vnd ym L(X)XVII jar (erste X getilgt). Item das puch hot geschriben swester Hrabra Pfinczigin in Bilenrewt sancti Augustini ordinis regularium cananicarum czu lob vnd ere der ho"hsten trinitat vnd wer das nu"czt der gedenk ir gen got ym leben vnd todt was in got vermant etc.
translation:
(1r) This is the first and sold in the section (erased); (13r) This is the second section and follows from the next (405v) of the book, as it contains XXXV sections.

Colophon (405v): This book was completed on the feast day of the Holy Martyrs John and Paul, according to the reckoning from the birth of Christ, 1500, and in the year L(X)XVII (the first X erased). Furthermore, this book was written by Sister Hrabra Pfinczigin in Bilenrewt, of the Order of Saint Augustine, Regular Canons, for the praise and glory of the Most Holy Trinity, and for the remembrance of her and her service to God in life and death, may she be united with God, etc.

title: Munich, Bayerische Staatsbibliothek, Clm 2931; Full manuscript
transcription: per sororem Annam Zinerin huius monasterii priorissam" (194v)
translation: by Sister Anna Zinerin, Prioress of this monastery (194v)

title: Munich, Bayerische Staatsbibliothek, Clm 2932; Full manuscript
transcription: (... per sororem Annam Zineris monast. Altmu"nster priorissam pulcherrime exaratus a. 1478 et seq.)
translation: (… by Sister Anna Zineris of the Monastery of Altmünster, Prioress, beautifully written in the year 1478 and following years.)

title: Munich, Bayerische Staatsbibliothek, Clm 8055; Full manuscript
transcription: (Scripsit Ursula de Braittenstain professa in Kirchain)
translation: “Written by Ursula of Braittenstain, professed in Kirchhain.”

title: Münster, Staatsarchiv, Ms. 366; Full manuscript
transcription: Istum libellum scripsit soror Druda de Elfenhusen O.F.P. in paradyso ad instanciam fr. Iacobi de Duzenberg.
translation: “This little book was written by Sister Druda of Elfenhusen, O.F.P. (Order of Friars Preachers), in paradise, at the request of Brother Iacobus de Duzenberg.”

title: Müstair, Klosterarchiv, I Nr. 48a; Full manuscript
Namur, Musée Archéologique, Fonds de la Ville 92; Full manuscript
transcription: f.204: Deo gratias. In den iaren ons here 1470 op sent Severyns dach is dyt boech geendichet ind gescreven durch suster Gertgenken van Duren woenende zo Wenauwen.
translation: “Thanks be to God. In the year of our Lord 1470, on the feast day of Saint Severin, this book was completed and written by Sister Gertgenken of Duren, living in Wenauwen.”

title: New Haven, Beinecke Library, Yale University, Ms. 968; Full manuscript
transcription:
f.173v: Daz puchlein war aussgeschriben m cccc lxvi jar von Sv. Vrsula Geyßherin pit gat finsy
f.238r: Vrs gey
translation:
f.173v: This little book was written out in the year 1466 by Sister Ursula Geiselherin. Pray to God for her.
f.238r: Ursula Geiselher
monastery: Saint Katharina, Dominican, Nuremberg, Germany, 1295

title: New York, Columbia Univ. Rare Book and Manuscript Library, X.242.1.S; Full manuscript
transcription: f.207v: Zu lobe und erwurdikeit des almehtigen gottes ouch umb willen eins gemeinen nutzes der andechtigen swester des ordens sant marie magdalene sust genant der orden der ruwerin So hat geschriben dis buechelin Katherina Ingolt ein swester des selben ordens und conuentes zu strossburg mit irer hant grossem ernst flis und arbeit und hat daz volbroht mit der hilff gottes uff sant Thiburcius und valerianus tag Anno domini M cccc lxxxv
translation: f.207v: “In praise and honor of Almighty God, and also for the common benefit of the devout sisters of the Order of Saint Mary Magdalene, also called the Order of the Penitents, this little book was written by Katherina Ingolt, a sister of this same order and convent in Strasbourg, with her own hand, with great diligence, effort, and labor. She completed it with God’s help on the feast day of Saints Tiburtius and Valerian, in the year of our Lord 1485.”

title: New York, Union Theological Seminary Library, Ms. 42; Full manuscript
transcription: f.198r: Anna Franckensteyn monasterii Fontis Sanctae Mariae in Weydas
translation: f.198r: “Anna Franckensteyn of the Monastery of the Fountain of Saint Mary in Weydas.”

title: Nijmegen, Regionaal Archief Nijmegen, ms. I a 23; Full manuscript
transcription: f.339: Dit boec is gescreven ende geeint int jaer ons heren M cccc vijftich des vridachs voer (sinte) Michiel. Bid om gods wi[ll] voer der scrijfster Ave maria.
translation: This book was written and completed in the year of our Lord 1450, on the Friday before (Saint) Michael's. Pray for God's will for the scribe (woman). Hail Mary.

title: Nijmegen, Regionaal Archief Nijmegen, ms. I a 28; Full manuscript
transcription: f.140v: Hier eynden die ierste twe nocturnen van davids psalter mitten glosen ende wert volscreven int jaer ons heren xv(c) ende iij Op sce Joriens avent Een ave marien van mynnen om gods wil voer Suster Stijn van rade.
translation: Here end the first two nocturnes of David's Psalter with the glosses, and it was completed in the year of our Lord 1503, on Saint George's Eve. A Hail Mary from my love for God's will for Sister Stijn van Rade.

title: Nijmegen, Regionaal Archief Nijmegen, ms. I a 29; Full manuscript
transcription: f.342v: Item dit boeck is volscreven int Jaer ons heren vijftien hondert ende vier opten heiligen derthien avont een ave maria voer suster foels hoeymans die dit boeck uit mynnen ende om gods wil gescreven heeft. (Other contemporary hand): Item dit boeck hoert te nymegen opten heesen berch anders geheiten sce peters berch den susteren vander dorder regelen sce franciscus.
translation: lso, this book was completed in the year of our Lord fifteen hundred and four, on the evening of the thirteenth, a Hail Mary for Sister Foels Hoeymans, who wrote this book out of love and for God's sake. (Other contemporary hand): Also, this book belongs to Nijmegen, on the Heesen mountain, otherwise known as Saint Peter's mountain, to the sisters of the order of Saint Francis.

title: Nijmegen, Universiteitsbibliotheek, Ms.241; Full manuscript
transcription:
f.274v: Hier neempt eijnde dit boeck ghenoempt dat beelt der duechden ghemaeckt (...) duer den subtijlen ende verlichten doctoor bruer peete (sic) dore van Orliens vander predicaren oerdene. Ende nu overgheset uut Fransoijs int duijtschen int minderbrueren clooster tot Gorcum. 
Desen boeck heeft ons ghedaen te scrijven die Eerweerdighe heere Egidius seghers. den welcken selven eerweerdighen heere heeft dien ghetranslateert uut Fransoijs int duijtsche, ende es ghescreven van mij suster marie vander hochstadt voleijndt in die maent Junius Anno M vc ender lxvij Jhesu Maria. Anna.
flyleaf: tot behoef van convent te Cortenberch. (Other contemporary hand)
translation:
f.274 verso: Here ends this book called "The Image of Virtues" made (...) by the subtle and enlightened doctor Brother Peter of Orléans from the Dominican order. And now translated from French into Dutch in the Minorite Friars' monastery at Gorinchem.

This book was done to be written by the Reverend Sir Egidius Seghers. The same Reverend Sir himself translated it from French into Dutch, and it was written by me, Sister Marie van der Hochstadt, completed in the month of June in the year 1567, Jesus Maria. Anna.

Flyleaf: For the use of the convent at Cortenberch. (Another contemporary hand)

title: Nijmegen, Universiteitsbibliotheek, Ms.306; Full manuscript
transcription: f.172v: Dit boec wort volscreven int jaer ons heren M ccc ende [lxxj (?) corrected in] lxxiij op sinte thimotheeus dach bid voer die susterges diet ghescreven hebben om gods willen
translation: f.172 verso: "This book was fully written in the year of our Lord 1371 on the day of Saint Timothy. Pray for the sisters who have written it for God's sake."

title: Nijmegen, Universiteitsbibliotheek, Ms.310; Full manuscript
transcription: f.339v: Gheeynt op sunte Bonyfacyus dach Int jaer ons heren M cccc hondert ende xvi doer my suster belie hermens gedenct hoerre in uxen gebede
translation: f.339 verso: "Finished on the day of Saint Boniface in the year of our Lord 1416 by me, Sister Belie Hermens. Remember her in your prayers."

title: Nijmegen, Universiteitsbibliotheek, Ms.323; Full manuscript
transcription: Suster Truken collaers schrieft. M cccc liij.
translation: Sister Truken Collaers wrote this. MCCCC LIII.
monastery: Unknown Franciscan House, Franciscan

title: Nr. I, 2035; Full manuscript
transcription:
f.154r: Magdalena von Wickersheim [finitus est iste liber per me sororem Magdalenam de Wickersheim et Canticrem Sitlaub] (Pfleger 1948, S. 61) [Quelle]
f.154r: Singerin Sitlaub [finitus est iste liber per me sororem Magdalenam de Wickersheim et Canticrem Sitlaub] (Pfleger 1948, S. 61) [Quelle]

title: Nuremberg, Germanisches Nationalmuseum, Hs 20718; Full manuscript
transcription: nun wrote it ("obiit min schwester sa/e/lig im xi ia[r]" etc); later ownership on 1v: "Item das bu/o/ch ist Else Haimine gewesen und begeret wer daran mettin bettee das der selb ie alle mal ain requiem bettin zelen
translation: The nun wrote it (“My sister passed away in the [year]”; etc). Later ownership on f.1v: “This book belonged to Else Haimine, and whoever wishes to read it should always pray a requiem for her.”

title: Nuremberg, Germanisches Nationalmuseum, Hs 2261; Full manuscript
transcription:
159v Also ich schreyberin diß püchleins genant Anna E. praeposito in Wildenreut
zu den Zeiten anno domini MCCCCLXVsetz her zu . . .,
translation: "So I, the scribe of this little book named Anna E., to the provost in Wildenreut, at the time in the year of our Lord MCCCCLXV, set to work on this…"

title: Nuremberg, Germanisches Nationalmuseum, Hs 28441; Full manuscript
transcription: 218ra Anno domini M°CCCC0XLVIIII° ant sant Augustinus ottaf do ward disz büch vss geschriben von mir >Korr.: swesterc Anna Jäkin zu den selben ziten pryorin disz gotzhus. Gedenkent ir durch den honyg fließenden süßen namen Jhesus mit ainem aue Maria. Amen.
translation: "In the year of our Lord M°CCCCXLVIIII, on the eve of Saint Augustine, this book was completed by me, Sister Anna Jäkin, prioress of this house of God, at the same time. Remember, by the sweet name of Jesus flowing through honey, with an Ave Maria. Amen."

title: Nuremberg, Germanisches Nationalmuseum, Hs 7205; Full manuscript
transcription: 39r: Orate pro scriptore Elisabet S
translation: f.39r: “Pray for the scribe Elisabeth S[hurstabin].”
monastery: Saint Katharina, Dominican, Nuremberg, Germany, 1295

title: Nuremberg, Stadtbibliothek, Cent. III 85, Nuremberg, Stadtbibliothek, Cent. IV 80, Nuremberg, Stadtbibliothek, Cent. V 29; Ms. Nuremberg, Stadtbibliothek, Cent. III 85, ms. Nuremberg, Stadtbibliothek, Cent. IV 80 and ms. Nuremberg, Stadtbibliothek, Cent. V 29
transcription:
148ra vnd durch meiner mü willen vnd arbaitt willen
wartt ich nicht anders Ions von den lewten neur allain daz si ir andechtige pet hincz dem aller-
parmherczigsten richter für mich vergiessen amen. Diez puch ist geschriben worden do man
czalt noch Xpi vnsers lieben herren gepurd M°CCCC° vnd in dem XXXVI jar an dem
nechsten mitwoch vor dem palmtag (28. März). Pitt got für die schreiberin die dicz puch
geschriben hat.
translation: “For the sake of my toil and effort, I ask nothing else from people except that they pour out their devout prayers to the most merciful judge on my behalf.Amen. This book was written in the year 1436 after the birth of Christ, our dear Lord, on the Wednesday before Palm Sunday (March 28). Pray to God for the female scribe who wrote this book.”
monastery: Saint Katharina, Dominican, Nuremberg, Germany, 1295

title: Nuremberg, Stadtbibliothek, Cent. III 86; Full manuscript
transcription: f.Nach cristi gepurt 1452 Iar habent diss puch geschriben Swester Margaretha Imhof und Swester Margaretha Karteuserin zu nutz iren Kloster czu Sant Kathrein in Nurnberg. Prediger ordens. Pit got für sie.
translation: “After the birth of Christ in the year 1452, this book was written by Sister Margaretha Imhof and Sister Margaretha, a Carthusian, for the benefit of their monastery at St. Kathrein in Nuremberg, of the Order of Preachers. Pray to God for them.”
monastery: Saint Katharina, Dominican, Nuremberg, Germany, 1295

title: Nuremberg, Stadtbibliothek, Cent. III 87; Full manuscript
transcription: f.1r: "Nach Christi gepurt M°CCCC° in dem LXIII iar hat diß boch geschriben swester Margareta Karteuserin zu nucz irem closter zu sant Katherina zu Nurmberg prediger ordens. Pit got fur sie.“
translation: f.1r: After the birth of Christ, in the year 1463, this book was written by Sister Margareta Kartheuserin, for the benefit of her convent of Saint Catherine in Nuremberg, of the Order of Preachers (Dominicans). Pray to God for her.
monastery: Saint Katharina, Dominican, Nuremberg, Germany, 1295

title: Nuremberg, Stadtbibliothek, Cent. IV 19; Full manuscript
transcription: Pyt got fuer die schreiberin die das puch geschriben hat K. N. (f.334rb)
translation: "Pray to God for the scribe who wrote this book, K.N."
monastery: Saint Katharina, Dominican, Nuremberg, Germany, 1295

title: Nuremberg, Stadtbibliothek, Cent. IV 33; Full manuscript
transcription:
lv: Item daz puch gehört in daz closter czu S(ant) Kath(rein) in Nürnberg prediger orden vnd hat ein E vnd kein czal dopey wann es ist von einem andern geteilt vnd hat geschriben swester Kungunt Nicklasin vnd swester
Keiperin hinten dorczu.
translation: “This book belongs to the convent of St. Katharine in Nuremberg, Order of Preachers, and it bears an ‘E’ but no number because it has been separated from another volume. It was written by Sister Kunigund Niklasin and Sister Keiperin.”
monastery: Saint Katharina, Dominican, Nuremberg, Germany, 1295

title: Nuremberg, Stadtbibliothek, Cent. IV 6; Full manuscript
transcription: Explicit feria secunda hora vesperarum post Bonifacij XXIo (9 june 1421). Explicit in nomine Ihesu Cristi amen.
translation: Ended on the second weekday at the hour of Vespers, after the Feast of Boniface XXI (9th June 1421). Ended in the name of Jesus Christ, amen.
monastery: Saint Katharina, Dominican, Nuremberg, Germany, 1295

title: Nuremberg, Stadtbibliothek, Cent. IV 7; Full manuscript
transcription: Schreiberinitialen D.G., datiert von 1474, 24.Nov. (245vb).
monastery: Saint Katharina, Dominican, Nuremberg, Germany, 1295

title: Nuremberg, Stadtbibliothek, Cent. V 33; Full manuscript
transcription:
Anno domini MCCCCLXII. ltem diß pucl1 g-elu,rt in den conuent des
closters ru -1ant Kathrein in Niiremberg prediger ordens vnd hat das geschriben swester Kungunt
Holtuchuhin, conuent swester des selbigen closters, zu nutz jrem conuent, vnd ire gewistret aben
jr das parmet vnd den zeug bezalt. Pitent got für sie alle, sie sint lebend oder tot etc
translation:
the front pastedown:
“In the year of our Lord 1462. This book belongs to the convent of St. Catherine in Nuremberg of the Order of Preachers, and it was written by Sister Kunigunde Holzschubin, a convent sister of the same house, for our convent, and she paid for the parchment and materials herself.Let all pray for her, whether she be living or dead, etc.”
monastery: Saint Katharina, Dominican, Nuremberg, Germany, 1295

title: Nuremberg, Stadtbibliothek, Cent. V 4; Full manuscript
monastery: Saint Katharina, Dominican, Nuremberg, Germany, 1295

title: Nuremberg, Stadtbibliothek, Cent. V App. 34p; Full manuscript

translation: f.1: “After Christ’s birth, 1458. This book has been written by Sister Margaretha, a Carthusian, for the benefit of her convent at Saint Catherine in Nuremberg, of the Order of Preachers. May God bless her.”
monastery: Saint Katharina, Dominican, Nuremberg, Germany, 1295

transcription: (l'') Eintrag der Sehreiberin: N«ch Christi gepurt MCCCC in dem LXVl 11 jar hat geschriben diß puch $tvester Margaretha KarteU.$erin czu nut:: irem closter .::::sua nt KatherinCJi n Nurenberg. Pi! sot /ur sie.

transcription: (P) Eintrag der Schreiberin: Noch ChrUti gepurl MCCCC in dem I„XX iar ha1 gescJ,riben difJ pu~li s~1ttr MOrifOrethu Karluurin :u nut: irem klo.ster :u tani Kaihr[ina] in Nur[ enbcrg) prediger ordens. Pit gor/ur ti.t. Eintrag auf den Hi.ntcnpicgel: Diß puclt hotgescliriben fLt,-ef(eMr ar&oretho Karuuuerin .:.u.s ont Kat,{ina] in Nu,{ en~rg) pred48e.r orden.,
