Pray for her. On the back pastedown: This book was written by Sister Margareta Kartheuserin of St. Catherine’s in Nuremberg, of the Dominican Order.
monastery: Saint Katharina, Dominican, Nuremberg, Germany, 1295

title: Nuremberg, Stadtbibliothek, Cent. VI 43l; Full manuscript
transcription: 313v: Item es ist das puch ausgeschriben worden an sant Dominicus tag vnsers heiligen vaters als er erhaben ist worden (5. Aug.) als man zalt M0 CCC0 vnd in dem XLVI jar. Pit got fuer die schreiberin die das puch geschriben hat K<unigund> N<ikalsin> das ir got genedig sey.
translation: “This book was written on Saint Dominic’s Day, our holy father’s feast (August 5), in the year 1446. Pray to God for the female scribe, Kunigunde Nikalsin, that God may be merciful to her.”
monastery: Saint Katharina, Dominican, Nuremberg, Germany, 1295

title: Nuremberg, Stadtbibliothek, Cent. VI 43m; Full manuscript
transcription: 40r-60v, 147r-196r with the name of the writer: Els Schurstabin
translation: 40r-60v, 147r-196r with the name of the writer: Els Schurstabin
monastery: Saint Katharina, Dominican, Nuremberg, Germany, 1295

title: Nuremberg, Stadtbibliothek, Cent. VII 10; Full manuscript
transcription: XIIr: Item an dem puch sten die epistel vnd ewangelium über jar vom zeyt ... vnd hats geschriben suiester Gerdraut Teczlin selig.
translation:
Table of contents on XIIr:
“In this book are the epistles and Gospels for the entire year, arranged by season… and it was written by Sister Gertraud Tetzel, of blessed memory.”
monastery: Saint Katharina, Dominican, Nuremberg, Germany, 1295

title: Nuremberg, Stadtbibliothek, Cent. VII 11a; Full manuscript
transcription: f.1r: Vnd das puch hat am meysten S{wester) Clara Keyperin geschriben vnd ein teyl s(wester) Gerdraut Teczlin
translation: f.1r: And this book was written mostly by Sister Clara Keyperin, and a portion by Sister Gerdraut Teczlin.
monastery: Saint Katharina, Dominican, Nuremberg, Germany, 1295

title: Nuremberg, Stadtbibliothek, Cent. VII 13; Full manuscript
transcription:
113r unter dem Text: 0 min ainigi vnd allergetrüwesti muter bitgotfür din trüws kind
S. Elizabet Munt(in) die dir dis vss gantzer trüw geschr(iben) haut u>ie wol die geschr(ift) bos ist so ist doch die
liebi gantz vnd gut.
translation:
f.113r (below the text):
• “O my unique and most faithful mother, pray to God for your faithful child S. Elisabeth Muntin, who has written this for you out of complete loyalty. Even if the writing is poor, the love is whole and good.”
monastery: Saint Katharina, Dominican, Nuremberg, Germany, 1295

title: Nuremberg, Stadtbibliothek, Cent. VII 16; Full manuscript
transcription:
8v: pittent got fu"r mich swester ku"sterin denn ich dise ding mit fleiss zusammengesucht han. Pittent auch fur die swester die in geschriben hat. 
On f.8: "Miner recht lieben sv .. svester M[a]rg[ret] V[er]nan zv/o/ sa[nt] Katrinen zu/o/ Nu/o/renber[g]." Margaretha Vernan kam 1428 aus Scho"nensteinbach, d. 1475
translation:
8v: May God have mercy on me, Sister Custodian, for I have diligently gathered these things. Also, may God have mercy on the sister who wrote it down. 
On f.8: “My very dear sister Margaretha Vernan, of Saint Catherine in Nuremberg.” Margaretha Vernan came from Schönensteinbach in 1428 and passed away in 1475.
monastery: Saint Katharina, Dominican, Nuremberg, Germany, 1295

title: Nuremberg, Stadtbibliothek, Cent. VII 21; Full manuscript
transcription: Item dise II puchlein haben die swestern geschriben, und hat gepredigt und gemacht der erwirdig vater prior zu den predigern, Peter Kirchslag, und unser peichtiger, vater Hasz, hat sy uns teutzsch lasen machen.
translation: These two little books have been written by the sisters, and preached and made by the venerable Father Prior of the Preachers, Peter Kirchslag, and our respected Father Hasz, had them translated into German for us.
monastery: Saint Katharina, Dominican, Nuremberg, Germany, 1295

title: Nuremberg, Stadtbibliothek, Cent. VII 29; Full manuscript
transcription: (...)mumen junkfrau Ur(...) zu Augsburg
monastery: Saint Katharina, Dominican, Nuremberg, Germany, 1295

title: Nuremberg, Stadtbibliothek, Cent. VII 31; Full manuscript
transcription: f.173v: „Das loblich vnd nuczlich buchlain ist volendt am suntag vor sant Jorgen tag (22. April) als man zalt noch Cristus geburdt tausent funffhundert vnd in dem funffzehenden jar. Anna Scheck.“
translation: This praiseworthy and useful little book was completed on the Sunday before St. George’s Day (22 April) in the year one thousand five hundred and fifteen since the birth of Christ. Anna Scheck.
monastery: Saint Katharina, Dominican, Nuremberg, Germany, 1295

title: Nuremberg, Stadtbibliothek, Cent. VII 50; Full manuscript
transcription:
f.39r, beneath the final prayer, reads:
“S(wester) V.T."
“Ein avemaria durch gotes willen. S(wester) V. T.”
translation:
f.39r, beneath the final prayer, reads:
(Sister V.T.)
(One Ave Maria by God’s will. Sister V. T.)
monastery: Saint Katharina, Dominican, Nuremberg, Germany, 1295

title: Nuremberg, Stadtbibliothek, Cent. VII 56; Full manuscript
transcription: f.50: S(wester?) B.P. Ave M(aria).
monastery: Saint Katharina, Dominican, Nuremberg, Germany, 1295

title: Nuremberg, Stadtbibliothek, Cent. VII 93; Full manuscript
transcription: f.135v: Klar Nutzlin
translation: On f.135v above the text, the name of the scribe is written (?): “Klar Nutzlin”
monastery: Saint Katharina, Dominican, Nuremberg, Germany, 1295

title: Ordin. 27a.; Full manuscript
transcription: Zuo lob vnd eer got ... ist diss buch gemcht vnd verordnet worden durch... Anne von Freyberg äptissin ... zuo sant Steffen ... 1527
translation: To the praise and honor of God, this book was made and arranged by Anne von Freyberg, Abbess of St. Stephen’s, in the year 1527.

title: Oxford, Bodleian Library, Add. A. 288; Full manuscript
transcription: Desen boeck heest ghescreven Suster Lysbeth Lenaerts ... enn is voleijnt int jaer ons Heeren a. 1578 den 15 dagh Iunii...
translation: “This book was written by Sister Lysbeth Lenaerts … and was completed in the year of our Lord 1578, on the 15th day of June.”

title: Oxford, Bodleian Library, Bodl. 451; Full manuscript
transcription: Salva et incolomis maneat per secula scriptrix.
translation: May this [female] scribe remain safe and saved for all time
monastery: Nunnaminster, Benedictine, Winchester, United Kingdom

title: Oxford, Bodleian Library, Can. misc. 226; Full manuscript
transcription: Detur pro pena Egflib pulcra puella qui scripsit scribat semper cum dno vivat. Vivat in celis veniet Holaker in nomine fellix
translation: “Let it be given as a penalty: Egflib, the beautiful girl who wrote this, may she always write and live with the Lord. May she live in heaven; may Holaker come in the blessed name.

title: Oxford, Bodleian Library, Canon. Ital. 285; Full manuscript
transcription: Era ’l sicondo di vespar sonato/ nel glorioso giorno che concepta/ fu l’umil Vergin sancta et benedecta/ per chui ’l primo peccar fu ristorato./ A octo giorni del mese ultimato la faticata penna asciutta et necta/ alquanto riposai et con herecta/ mente l’ora vigesima uscì dallato./ Sonavan gli anni del nostro signore/ cinque cinquanta quattrocento et mille/ quando Maria di Matheo cimatore/ finì copiare el testo et le postille/ di questo clar poeta almo, et de core/ che ’nfino al ciel mandò le sue faville./Laus Deo sit semper benedictus.
translation: The second hour of the evening had sounded on the glorious day of the conception of the humble Virgin, holy and blessed, who was free from original sin. On the eighth day of the last month I gave some rest to my weary pen, dry and clean, and the twentieth hour came forth alongside with upright mind. The year of our Lord 1455 was sounding when Maria daughter of Matteo the cloth-shearer finished copying the text and commentary of this poet, renowned and noble, and with a heart that sent its sparks as far as heaven. Praise the Lord, may He always be blessed.

title: Oxford, Bodleian Library, Canonici Or. 89; Full manuscript
transcription: תהלות יי’ ... אשר רחמני אותי פולה בת ר’ אברהם הסופר בי"ר יואב צי"ע ... ר’ מנחם בי"ר בנימן הצדיק ... קרובי ... והפצירני ... לכתוב לו הספר ... ונגמרה ... יום רביעי שני ימים לחודש הראשון שנת חמשת אלפים וחמשים ושלשה לבריאת עולם"
translation:
Praises to the Lord… who showed mercy to me, Paola, daughter of Rabbi Abraham the scribe, son of Rabbi Yoav, may Zion be rebuilt…
Rabbi Menahem, son of Rabbi Binyamin the righteous one — my relative — urged me persistently to write this book for him…
And it was completed on Wednesday, the second day of the first month, in the year 5053 from the creation of the world.

title: Oxford, Bodleian Library, d'Orv XI. 1.28.; Full manuscript
transcription: In Biblioth. Guelderbytana extat exemplar manu Marg; Gudii descriptum.
translation: “In the Guelderbytan Library, there exists a copy written by the hand of Margareta Gudius.”

title: Oxford, Bodleian Library, Laud Misc 485; Full manuscript
transcription: sam Çuane"
translation: "Praise be to God in 147480 this book was made by the hand of myself, Maria, in praise of God and his mother and the glorious apostle evangelist St John", translated in B. Richardson, Women and the Circulation of Texts in Renaissance Italy (Cambridge: Cambridge University Press, 2020), p. 94

title: Oxford, Bodleian Library, Laud Misc. 415; Full manuscript
transcription: a.d. 1294 Iutta discreta virgo O.C. in monasterio s. Spiritus apud Alzeyam complevit hunc librum scribens eum ad peticionem Henrici prespiteri de Schimischem. Laus sit Deo. Amen.
translation: In the year of our Lord 1294, Jutta, a devout virgin of the Order of Cistercians in the monastery of the Holy Spirit at Alzey, completed this book, writing it at the request of Henry, priest of Schimischem. Praise be to God. Amen.
monastery:
Holy Spirit and Saint John, nunnery, Cistercian, Alzey, Germany, 1262-
1564

title: Oxford, Bodleian Library, Lyell 73; Full manuscript
transcription: Iste liber est sororis Antonie monialis monasterii Sancti Petri Maioris de Florentia. Manibus suis scripsit. Explevit ipsum die secundo Martii ad horam vigesimam die giovis anno millesimo quartocientesimo vigesimo tertio. Rogate Dominum pro eam
translation: This book belongs to Sister Antonia, nun of San Pier Maggiore of Florence. She wrote it with her own hands. She finished it on Thursday 2 March at the twentieth hour in 1424. Pray to the Lord for her.
monastery:
Saint Pier Maggiore, Florence, Italy, 1067-
1784

title: Oxford, Bodleian Library, Rawl. C. 86; Full manuscript
transcription: f.155v: Finis quod quene Elyzabeth
translation: f.155v: “Finished, by Queen Elizabeth.”

title: Oxford, St John's College, Ms.167; Full manuscript
transcription: (f.ii recto) shows Mary’s ownership inscription, ‘Syster mare. Neuel.’, alongside that of ‘syster tomysyn grove’ and ‘Brother James Stock’,
monastery:
Syon abbey, Bridgettine, Isleworth, United Kingdom, 1414-
1539

title: p. 60 catal. a. 1783 n.30; Full manuscript
transcription: Soror Catharina Eschenfelde in Montolii in Langendorf
translation: “Sister Catharina Eschenfelde in Montolii in Langendorf.”

title: Padova, Biblioteca Civica, C.M.30; Full manuscript
transcription: f.57r by hand identifiable as that of Cleofe: “Finisce la leggienda di sancto Çenobio copiata per una monacha del Paradiso. La quale l’à copiata a honore di tanto glorioso sancto, acciò lui interceda per me dinançi al divino e severo guidice. Laus Deo sit semper. Amen. Finissi di scrivere a dì dieci di gennaio 1506.”
translation: "f.57r by hand identifiable as that of Cleofe: "The legend of Saint Zenobius finishes, copied by a nun of the Paradiso. She copied it in honor of such a glorious saint, so that he may intercede for me before the divine and strict judge. Praise be to God always. Amen. Finished writing on the tenth day of January 1506."
monastery: Santa Brigida del Paradiso, Brigittine, Florence, Italy

title: Padova, Biblioteca del Seminario, 542 I; Full manuscript
transcription: f.193v: “Ego soror Agnes Scarabela de Sancte Agathe de Vantio [erased] fecit [with an erased 'd'] hoc opus. Anno Domini millesimo ducentesimo nonagesimo septimo [‘ti’ interlinear addition], indicione decima.”
translation: "f.193v: "I, Sister Agnes Scarabela of Saint Agatha of Vantio, made this work. In the year of our Lord one thousand two hundred and ninety-seven, tenth indiction."

title: Paris, Bibiliothèque Thiers, Ms.1249; Full manuscript
transcription: f.549: Librum conscripsit hunc Mehildis monialis...
translation: f.549: Mehildis, the nun, wrote this book.

title: Paris, Bibliothèque de l'Arsenal, Ms. 1189; Full manuscript
transcription: f.12v: Je, Mariette, femme de Person l'escripvain, demourant a Reins, ay escriples ces heures de ma propre main. [MCCV]
translation: I, Mariette, wife of Person the scribe, residing in Reims, have written these hours with my own hand. [1205]

title: Paris, Bibliothèque de l'Arsenal, Ms. 2075; full manuscript
transcription: « Explicit la benoites Passion de Nostre Seigneur Jhesu Crist, qui fut escripte et copulée l'an de graice Nostre Seigneur M IIIIc IIIIxx et VI, le jour de feste saint Gregoire, a la louuange (sic) et a l'asaucement du hault nons de Jhesus, et pour bien, profit et augmentaction de l'ame et du corps de très excellant et nobles dame Ysabiaulz de Croy, escripte par ma propre mains, suer Barbe Wyesse, religieuse indigne du couvent de Sainte Clare, cituée au Nuefchastelz, en Lorraine. » f.138v
translation: "Here ends the blessed Passion of Our Lord Jesus Christ, which was written and completed in the year of the grace of Our Lord 1496, on the feast day of Saint Gregory, to the praise and exaltation of the high name of Jesus, and for the well-being, profit, and enhancement of the soul and body of the most excellent and noble lady Ysabiaulz de Croy, written by my own hands, Sister Barbe Wyesse, unworthy nun of the convent of Saint Clare, situated in Neufchâteau, Lorraine." (f.138v)

title: Paris, Bibliothèque de l'Arsenal, Ms. 424; Full manuscript
transcription: f.313v: Item dit boexken is gheeint int iaer ons Heren MCCC en[de] XCIII op den avont der besnidenisse ons Heren... mij s. Ghertruit Bay bidt om Gods wil voer mijn siele.
translation: Also, this little book was completed in the year of our Lord 1393 on the eve of the Circumcision of our Lord... me, Sister Ghertruit Bay, prays for the sake of my soul.

title: Paris, Bibliothèque de l'Arsenal, Ms. 8201; Full manuscript
transcription: f.154: Item, desen bouc heeft ghescreven suster Mergriete van den Perboen te harer 69 iaren ende ghehent te harer 70 iaren int iaer Ons Heren 15 ende 16 up die octave van Allen Heleghen, die doen lach up den saterdach, bidt voer haer.
translation: “Item, this book was written by Sister Margriete van den Perboen at the age of 69 and completed at the age of 70, in the year of Our Lord 1516, on the octave of All Saints’ Day, which fell on a Saturday. Pray for her.”

title: Paris, Bibliothèque de l'Arsenal, Ms. 8208; Full manuscript
transcription:
f.161r - kopiiste: "Dit boeck wert voleynt int jaer ons heren M cccc ende lxvij byder hant suster geertruyt vasteersts" 
f.175r: "Suster Gheertruit Vastaerts"
translation:
"f.161r - copyist: "This book was completed in the year of our Lord 1467 by the hand of Sister Geertruyt Vasteersts."
f.175r: "Sister Geertruit Vastaerts"

title: Paris, Bibliothèque de l'Arsenal, Ms. 8227; Full manuscript
transcription:
Dit boeck es ghescreven van mij suster Janneken Hubrechts ... Ick y aermme suster ben overleden a. 15(85) den (26 merts) (f.316v)
a. 1578 in der maent augustus (f.640)
translation:
“This book is written by me, Sister Janneken Hubrechts … I, a poor sister, passed away in the year 1585, on the 26th of March (f.316v).
In the year 1578, in the month of August (f.640).”

title: Paris, Bibliothèque de l'Arsenal, Ms. 8228; Full manuscript
transcription: Suster Elisabeth der Moeien

title: Paris, Bibliothèque Mazarine, Ms. 432; Full manuscript
transcription: On the interior of the lower cover of the binding: « Hoc temporale scripsit atque complevit soror Margareta Bruunruwe, monialis professa VIIa domus Syon in Brugis, ordinis dive virginis Marie de Monte-Carmeli, et illuminavit soror Cornelia de Wultinchkercke, ejusdem domus et ordinis monialis professa XIIII, anno Domini XCc, V, XI die mensis octobris. O vos presentes et subsequentes, imitamini ocia earum et oretis pro eis. »
translation: On the interior of the lower cover of the binding: "This temporal [book] was written and completed by Sister Margareta Bruunruwe, professed nun of the seventh house of Syon in Bruges, of the order of the blessed Virgin Mary of Mount Carmel, and illuminated by Sister Cornelia de Wultinchkercke, professed nun of the same house and order, on the 11th day of October in the year of our Lord 1195. Oh you present and future ones, imitate their leisure and pray for them."

title: Paris, Bibliothèque Mazarine, Ms.781; Full manuscript
transcription: f.222v: « Item int iaer ons liefs Heeren doemmen screef XVc en̅ LXXIIII, was dit boeck volscreuen, den XXVIIIsten in junius, in der vigilien van sinte Peeten en̅ sinte Pauwels, die heyleghe apostolen, van mii suster Margrieten der Weduwen een erm professie nonne, tot Bruesel, in Sinte Elizabetten clooster op de Berch van Syon. »
translation: "Also, in the year of our dear Lord, one thousand five hundred and seventy-four, this book was completed on the twenty-eighth of June, on the vigil of Saint Peter and Saint Paul, the holy apostles, by me, Sister Margrieten der Weduwen, a poor professed nun, at Brussels, in the Saint Elizabeth's convent on the Mount of Zion."

title: Paris, Bibliothèque nationale de France, BnF Français 580; Full manuscript
transcription: « A tres excellent Redoubtee & puissant et tres princesse. Ma dame ysabel Royne de France ...- ... Escript le ve jour d'octombre. l'an de grace mil iiij C et/ cinq. Vostre treshumble obeissant Creature/ cristine de Pizan. Prennez en gré s'il vous plaist cest escript / De ma main fait aprés mienuit une heure / Noble seigneur pour qui je l'ai escript / Prennez en gré / Quant vous plaira mieulz vous sera rescript / Mais n'avoye nul autre clerc a l'eure / Prennez en gré s'il...» (f.53r)
translation:
f.53r: “To the most excellent, revered, powerful, and most noble princess,
My lady Isabel, Queen of France…

Written on the eve of October, in the year of grace 1405.

Your most humble and obedient servant,
Christine de Pizan.

Please accept this writing, if it pleases you,
Made by my own hand after midnight, at one o’clock.
Noble lord, for whom I have written it,
Please accept it.
When it pleases you, it can be copied more finely.
But I had no other clerk at the time—
Please accept it…”

title: Paris, Bibliothèque nationale de France, Français 1533; Full manuscript
transcription: f.265v : "Ce livre fut ... ma dame Agnes de Bourgogne, ..."
translation: "f.265v: "This book was ... my lady Agnes de Bourgogne, ..."

title: Paris, Bibliothèque nationale de France, Français 342; Full manuscript
transcription: Colophon: 'Cil roumans fu par ecrit en lan del incarnation notre segnor Mil deus Cens et sixante et quatorse, le semedi Apries les octaues de le trinite [Saturday, 9 June 1274]. Pries pour celi ki lescrist'. Celi is usually a female form (in contrast to celui).
translation: Colophon: 'This romance was written in the year of the incarnation of our Lord one thousand two hundred and sixty-four, on Saturday after the octave of the Trinity [Saturday, 9 June 1274]. Pray for she who wrote it.' Celi is usually a female form (in contrast to celui).

title: Paris, Bibliothèque nationale de France, Français 817; Full manuscript
transcription: f.190v: Et fu achave ledit livre le 19 jour de descembre lan 1465. Maguerite de Chauvigny.
translation: f.190v: And this book was finished on the 19th day of December in the year 1465. Marguerite de Chauvigny.

title: Paris, Bibliothèque nationale de France, Latin 11969; Full manuscript
transcription: Explicit compendium theologice virtutis (sic). Deo dicimus gratias. Scriptum per Henrietam anno Domini M°CCCLVI (the name and date are difficult to read due to ink smudges). Another mention of the copyist, in her own hand, is found in the upper margin of f.1r: Perscriptum a Henrieta de Lathilliaco, anno LV (not a clear reading), iovis post festum beati Luce (22 October 1355). The reasons for the transcription are explained on the same f.1r:Incipit compendium theologie sancti Thome de Aquino, hic subscriptum interlineariter, ne pargamenum sit occiosum.
translation:
Explicit Compendium Theologicae Virtutis (sic). We give thanks to God. Written by Henrietta in the year of our Lord 1356 (the name and date are difficult to read due to ink smudges).

Another mention of the copyist, in her own hand, is found in the upper margin of f.1r: Written by Henrietta of Lathilliaco, in the year 55 (not a clear reading), on Thursday after the feast of Saint Luke (22 October 1355).

The reasons for the transcription are explained on the same f.1r: Here begins the Compendium of Theology by Saint Thomas Aquinas, transcribed here interlinearly, so that the parchment may not remain idle.

title: Paris, Bibliothèque nationale de France, Latin 12949; Full manuscript
transcription: f.52: scripturae finem sibi quaerunt hic ysagogae parva quidem moles magna sed utilitas Icpa hunc scripsi glossans utrumque libellum quod logicae si sit scire legens poterit.
translation: “The end of writing is sought here by these small introductions; though small in size, they are of great usefulness. I, Icpa, wrote and glossed this little book, so that whoever wishes to know logic may learn by reading.”

title: Paris, Bibliothèque nationale de France, Latin 17185; Full manuscript
transcription: f.291Explicit... Commenciet par moy Jenne le Fevre le 21 iour docoust an 1503 et perfet le 27 iour de septembre ensyvant et est a moy.
translation: “Completed … Begun by me, Jenne le Fevre, on the 21st day of August in the year 1503 and finished on the 27th day of September following, and it belongs to me.”

title: Paris, Bibliothèque nationale de France, Latin 17323; Full manuscript
transcription: f.385. Cf.photos

title: Paris, Bibliothèque nationale de France, Latin 7560; Full manuscript
transcription: f.54. Εογενυα
translation: f.54. Eugenia

title: Paris, Bibliothèque nationale de France, NAL 348; Full manuscript
transcription: f.134v: "Quorum uel quarum nomina hic scripsi meritis peto in celis adscribi. Elsendis."
translation: "Whose names, whether of one or more, I have written here, I ask to be enrolled in heaven for their merits. Elsendis."

title: Paris, Bibliothèque nationale de France, NAL 772; Full manuscript
transcription: f.21: "XIIII. k1. [Octobris]: Soror Christina que scripsit hunc librum."
translation: "14th day before the kalends of October: Sister Christina who wrote this book."

title: Parma, Biblioteca Palatina, Palatino 23; Full manuscript
transcription: Explicit liber iste per me suora Cleophe moniali Paradissi. Scripto negli anni della incarnatione del nostro signore (Yesu) (Christo) M CCCCC dicianove, si compié di scrivere a dì XV di março. Laus Deo sit semper. Amen.
translation: This book is finished by me, Sister Cleophe, nun of the Paradiso. Written in the year of the incarnation of our Lord Jesus Christ 1520, completed on the 15th day of March. Praise be to God always. Amen.
monastery: Santa Brigida del Paradiso, Brigittine, Florence, Italy

title: Parma, Biblioteca Palatina, Palatino 84; Full manuscript
transcription: f.144vB in hand of Raffaella: “Finito è il presente libro scripto per mano d’una monacha indegnamente consecrata nel monasterio del Paradiso, il cui nome sia scripto nel libro della vita, a dì quatordici di dicenbre M CCCC LXXVII. A llaude (et) gloria della somma (et)d eterna sapientia. Deo gratias. Poi ch’ài letto il libro (et) la visione coll’altre cose che qui sono scripte priega per me misera, peccatore. Dà il cuore a Dio intero (et) non diviso se gustar vuogli questo libro sancto (et) rendilo al monasterio del Paradiso”
translation: f.144vB, in the hand of Raffaella: "Finished is this present book written by the hand of a nun, unworthily consecrated in the monastery of Paradiso, whose name is written in the book of life, on the fourteenth day of December 1477. To the praise and glory of the highest and eternal wisdom. Thanks be to God. After you have read the book and the vision with the other things written here, pray for me, a miserable sinner. Give your heart entirely to God if you wish to taste this holy book, and return it to the monastery of Paradiso."
monastery: Santa Brigida del Paradiso, Brigittine, Florence, Italy

title: Pavia, Biblioteca Universitaria, Aldini 353; full manuscript
transcription: Laus Deo Omnipotenti et Santissime matri eius Virgini Marie soror Luchina decisit hoc hopus [sic]
translation: Praise be to Almighty God and to His most holy Mother, the Virgin Mary. Sister Luchina completed this work.

title: Perugia, Biblioteca Comunale, 1086; Full manuscript
transcription: f.97: In Monte Luce scripto. Qui scrissit scribat sorori Eufrasie vivat in celis semper cum dno felix
translation: f.97: Written in Monte Luce. May he who wrote this write for Sister Eufrasia, may she live forever in the heavens with the Lord, happy.
monastery: Saint Maria de Monteluce, Benedictine, Monteluce (Monte Lucido), a suburb of Perugia, Italy, 1222

title: Perugia, Biblioteca Comunale, 1108; Full manuscript
transcription: f.109: Scripto nel Monasterio de Sancta Maria de Mont Luce nel 1510 etc. per me sora Felicita de Peroscia indigna, sora de sancta Chiara
translation: “Written in the Monastery of Santa Maria de Mont Luce in 1510, etc., by me, Sister Felicita of Perugia, unworthy, Sister of Saint Clare.”
monastery: Saint Maria de Monteluce, Benedictine, Monteluce (Monte Lucido), a suburb of Perugia, Italy, 1222

title: Perugia, Biblioteca Comunale, 1290; Full manuscript
transcription: f.1: Questo libro fu incominciato lanno di Cristo 1488 nel mese di agosto da suora Eufrasia figliuola di Alfano da Perugia
translation: f.1: This book was begun in the year of Christ 1488 in the month of August by Sister Eufrasia, daughter of Alfano from Perugia.
monastery: Saint Maria de Monteluce, Benedictine, Monteluce (Monte Lucido), a suburb of Perugia, Italy, 1222

title: Philadelphia, Free Library of Philadelphia, Lewis E 213; Full manuscript
transcription: Colophon f.118r (end of Augustine's Rule) lists eleven nuns and their confessor; 'Dit sijn der gheender namen die dit boexsken ghescreven hebben uut caritaten. Ons eerweerdighe pater heer Philips Nycholaes god sij sijn loen. Suster Beatrix Noeys, suster Margarete Bont, suster Janne van den Velde, suster Marie van Hansbeke, suster Katherie Tymmermans, suster Maria Meerts, suster Margarete Joerdaens, suster Janne Colijns, suster Anne Joerdaens, suster Rijckmoet van Zelken, suster Maergarete van den Rade. Int boeck des levens sij haerder alder name'. Free Library catalogue entry mentions 13 hand changes, but the last hand change covers the sermon (which may not be covered by the colophon)
translation:
Colophon f.118r (end of Augustine's Rule) lists eleven nuns and their confessor; "This is the list of those whose names have written this booklet out of charity. Our honorable father, Mr. Philips Nycholaes, may God be his reward. Sister Beatrix Noeys, Sister Margarete Bont, Sister Janne van den Velde, Sister Marie van Hansbeke, Sister Katherie Tymmermans, Sister Maria Meerts, Sister Margarete Joerdaens, Sister Janne Colijns, Sister Anne Joerdaens, Sister Rijckmoet van Zelken, Sister Maergarete van den Rade. In the book of life, their names are all recorded."
Free Library catalogue entry mentions 13 hand changes, but the last hand change covers the sermon (which may not be covered by the colophon)
monastery: Cloister Notre-Dame of the Rose of Jericho, Augustinian, Brussels, Belgium, 1247

title: Philadelphia, University of Pennsylvania, Ms.ex 655; Full manuscript
transcription: "Qui me scribebat nome(n) katherina mast habebat. Premia scriptricis. sint vite dona p(er)he(n)nis"
translation: "The one who was writing me had the name Katherina Mast. May the rewards of the writer be the gifts of eternal life."

title: Pommersfelden, Gräfliche Schönbornsche Schlossbibliothek, 344; Full manuscript
transcription: f.184v-185r: "Completus est iste libellus orarius anno domini M cccc lxxviii ipso die Sancti Ambrosii episcopi. Quem scripsit Soror Wendelmodis Roltemans ad instanciam carissime neptis eius Leve Ter Bruggen honeste matrone. Et Soror Agnes Martini illuminavit. Sancti moniales monasterii ordinis sancti Benedicti ad Sanctam Katharinam In Syloe prope Groenyncgen Urbem inclitam et opulentam in frysia. Eundem orarium prefata Leve Ter Bruggen tamquam entenium[?] memorabile propinando dedit illustri et honesto viro Johanni De Valle rosarum Alias Vanden Roesendael"
translation: f.184v-185r: "This little prayer book was completed in the year of our Lord 1478, on the very day of Saint Ambrose the Bishop. It was written by Sister Wendelmodis Roltemans at the request of her dear niece Leve Ter Bruggen, an honorable matron. And Sister Agnes Martini illuminated it. The holy nuns of the monastery of the Order of Saint Benedict at Saint Catherine in Syloe, near the renowned and prosperous city of Groningen in Friesland. The aforementioned Leve Ter Bruggen, as a memorable gift, gave this prayer book to the illustrious and honorable man John of the Valley of Roses, also known as Vanden Roesendael."

title: Prague University, D.H. 120; Full manuscript
transcription: f.171: Amen. Dyss puch ist geschriben und volendt am abent des heiligen apostel und ewang. Mathei als man zalt nach Cristi gepurt unssers lieben herrn 1517 iar. Pytt got fur die schreiberyn swester Appolonia Polanderijn
translation: f.171: Amen. This book was written and completed on the evening of the Holy Apostle and Evangelist Matthew, as one counts from the birth of Christ our Lord in the year 1517. May God grant for the scribe, Sister Appolonia Pollanderin.

title: Prague University, D.H.117; Full manuscript
transcription: f.312v: ...geschriben und vollendt mit der hilff Gotes am obent des heiligen Erczengels sant Michaelis als man schreib nach Cristi unssers lieben herren gepurt 1500 und in dem 14 jar... pit got fur die letzte schreiberin Appolonia Pollanderin... die ewigen seligkeit. Amen.
translation: f.312v: …written and completed with God’s help on the feast of the Holy Archangel Saint Michael, as one writes after the birth of our Lord Jesus Christ in the year 1500, and in the 14th year… May God grant the eternal bliss to the last scribe, Appolonia Pollanderin… Amen.

title: Prague University, DH 132; Full manuscript
transcription: Dycz puch ist volent wurden an unser heylygen muter und haubtfrawen sant Claren tag, als sy erhebt ist wurden von einer swesster irs ordens. Got geb ir und uns all dy ewygen freud und das ewyg vaterlant, do alle wun und frewd ist an endt. Amen. (CMO 21732, Cmo VI/312)
translation: This book was completed on our holy mother and lady, Saint Clare’s day, when she was elevated, by a sister of her order. May God grant her and all of us eternal joy and the eternal homeland, where all joy and happiness end. Amen.

title: Prague University, DH 140; Full manuscript
transcription: ... amen. amen. Margaretha von Schonbergk hat diss geschriben mit yrer lyncken hant. nemet vor gut libe Swester Juliana und bittet och got vor mich. amen.
translation: … amen. amen. Margaretha von Schönbergk has written this with her left hand. She asks for the good sister Juliana and also prays to God for me. amen.

title: Prague University, DH 148; Full manuscript
transcription: Wer disses puchlein vint der geb es durch got wider swester Angnes Keisserin oder swester Yrsala Wickersteterin der es auch peider ist. (f.99). Disse vorgeschriben predig hat uns swester Margaretta Gruntherin aptesin sant clar ordens von Nurnberg geschikt und begert von einer iden swester. einen. pater noster und ein ave maria der heiligen schar. das sie got fur sie piten. (f.127). Amen. Pitt got fur mich aller liebsten swester. (f.323).
translation:
Whoever finds this little book, may they give it through God’s mercy to Sister Agnes Keisserin or Sister Yrsala Wickersteterin, who are both of them. (f.99).

This prescribed sermon was sent to us by Sister Margaretta Gruntherin, Abbess of the Order of Saint Clare of Nuremberg, who requested from a certain Sister a Pater Noster and an Ave Maria for the holy assembly, that she might pray to God for her. (f.127).

Amen. May God pray for me, my dearest sister. (f.323).
monastery:
Saint Klara, Poor Clares, Nuremberg, Germany,-
1525

title: Prague University, DH 159; Full manuscript
transcription: Hie ist ein end der regel sant Clarn swester. Regula te salvat, si servas que tibi narrat. Ein Swester die regel geschriben hat, da man zalt von cristus 1505 iar, geendet an sant Erhardi des heiligen pishoff, in Convent in Eger
translation: Here is the end of the rule of the Saint Clare sisters. The rule saves you, if you keep what it tells you. A sister wrote the rule, in the year 1505 after the birth of Christ, finished on Saint Erhard’s Day, at the Holy Bishop’s, in the convent in Eger.

title: Prague, Knihovna Metropolitni Kapituli, B IV 1; Full manuscript
transcription: f.174: Ego Birgitta filia Sighfusi soror conventualis in monasterio Munkalijff prope Bergis scripsi hunc psalterium cum litteris capitalibus licet minus bene quam debui orate pro peccatrice.
translation: “I, Birgitta, daughter of Sighfus, conventual sister in the monastery of Munkalijff near Bergen, wrote this psalter with capital letters, though not as well as I should have. Pray for the sinner.”

title: Prague, National Library of the Czech Republic, Ms. XVI.F.73; Full manuscript
transcription: f.69v

title: Prague, National Museum, 3069; Full manuscript
transcription: f.175 ... von mir Catarina, Frau von Volkenstorf geb. Frau von Liechtenstein beschrieben.
translation: f.175 … written by me, Catarina, Lady of Volkenstorf, née Lady of Liechtenstein.

title: Prague, National Museum, ms. X A 12; Full manuscript
transcription: ,f.359v lin blackl: Anno dni Augspurg lxxi / Clara Hatzlerin sb (scripsi).
translation: “Year of the Lord [in] Augsburg, 1471 / Clara Hatzlerin wrote [this].”

title: Private Collection in Province of Vicenza, Ms.18; Full manuscript
transcription: f.45r: “Orate pro scriptrice sorore Samaritana de Calcagninis.”
translation: "Pray for the scribe, Sister Samaritana de Calcagninis."

title: Rome, Biblioteca Nazionale Centrale, Varia 24 (574); Full manuscript
transcription: Questo libro si è scrito per mane/ de Lana de i Galvagni,/ fiola che fu de miser zan / Bertolameo. (Iesu) Maria.
translation: This book was written by the hand of Lana de i Galvagni, daughter of the late Sir Zan Bertolameo. Jesus Mary.

title: Rome, Biblioteca Nazionale Centrale, Vittorio Emanuele 1335; Full manuscript
transcription: Finito el mio libro chiamato amor de carita. Scricto per man de me Giovanna de Piero di Martinozzi.
translation: Finished is my book called Amor de Carita. Written by the hand of me, Giovanna de Piero di Martinozzi.

title: s-Hertogenbosch, Société provinciale des Arts et des Sciences, Ms.635; Full manuscript
transcription:
f.179v: Finitus Anno Millesimo quadringentesimo lxxix. Per manu sororis Diewaris peregrini in festo sancti willibrordi confessoris. Et maxima pars scripta est in celebribus festis Orate pro ea. 
f.(garde): Liber magistri garlaci de scoten ad usum aduarie pauli monialis in beverwijck ad eiusdem vitam a prefato magistro aduarie concessus cum parte estivali etc.
translation:
f.179 verso: Finished in the year one thousand four hundred seventy-nine. By the hand of Sister Diewaris Peregrini on the feast of Saint Willibrord, confessor. And the majority of it was written on celebrated feast days. Pray for her.

Guard f.: The book of Master Garlacus de Scoten for the use of Sister Pauli, nun in Beverwijck, granted by the aforementioned Master Garlacus for her life, with the summer part, etc.

transcription: Item der tracktat ist zu taucz gemacht vnd verpracht von der erwirdigen frumen frawen vnd swester vrsula Saczenhoferin dy vor zeiten ain chlosterfraw ist gewesen zu regenspurg in dem chloster nidern munstern zu Sant erhart vnd dar nach sich hat geben durch gottes willen vnter dy gehorsam des erwirdigen herrn herrn vnd vater in got abbt Rueprecht chauczel zu Sant peter zu salczpurg." AQI St Peter Catalog 1982 p. 290.
translation: Furthermore, the tractate was presented and handed over by the venerable and pious lady and sister Ursula Saczenhoferin, who in the past had been a nun in Regensburg at the Niedermünster convent dedicated to Saint Erhart, and later, through God’s will, placed herself under the obedience of the venerable lord and father in God, Abbot Rueprecht Chauczel, at Saint Peter’s in Salzburg.

Petersfrauen, Benedictine, Salzburg, Austria, 1113-
1583

title: Salzburg, Bibliothek St. Peter, b. I. 1 (olim R. 365); Full manuscript
transcription: S unczt das ich ein gee in die freyd meines herrn da selbs zw peleiben ewigkleichen amen.... Das puechel hat ein endt got uns all unser truebsal in ewige frewd wendt. Sprecht der schreiberin ain Ave Maria. S.K.P. = Soror Katharina Puchlerin on f.151v
translation:
“So may it happen that I go into the joy of my Lord, and there remain forever. Amen.
This little book has come to an end — may God turn all our sorrow into eternal joy.
Say an Ave Maria for the woman scribe.”

S.K.P. = Sister Katharina Puchlerin on f.151v
monastery:
Petersfrauen, Benedictine, Salzburg, Austria, 1113-
1583

title: San Marino, Huntington Library, Art Museum, and Botanical Gardens, mssHM 26068; Full manuscript
transcription: Incipit: A treshaute et puissante Princesse Elizabeth Roine d'Angleterre et cetera, Madame, combien que ie soye peu exercée ... De votre Majestie La treshumble, tresobeissante et tresaffectionnée servante a Jamais, Esther Langlois, Fille Françoise. Explicit: de pouvoir a Jamais vous faire treshumble service. Huius ipsius Libelli Prosopopoeia, Filia me scripsit mandante vtroque Parente/ Exilii calamo taedia discutiens.
translation:
Incipit: “To the most high and powerful Princess Elizabeth, Queen of England, etc., Madam, although I am little practiced… From Your Majesty’s most humble, most obedient, and most affectionate servant forever, Esther Langlois, a French daughter.”

Explicit: “To be forever able to render you most humble service. The personification of this very little book — my daughter wrote me, at the command of both parents / driving away the tedium of exile with her pen.”

Sheet 165v: Fidis Baier [Fidis Baierin]

title: St.Gallen, Stiftsbibliothek, Ms. membr. 65; Full manuscript
transcription: 128r–v Kolophon. Dis büchlin wart geendet durch mich schwester Dorothea Schermanyn in dem closter Gnodental in der stat Baszel sant Claren ordens der observantz uff vigilia visitacionis Marie virginis anno im xvc xv und gehört der geistlichen und andechtigen schwester Anna Lowlin ouch in Gnodental und begert dz sy got für sy well bitten umm ein gůt selig end.
translation: "Colophon: This little book was completed by me, Sister Dorothea Schermanyn, in the Cloister of Gnodental in the city of Basel, of the Order of St. Clare of the Observance, on the Vigil of the Visitation of the Virgin Mary in the year 1515. It belongs to the spiritual and devout Sister Anna Lowlin, also in Gnodental, and she desires that you pray to God for her for a good and blessed end."

title: St.Gallen, Stiftsbibliothek, Ms. Sang. 363; Full manuscript
transcription: f.304: Explicit Liber iste. Dis bůch ist volendet vnd geschriben von der gnad gocz durch Schwoͤster Elizabeth Muntpratin zů Sant Katherina prediger ordens an aller hailgen Octaaf in dem iar da man zalt nach der gebůrt Jhesu christi MoCCCCo lxxxiij iar bittend gott fv́r die schriberin des begert sy von ganczem. herczen lebind vnd todt,
translation: "Here ends this book. This book was completed and written by the grace of God by Sister Elizabeth Muntpratin of St. Catherine of the Dominican Order, on the Octave of All Saints in the year of our Lord 1483. She prays to God for the scribe, who desires this from the bottom of her heart, living and dead."
monastery:
Saint Katharinental, Dominican, Saint Gallen, Switzerland,-1245
1869

title: St.Gallen, Stiftsbibliothek, Ms. Sang. 983; Full manuscript
transcription: f.3: Dis buch ist der swostren zu sand linhart und ist geschriben, volendet am mitwoch vor dem buertlichen tag unser lieben frowen jny dem lxiiii jar. – bit got fur swester endlin. (= 4. September 1464).
translation: "This book belongs to the sisters of Saint Linhart and was written, completed on Wednesday before the feast day of our dear Lady in the year 1464. – Pray to God for Sister Endlin."

title: St.Gallen, Stiftsbibliothek, Ms. Sang. 990; Full manuscript
transcription:
f.200a : Est finis Laus deo Mille deo gratias Anno domini xᵛ xxij S. [ oror ] R. [ egina ] S. [ attler ] Orate per me 

p. 314b : Deo Gratias Bittend got für ich bosse Schriber〈in〉[erased] S. [sister] Dorothea von hertenstein

third hand not signed
translation:
"f.200a: This is the end. Praise be to God. A thousand thanks to God. In the year of our Lord 1522. Sister Regina Sattler. Pray for me.

p. 314b: Thanks be to God. Praying to God for me, the sinful scribe. Sister Dorothea von Hertenstein.

The third hand is not signed."
monastery:
Saint Katharinental, Dominican, Saint Gallen, Switzerland,-1245
1869

title: St.Gallen, Stiftsbibliothek, Ms.1003; Full manuscript
transcription: Diss buchly ward uss geschriben und volendet an dem abent unsers vatters s. Ludwicus barfussen orden (d)a m(an) z(a"hlt) n(ach) d(er) g(eburt) ch(risti) 1400 un in dem 98 ior. Biten got fu"r die schriberin mit ain Ave Maria. (CMO)
translation:
This book was written by me, Katheryna von [possibly Dienes?] Remchingen, professed at the convent of Frauenalb, and completed on the day that also happened to be the feast of Saint Mark the Evangelist, in the year counted as 1518.
For God’s sake, I ask: when I am dead, remember me in this, and in all goodness.

title: St.Gallen, Stiftsbibliothek, Ms.1464; Full manuscript
transcription: p. 443: Finitus est liber ille in vigilia sancti jacobij Appostoli per me S Marianna Pflügerin Ano domini MDIXX
translation: “This book was completed on the eve of Saint James the Apostle (July 24) by me, Sister Marianna Pflüger, in the year of our Lord 1520.”

translation: a humble convent sister
monastery:
Vadstena Abbey, Bridgettine, Vadstena, Sweden, 1346-
1595

title: Stockholm, Kungliga Biblioteket, A 172; Full manuscript
transcription: f.106v: Soror Jutta de alfter persoluit istum librum cum suis expensis et elemosynis. Orate pro ea et pro quibus intendit deuote et soror lorra de specula perfecit scribendo liniando notando illuminando quam non excludatis ex cordibus vestris nex non ex oracionibus vestris deuotis anno domini mcccl maximam pestilencia ubique existente.
translation: “f.106v: Sister Jutta of Alfter paid for this book with her own expenses and alms. Pray for her and for those for whom she devoutly intends [her prayers], and Sister Lorra of Spiegel completed it by writing, ruling, noting, and illuminating. Do not exclude her from your hearts nor from your devout prayers, in the year of our Lord 1350, when the great pestilence was raging everywhere.”

title: Stockholm, Kungliga Biblioteket, A 194; Full manuscript
transcription:
f.325: Die episteln hat zu dewchs gemacht der erwiendig geistleich herr maister hans amman aus der weissen aw pey rafelspuerkch den geistleichen jankchfrawn vnd swestern zu den himelparten zu wienn da er dann prior ist gewesen mer dann xx jar dem fot genedig sey. Vnd die episteln hat nach im abgeschriben swester magdalena die got der almochtig vnd sein liebe mueter maria haben in itt huet.
f.360: Anno domini tausent cccc vnd im lxviii jar an vnser lieben frawn tag concepcionis in dem aduent ist das puech aus geschriben warden ist das puech aus geschriben warden vnd gehert zu den himelparten in das klaster zu wienn vnd hat geschriben swester magdalena panholezin. Pitt got für sey mit ainem aue maria. Deo gracias.
translation:
f.325:
“The Epistles were translated by the venerable and spiritual Master Hans Amman from Weissenau near Rafelspuerkch for the spiritual virgins and sisters at the Himmelspforten convent in Vienna, where he served as prior for more than twenty years. May God be gracious to his soul. The Epistles were later copied by Sister Magdalena, whom Almighty God and His beloved Mother Mary hold in their care.”

f.360:
“In the year of our Lord 1468, on the Feast of the Conception of Our Lady, during Advent, this book was completed. It belongs to the Himmelspforten convent in Vienna and was written by Sister Magdalena Panholezin. Pray to God for her with an Ave Maria. Thanks be to God.”

title: Stockholm, Kungliga Biblioteket, A 1; Full manuscript
transcription: enne conuentz systher
monastery:
Vadstena Abbey, Bridgettine, Vadstena, Sweden, 1346-
1595

title: Stockholm, Kungliga Biblioteket, A 2; Full manuscript
transcription: Ithem taessa book haffwer waar kaera syster systher margith nilzsa dotther laetidh scriffwa oc haffwer hon henne alla samman j allo mattho kosthwarth mz thz som gudz waener oc hennas haffwa henne giffwidh oc war hon scriffwadh add ene owerdoghe conuens systher j watzstena closthier och war hon lyktadh diuisio apostolorum aarom aepther gudz burdh m d xxx iiii ...
translation: Also, this book was commissioned by our dear sister, Sister Margit Nilsdotter, who had it written and entirely furnished in every way with what God’s friends and her own provided to her. It was written by a senior convent sister in the Vadstena cloister and was completed on the Feast of the Division of the Apostles, in the year of our Lord 1534.
monastery:
Vadstena Abbey, Bridgettine, Vadstena, Sweden, 1346-
1595

title: Stockholm, Kungliga Biblioteket, A 37; Full manuscript
transcription: MT
translation: Märta Turesdotter
monastery:
Vadstena Abbey, Bridgettine, Vadstena, Sweden, 1346-
1595

title: Stockholm, Kungliga Biblioteket, A 3; Full manuscript
transcription: Thenna bok laeth systher aelseby giordz dotter skriffwa aat conuentenne tha hon war swmma cantrix wppa thz perman som köptis for thz silff baeltet som henna modhersysther hustru cristin biörn nielsons gaff ther til thz war swa goth som xxiiij mark hwilkin bok skriffwen war aff enne conwentz syster som war anno domini m dij i them tima war kaera modher syster anna fickonis war abbatissa gudhi til hedhers oc jdher allom minom kaera systrom til andelikin hugnat.
translation: This book was commissioned by Sister Elseby, the daughter of Gyrd, for the convent when she was serving as the cantor. It was written on parchment purchased with the silver belt gifted by her maternal aunt, Mistress Kristin Björn Nielson, which was valued at 24 marks. This book was written by a sister of the convent in the year of our Lord 1502, during the time when our beloved Mother Sister Anna Fickonis was abbess, to the honor of God and for the spiritual benefit of all my dear sisters.”
monastery:
Vadstena Abbey, Bridgettine, Vadstena, Sweden, 1346-
1595

title: Stockholm, Kungliga Biblioteket, A 4; Full manuscript
transcription: Her lyktas the book som syster kadhrin jöns gummwndzsons dotter oc syster cristin hanssa dotter haffua scriffuat gudhi til hedhers oc jdher allom til hugnadh.
translation: Here ends the book that Sister Katrin, daughter of Jöns Gudmundsson, and Sister Kristin, daughter of Hans, have written to the honor of God and for the benefit of you all.”
monastery:
Vadstena Abbey, Bridgettine, Vadstena, Sweden, 1346-
1595

title: Stockholm, Kungliga Biblioteket, A 8; Full manuscript
transcription: Thaenna firescripna book waende war kaere fadher ok brodher haer mathias laurencii conwaendz brodher j wastztenom aff latino ok j swaensko mz storom kaerlek ok jnnerlikom godh wilia gudhi til hedhers ok jomfru mario ok allom os til hwgnadh ... Bidhin thy kaera systra for honom ... Bidhin ok jaemwael for ware kaere modher syster margarete clawissa dotther abdissa som thenna bokena laet waendha at hon matte triffwas j allo godho swa wael likamlika som andelika.
translation: This aforementioned book was translated by our dear father and brother, Brother Matthias Laurencii, a convent brother at Vadstena, from Latin into Swedish with great love and heartfelt goodwill, to the honor of God, the Virgin Mary, and for the benefit of us all. … Dear sisters, pray for him … And also pray for our dear mother, Sister Margareta Clawisdotter, abbess, who had this book translated, that she may thrive in all goodness, both physical and spiritual.
monastery:
Vadstena Abbey, Bridgettine, Vadstena, Sweden, 1346-
1595

title: Stockholm, Kungliga Biblioteket, A 9; Full manuscript
transcription: AM
translation: Anna Matsdotter Karth
monastery:
Vadstena Abbey, Bridgettine, Vadstena, Sweden, 1346-
1595
